Make not your oaths a deceit between you, lest a foot should slip
			after being firmly planted and ye should taste evil forasmuch as
			ye debarred (men) from the way of Allah, and yours should be an
			awful doom.
And purchase not a small gain at the price of Allah's covenant.\n\t\t\tLo! that which Allah hath is better for you, if ye did but know.
That which ye have wasteth away, and that which Allah hath\n\t\t\tremaineth. And verily We shall pay those who are steadfast a\n\t\t\trecompense in proportion to the best of what they used to do.

Whosoever doeth right, whether male or female, and is a believer,\n\t\t\thim verily We shall quicken with good life, and We shall pay them\n\t\t\ta recompense in proportion to the best of what they used to do.
And when thou recitest the Quran, seek refuge in Allah from Satan\n\t\t\tthe outcast.
Lo! he hath no power over those who believe and put trust in\n\t\t\ttheir Lord.
His power is only over those who make a friend of him, and those\n\t\t\twho ascribe partners unto Him (Allah).
And when We put a revelation in place of (another)\n\t\t\trevelation,--and Allah knoweth best what He revealeth--they say:\n\t\t\tLo! thou art but inventing. Most of them know not.

Say: The holy Spirit hath revealed it from thy Lord with truth,
			that it may confirm (the faith of) those who believe, and as
			guidance and good tidings for those who have surrendered (to
			Allah).
And We know well that they say: Only a man teacheth him. The\n\t\t\tspeech of him at whom they falsely hint is outlandish, and this\n\t\t\tis clear Arabic speech.
Lo! those who disbelieve the revelations of Allah, Allah guideth\n\t\t\tthem not and theirs will be a painful doom.
Only they invent falsehood who believe not Allah's revelations,\n\t\t\tand (only) they are the liars.

Whoso disbelieveth in Allah after his belief save him who is
			forced thereto and whose heart is still content with Faith but
			whoso findeth ease in disbelief: On them is wrath from Allah.
			Theirs will be an awful doom.
That is because they have chosen the life of the world rather\n\t\t\tthan the Hereafter, and because Allah guideth not the\n\t\t\tdisbelieving folk.
Such are they whose hearts and ears and eyes Allah hath sealed.\n\t\t\tAnd such are the heedless.
Assuredly in the Hereafter they are the losers.
Then lo! thy Lord--for those who become fugitives after they had\n\t\t\tbeen persecuted, and then fought and were steadfast--lo! thy Lord\n\t\t\tafterward is (for them) indeed Forgiving, Merciful,
On the Day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and\n\t\t\tevery soul will be repaid what it did, and they will not be\n\t\t\twronged.

Allah coineth a similitude: a township that dwelt secure and well
			content, its provision coming to it in abundance from every side,
			but it disbelieved in Allah's favors, so Allah made it experience
			the garb of dearth and fear because of what they used to do.
And verily there had come unto them a messenger from among them,\n\t\t\tbut they had denied him, and So the torment seized them while\n\t\t\tthey were wrong-doers.
So eat of the lawful and good food which Allah hath provided for\n\t\t\tyou, and thank the bounty of your Lord if it is Him ye serve.

He hath forbidden for you only carrion and blood and swine-flesh
			and that which hath been immolated in the name of any other than
			Allah; but he who is driven thereto, neither craving nor
			transgressing, lo! then Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

And speak not, concerning that which your own tongues qualify (as
			clean or unclean), the falsehood: "This is lawful, and this is
			forbidden," so that ye invent a lie against Allah. Lo! those who
			invent a lie against Allah will not succeed.
A brief enjoyment (will be theirs); and theirs a painful doom.
And unto those who are Jews We have forbidden that which We have\n\t\t\talready related unto thee. And We wronged them not, but they were\n\t\t\twont to wrong themselves.
Then lo! thy Lord for those who do evil in ignorance and\n\t\t\tafterward repent and amend--lo! (for them) thy Lord is afterward\n\t\t\tindeed Forgiving, Merciful.
Lo! Abraham was a nation obedient to Allah, by nature upright,\n\t\t\tand he was not of the idolaters;
Thankful for His bounties; He chose him and He guided him unto a\n\t\t\tstraight path.
And We gave him good in the world, and in the Hereafter he is\n\t\t\tamong the righteous.
And afterward We inspired thee (Muhammad, saying): Follow the\n\t\t\treligion of Abraham, as one by nature upright. He was not of the\n\t\t\tidolaters.
The Sabbath was appointed only for those who differed concerning\n\t\t\tit, and lo! thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection concerning that wherein they used to differ.

Call unto the way of thy Lord with wisdom and fair exhortation,
			and reason with them in the better way. Lo! thy Lord is best
			aware of him who strayeth from His way, and He is Best Aware of
			those who go aright.
If ye punish, then punish with the like of that wherewith ye were\n\t\t\tafflicted. But if ye endure patiently, verily it is better for\n\t\t\tthe patient.
Endure thou patiently (O Muhammad). Thine endurance is only by\n\t\t\t(the help of) Allah. Grieve not for them, and be not in distress\n\t\t\tbecause of that which they devise.
Lo! Allah is with those who keep their duty unto Him and those\n\t\t\twho are doers of good.

Glorified be He Who carried His servant by night from the
			Inviolable Place of Worship to the Far Distant Place of Worship
			the neighborhood whereof We have blessed, that We might show him
			of Our tokens! Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the Seer.
We gave unto Moses the Scripture, and We appointed it a guidance\n\t\t\tfor the Children of Israel, saying: Choose no guardian beside Me.
(They were) the seed of those whom We carried (in the ship) along\n\t\t\twith Noah. Lo! he was a grateful slave.
And We decreed for the Children of Israel in the scripture: Ye\n\t\t\tverily will work corruption in the earth twice, and ye will\n\t\t\tbecome great tyrants.
So when the time for the first of the two came, We roused against\n\t\t\tyou slaves of Ours of great might who ravaged (your) country, and\n\t\t\tit was a threat performed.
Then we gave you once again your turn against them, and We aided\n\t\t\tyou with wealth and children and made you more in soldiery,

(Saying): If ye do good, ye do good for your own souls, and if ye
			do evil, it is for them (in like manner). So, when the time for
			the second (of the judgments) came (We roused against you others
			of Our slaves) to ravage you, and to enter the Temple even as
			they entered it the first time, and to lay waste all that they
			conquered with an utter wasting.
It may be that your Lord will have mercy on you, but if ye repeat\n\t\t\t(the crime) We shall repeat (the punishment), and We have\n\t\t\tappointed hell a dungeon for the disbelievers.
Lo! this Quran guideth unto that which is straightest, and giveth\n\t\t\ttidings unto the believers who do good works that theirs will be\n\t\t\ta great reward.
And that those who believe not in the Hereafter, for them We have\n\t\t\tprepared a painful doom.
Man prayeth for evil as he prayeth for good; for man was ever\n\t\t\thasty.

And we appoint the night and the day two portents. Then We make
			dark the portent of the night, and We make the portent of the day
			sight- giving, that ye may seek bounty from your Lord, and that
			ye may know the computation of the years, and the reckoning; and
			everything have We expounded with a clear expounding.
And every man's augury have We fastened to his own neck, and We\n\t\t\tshall bring forth for him on the Day of Resurrection a book which\n\t\t\the will find wide open.
(And it will be said unto him): Read thy book. Thy soul sufficeth\n\t\t\tas reckoner against thee this day.

Whosoever goeth right, it is only for (the good of) his own soul
			that he goeth right, and whosoever erreth, erreth only to its
			hurt. No laden soul can bear another's load. We never punish
			until We have sent a messenger.

And when We would destroy a township We send commandment to its
			folk who live at ease, and afterward they commit abomination
			therein, and so the Word (of doom) hath effect for it, and We
			annihilate it with complete annihilation.
How many generations have we destroyed since Noah! And Allah\n\t\t\tsufficeth as knower and Beholder of the sins of His slaves.

Whoso desireth that (life) which hasteneth away, We hasten for
			him therein that We will for whom We please. And afterward We
			have appointed for him hell; he will endure the heat thereof,
			condemned, rejected.
And whoso desireth the Hereafter and striveth for it with the\n\t\t\teffort necessary, being a believer; for such, their effort\n\t\t\tfindeth favor (with their Lord).
Each do We supply, both these and those, from the bounty of thy\n\t\t\tLord. And the bounty of thy Lord can never be walled up.
See how We prefer one above another, and verily the Hereafter\n\t\t\twill be greater in degrees and greater in preferment.
Set not up with Allah any other god (O man) lest thou sit down\n\t\t\treproved, forsaken.

Thy Lord hath decreed, that ye worship none save Him, and (that
			ye show) kindness to parents. If one of them or both of them to
			attain old age with thee, say not "Fie" unto them nor repulse
			them, but speak unto them a gracious word.
And lower unto them the wing of submission through mercy, and\n\t\t\tsay: My Lord! Have mercy on them both as they did care for me\n\t\t\twhen I was little.
Your Lord is best aware of what is in your minds. If ye are\n\t\t\trighteous, then lo! He was ever Forgiving unto those who turn\n\t\t\t(unto Him).
Give the kinsman his due, and the needy, and the wayfarer, and\n\t\t\tsquander not (thy wealth) in wantonness.
Lo! the squanderers were ever brothers of the devils, and the\n\t\t\tdevil was ever an ingrate to his Lord.
But if thou turn away from them, seeking mercy from thy Lord, for\n\t\t\twhich thou hopest, then speak unto them a reasonable word.
And let not thy hand be chained to thy neck nor open it with a\n\t\t\tcomplete opening, lest thou sit down rebuked, denuded.
Lo! thy Lord enlargeth the provision for whom He will, and\n\t\t\tstraiteneth (it for whom He will). Lo, He was ever Knower, Seer\n\t\t\tof His slaves.
Slay not your children, fearing a fall to poverty, We shall\n\t\t\tprovide for them and for you. Lo! the slaying of them is great\n\t\t\tsin.
And come not near unto adultery. Lo! it is an abomination and an\n\t\t\tevil way.

And slay not the life which Allah hath forbidden save with right.\n\t\t\tWhoso is slain wrongfully, We have given power unto his heir, but\n\t\t\tlet him not commit excess in slaying. Lo! he will be helped.
Come not near the wealth of the orphan save with that which is\n\t\t\tbetter till he come to strength; and keep the covenant. Lo! of\n\t\t\tthe covenant it will be asked.
Fill the measure when ye measure, and weigh with a right balance;\n\t\t\tthat is meet, and better in the end.
(O man), follow not that whereof thou hast no knowledge. Lo! the\n\t\t\thearing and the sight and the heart--of each of these it will be\n\t\t\tasked.
And walk not in the earth exultant. Lo! thou canst not rend the\n\t\t\tearth, nor canst thou stretch to the height of the hills.
The evil of all that is hateful in the sight of thy Lord.
This is (part) of that wisdom wherewith thy Lord hath inspired\n\t\t\tthee (O Muhammad). And set not up with Allah any other god, lest\n\t\t\tthou be cast into hell, reproved, abandoned.
Hath your Lord then distinguished you (O men of Mecca) by giving\n\t\t\tyou sons, and hath chosen for Himself females from among the\n\t\t\tangels? Lo! verily ye speak an awful word!
We verily have displayed (Our warnings) in this Qur'an that they\n\t\t\tmay take heed, but it increaseth them in naught save aversion.
Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): If there were other gods\n\t\t\talong with Him, as they say, then had they sought a way against\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Throne.
Glorified is He, and High Exalted above what they say!

The seven heavens and the earth and all that is therein praise\n\t\t\tHim, and there is not a thing but hymneth his praise; but ye\n\t\t\tunderstand not their praise. Lo! He is ever Clement, Forgiving.
And when thou recitest the Qu'ran We place between thee and those\n\t\t\twho believe not in the Hereafter a hidden barrier;

And We place upon their hearts veils lest they should understand\n\t\t\tit, and in their ears a deafness; and when thou makest mention of\n\t\t\tthy Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn their backs in aversion.
We are best aware of what they wish to hear when they give ear to\n\t\t\tthee and when they take secret counsel, when the evil doers say:\n\t\t\tYe follow but a man bewitched.
See what similitudes they coin for thee, and thus are all astray,\n\t\t\tand cannot find a road!
And they say: When we are bones and fragments, shall we,\n\t\t\tforsooth, be raised up as a new creation?
Say: Be ye stones or iron

Or some created thing that is yet greater in your thoughts! Then
			they will say: Who shall bring us back (to life)? Say: He who
			created you at the first. Then will they shake their heads at
			thee, and say: When will it be? Say: It will perhaps be soon;
A day when He will call you and ye will answer with His praise,\n\t\t\tand ye will think that ye have tarried but a little while.
Tell My bondmen to speak that which is kindlier. Lo! the devil\n\t\t\tsoweth discord among them. Lo! the devil is for man an open foe.
Your Lord is best aware of you. If He will, He will have mercy on\n\t\t\tyou, or if He will, He will punish you. We have not sent thee (O\n\t\t\tMuhammad) as a warden over them.
And thy Lord is best aware of all who are in the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth. And we preferred some of the Prophets above others, and\n\t\t\tunto David We gave the Psalms.
Say: Cry unto those (saints and angels) whom ye assume (to be\n\t\t\tgods) beside Him, yet they have no power to rid you of misfortune\n\t\t\tnor to change.

Those unto whom they cry seek the way of approach to their Lord,\n\t\t\twhich of them shall be the nearest; they hope for His mercy and\n\t\t\tthey fear His doom. Lo! the doom of thy Lord is to be shunned.
There is not a township but We shall destroy it ere the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection, or punish it with dire punishment. That is set\n\t\t\tforth in the Book (of Our decrees).

Naught hindereth Us from sending portents save that the folk of
			old denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel--a clear
			portent--but they did wrong in respect of her. We send not
			portents save to warn.

And (it was a warning) when We told thee: Lo! thy Lord
			encompasseth mankind, and We appointed the vision which We showed
			thee as an ordeal for mankind, and (likewise) the Accursed Tree
			in the Qur'an. We warn them, but it increaseth them in naught
			save gross impiety.
And when We said unto the angels: Fall down prostrate before Adam\n\t\t\tand they fell prostrate all save Iblis, he said: Shall I fall\n\t\t\tprostrate before that which Thou hast created of clay?
He said: Seest Thou this (creature) whom Thou hast honored above\n\t\t\tme, if Thou give me grace until the Day of Resurrection I verily\n\t\t\twill seize his seed, save but a few.
He said: Go, and whosoever of them followeth thee--lo! Hell will\n\t\t\tbe your payment, ample payment.

And excite any of them whom thou canst with thy voice, and urge
			thy horse and foot against them, and be a partner in their wealth
			and children, and promise them. Satan promiseth them only to
			deceive.
Lo! My (faithful) bondmen--over them thou hast no power,--and thy\n\t\t\tLord sufficeth as (their) guardian.
(O mankind), your Lord is He Who driveth for you the ship upon\n\t\t\tthe sea that ye may seek of His bounty. Lo! He was ever Merciful\n\t\t\ttoward you.
And when harm toucheth you upon the sea, all unto whom ye cry\n\t\t\t(for succour) fail save Him (alone), but when He bringeth you\n\t\t\tsafe to land, ye turn away, for man was ever thankless.
Feel ye then secure that He will not cause a slope of the land to\n\t\t\tengulf you, or send a sandstorm, upon you, and then ye will find\n\t\t\tthat ye have no protector?

Or feel ye secure that He will not return you to that (plight) a
			second time, and send against you a hurricane of wind and drown
			you for your thanklessness, and then ye will not find therein
			that ye have any avenger against Us?

Verily We have honored the children of Adam. We carry them on the
			land and the sea, and have made provision of good things for
			them, and have preferred them above many of those whom We created
			with a marked preferment.
On the day when We shall summon ill men with their record, whoso\n\t\t\tis given his book in his right hand such will read their book and\n\t\t\tthey will not be wronged a shred.
Whoso is blind here wilt be blind in the Hereafter, and yet\n\t\t\tfurther from the road.

And they indeed strove hard to beguile thee (Muhammad) away from
			that wherewith We have inspired thee, that thou shouldst invent
			other than it against Us; and then would they have accepted thee
			as a friend.
And if We had not made thee wholly firm thou mightest almost have\n\t\t\tinclined unto them a little.
Then had We made thee taste a double (punishment) of living and a\n\t\t\tdouble (punishment) of dying, then hadst thou found no helper\n\t\t\tagainst Us.
And they indeed wished to scare thee from the land that they\n\t\t\tmight drive thee forth from thence, and then they would have\n\t\t\tstayed (there) but a little after thee.
(Such was Our) method in the case of those whom We sent before\n\t\t\tthee (to mankind), and thou wilt not find for Our method aught of\n\t\t\tpower to change.
Establish worship at the going down of the sun until the dark of\n\t\t\tnight, and (the recital of) the Qur'an at dawn. Lo! (the recital\n\t\t\tof) the Qur'an at dawn is ever witnessed.
And some part of the night awake for it, a largess for thee. It\n\t\t\tmay be that thy Lord will raise thee to a praised estate.
And say: My Lord! Cause me to come in with a firm incoming and to\n\t\t\tgo out with a firm outgoing. And give me from Thy presence a\n\t\t\tsustaining Power.
And say: Truth hath come and falsehood hath vanished away. Lo!\n\t\t\tfalsehood is ever bound to vanish.
And We reveal of the Qur'an that which is a healing and a mercy\n\t\t\tfor believers though it increase the evil-doers in naught save\n\t\t\truin.
And when We make life pleasant unto man, he turneth away and is\n\t\t\taverse; and when ill toucheth him he is in despair.
Say: Each one doth according to his rule of conduct, and thy Lord\n\t\t\tis best aware of him whose way is right.
They will ask thee concerning the Spirit. Say: The Spirit is by\n\t\t\tcommand of my Lord, and of knowledge ye have been vouchsafed but\n\t\t\tlittle.
And if We willed We could withdraw that which We have revealed\n\t\t\tunto thee, then wouldst thou find no guardian for thee against Us\n\t\t\tin respect thereof.
(It is naught) save mercy from thy Lord. Lo! His kindness unto\n\t\t\tthee was ever great.
Say: Verily, though mankind and the Jinn should assemble to\n\t\t\tproduce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like\n\t\t\tthereof though they were helpers one of another.
And verily We have displayed for mankind in this Qur'an all kinds\n\t\t\tof similitudes, but most of mankind refuse aught save disbelief.
And they say: We will not put faith in thee till thou cause a\n\t\t\tspring to gush forth from the earth for us;
Or thou have a garden of date palms and grapes, and cause rivers\n\t\t\tto gush forth therein abundantly;
Or thou cause the heaven to fall upon us piecemeal, as thou hast\n\t\t\tpretended, or bring Allah and the angels as a warrant;

Thou have a house of gold; or thou ascend up into heaven, and
			even then we will put no faith in thine ascension till thou bring
			down for us a book that we can read. Say (O Muhammad): My Lord be
			glorified! Am I naught save a mortal messenger?
And naught prevented mankind from believing when the guidance\n\t\t\tcame unto them save that they said: Hath Allah sent a mortal as\n\t\t\t(His) messenger?
Say: If there were in the earth angels walking secure, We had\n\t\t\tsent down for them from heaven an angel as messenger.
Say: Allah sufficeth for a witness between me and you Lo! He is\n\t\t\tKnower, Seer of His slaves.

And he whom Allah guideth, he is led aright; while, as for him
			whom He sendeth astray, for them thou wilt find no protecting
			friends beside Him, and We shall assemble them on the Day of
			Resurrection on their faces, blind, dumb and deaf; their
			habitation will be hell; whenever it abateth, We increase the
			flame for them.
That is their reward because they disbelieved Our revelations and\n\t\t\tsaid: When we are bones and fragments shall we, forsooth, be\n\t\t\traised up as a new creation?

Have they not seen that Allah Who created the heavens and the
			earth is Able to create the like of them, and hath appointed for
			them an end whereof there is no doubt? But the wrong-doers refuse
			aught save disbelief.
Say (unto them): If ye possessed the treasures of the mercy of my\n\t\t\tLord, ye would surely hold them back for fear of spending, for\n\t\t\tman was ever grudging.

And verily We gave unto Moses nine tokens, clear proofs (of
			Allah's Sovereignty). Do but ask the Children of Israel how he
			came unto them, then Pharaoh said unto him: Lo! I deem thee one
			bewitched, O Moses.
He said: In truth thou knowest that none sent down these\n\t\t\t(portents) save the Lord of the heavens and the earth as proofs,\n\t\t\tand lo! (for my part) I deem thee lost, O Pharaoh.
And he wished to scare them from the land, but We drowned him and\n\t\t\tthose with him, all together.
And We said unto the Children of Israel after him: Dwell in the\n\t\t\tland; but when the promise of the Hereafter cometh to pass we\n\t\t\tshall bring you as a crowd gathered out of various nations.
With truth have We sent it down, and with truth hath it\n\t\t\tdescended. And We have sent thee as naught else save a bearer of\n\t\t\tgood tidings and a warner.
And (it is) a Quran that We have divided, that thou mayest recite\n\t\t\tit unto mankind at intervals, and We have revealed it by\n\t\t\t(successive) revelation.
Say: Believe therein or believe not, lo! those who were given\n\t\t\tknowledge before it, when it is read unto them, fall down\n\t\t\tprostrate on their faces, adoring,
Saying: Glory to our Lord! Verily the promise of our Lord must be\n\t\t\tfulfilled.
They fall down on their faces, weeping, and it increaseth\n\t\t\thumility in them.

Say (unto mankind): Cry unto Allah, or cry unto the Beneficent,
			unto whichsoever ye cry (it is the same). His are the most
			beautiful names. And thou (Muhammad), be not loud voiced in thy
			worship nor yet silent therein, but follow a way between.

And say: Praise be to Allah, Who hath not taken unto Himself a
			son, and Who hath no partner in the Sovereignty, nor hath He any
			protecting friend through dependence. And magnify Him with all
			magnificence.
Praise be to Allah Who hath revealed the Scripture unto His\n\t\t\tslave, and hath not placed therein any crookedness,
(But hath made it) straight, to give warning of stern punishment\n\t\t\tfrom Him, and to bring unto the believers who do good works the\n\t\t\tnews that theirs will be a fair reward,
Wherein they will abide for ever;
And to warn those who say: Allah hath chosen a son,
(A thing) whereof they have no knowledge, nor (had) thee fathers.\n\t\t\tDreadful is the word that cometh out of their mouths. They speak\n\t\t\tnaught but a lie.
Yet it may be, if they believe not in this statement, that thou\n\t\t\t(Muhammad) wilt torment thy soul with grief over their footsteps.
Lo! We have placed all that is in the earth as an ornament\n\t\t\tthereof that we may try them: which of them is best in conduct.
And lo! We shall make all that is therein a barren mound.
Or deemest thou that the People of the Cave and the Inscription\n\t\t\tare a wonder among Our portents?
When the young men fled for refuge to the Cave and said: Our\n\t\t\tLord! Give us mercy from Thy presence and shape for us right\n\t\t\tconduct in our plight.
Then We sealed up their hearing in the Cave for a number of\n\t\t\tyears.
And afterward We raised them up that We might know which of the\n\t\t\ttwo parties would best calculate the time that they had tarried.
We narrate unto thee their story with truth. Lo! they were young\n\t\t\tmen who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in\n\t\t\tguidance.
And We made firm their hearts when they stood forth and said: Our\n\t\t\tLord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We cry unto no god\n\t\t\tbeside Him, for then should we utter an enormity.
These, our people, have chosen (other) gods beside Him though\n\t\t\tthey bring no clear warrant (vouchsafed) to them. And who doth\n\t\t\tgreater wrong than he who inventeth a lie concerning Allah?

And when ye withdraw from them and that which they worship except
			Allah, then seek refuge in the Cave; your Lord will spread for
			you of His mercy and will prepare for you a pillow in your
			plight.

And thou mightest have seen the sun when it rose move away from
			their cave to the right, and when it set go past them on the
			left, and they were in the cleft thereof. That was (one) of the
			portents of Allah. He whom Allah guideth, he indeed is led
			aright, and he whom He sendeth astray, for him thou wilt not find
			a guiding friend.

And thou wouldst have deemed them waking though they were asleep,
			and we caused them to turn over to the right and the left, and
			their dog stretching out his paws on the threshold. If thou hadst
			observed them closely thou hadst assuredly turned away from them
			in flight, and hadst been filled with awe of them.

And in like manner We awakened them that they might question one
			another. A speaker from among them said : How long have ye
			tarried? They said: We have tarried a day or some part of a day,
			(Other) said: Your Lord best knoweth what ye have tarried. Now
			send one of you with this your silver coin unto the city, and let
			him see what food is purest there and bring you a supply thereof.
			Let him be courteous and let no man know of you.
For they, if they should come to know of you, will stone you or\n\t\t\tturn you back to their religion; then ye will never prosper.

And in like manner We disclosed them (to the people of the city)
			that they might know that the promise of Allah is true, and that,
			as for the Hour, there is no doubt concerning it. When (the
			people of the city) disputed of their case among themselves, they
			said: Build over them a building; their Lord knoweth best
			concerning them. Those who won their point said: We verily shall
			build a place of worship over them.

(Some) will say: They were three, their dog the fourth, and
			(some) say: Five, their dog the sixth, guessing at random; and
			(some) say: Seven, and their dog the eighth. Say (O Muhammad): My
			Lord is best aware of their number. None knoweth them save a few.
			So contend not concerning them except with an outward contending,
			and ask not any of them to pronounce concerning them.
And say not of anything: Lo! I shall do that tomorrow,
Except if Allah will. And remember thy Lord when thou forgettest,\n\t\t\tand say: It may be that my Lord guideth me unto a nearer way of\n\t\t\ttruth than this.
And (it is said) they tarried in their Cave three hundred years\n\t\t\tand add nine.

Say: Allah is best aware how long they tarried. His is the
			Invisible of the heavens and the earth. How clear of sight is He
			and keen of hearing! They have no protecting friend beside Him,
			and He maketh none to share in His government.
And recite that which hath been revealed unto thee of the\n\t\t\tscripture of thy Lord. There is none who can change His words,\n\t\t\tand thou wilt find no refuge beside Him.

Restrain thyself along with those who cry unto their Lord at morn
			and evening, seeking His countenance; and let not thine eyes
			overlook them, desiring the pomp of the life of the world; and
			obey not him whose heart We have made heedless of Our
			remembrance, who followeth his own lust and whose case hath been
			abandoned.

Say: (It is) the truth from the Lord of you (all). Then whosoever
			will, let him believe, and whosoever will, let him disbelieve.
			Lo! We have prepared for disbelievers Fire. Its tent encloseth
			them. If they ask for showers, they will be showered with water
			like to molten lead which burneth the faces. Calamitous the drink
			and ill the resting place!
Lo! as for those who believe and do good works, Lo! We suffer not\n\t\t\tthe reward of one whose work is goodly to be lost.

As for such, theirs will be Gardens of Eden, wherein rivers flow
			beneath them; therein they will be given armlets of gold and will
			wear green robes of finest silk and gold embroidery, reclining
			upon thrones therein. Blest the reward, and fair the resting
			place!
Coin for them a similitude: Two men, unto one of whom We had\n\t\t\tassigned two gardens of grapes, and We had surrounded both with\n\t\t\tdate palms and had put between them tillage.
Each of the gardens gave its fruit and withheld naught thereof.\n\t\t\tAnd We caused a river to gush forth therein.
And he had fruit. And he said unto his comrade, when he spake\n\t\t\twith him: I am more than thee in wealth, and stronger in respect\n\t\t\tof men.
And he went into his garden, while he (thus) wronged himself. He\n\t\t\tsaid: I think not that all this will ever perish.
I think not that the Hour will ever come, and if indeed I am\n\t\t\tbrought back unto my Lord I surely shall find better than this as\n\t\t\ta resort.
And his comrade, while he disputed with him, exclaimed:\n\t\t\tDisbelievest thou in Him Who created thee of dust, then of a drop\n\t\t\t(of seed), and then fashioned thee a man?
But He is Allah, my Lord, and I ascribe unto my Lord no partner.

If only, when thou enteredst thy garden, thou hadst said: That
			which Allah willeth (will come to pass)! There is no strength
			save in Allah! Though thou seest me as less than thee in wealth
			and children.
Yet it may be that my Lord will give me better than thy garden,\n\t\t\tand will send on it a bolt from heaven, and some morning it will\n\t\t\tbe a smooth hillside,
Or some morning the water thereof will he lost in the earth so\n\t\t\tthat thou canst not make search for it.

And his fruit was beset (with destruction). Then began he to
			wring his hands for all that he had spent upon it, when (now) it
			was all ruined on its trellises, and to say: Would that I had
			ascribed no partner to my Lord!
And he had no troop of men to help him as against Allah, nor\n\t\t\tcould he save himself.
In this case is protection only from Allah, the True. He is best\n\t\t\tfor reward, and best for consequence.

And coin for them the similitude of the life of the world as
			water which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the
			earth mingleth with it and then becometh dry twigs that the winds
			scatter. Allah is Able to do all things.
Wealth and children are an ornament of life of the world. But the\n\t\t\tgood deeds which endure are better in thy Lord's sight for\n\t\t\treward, and better in respect of hope.
And (bethink you of) the Day when We remove the hills and ye see\n\t\t\tthe earth emerging, and We gather them together so as to leave\n\t\t\tnot one of them behind.
And they are set before thy Lord in ranks (and it is said unto\n\t\t\tthem): Now verily have ye come unto Us as We created you at the\n\t\t\tfirst. But ye thought that We had set no tryst for you.

And the Book is placed, and thou seest the guilty fearful of that
			which is therein, and they say: What Kind of a book is this that
			leaveth not a small thing nor a great thing but hath counted it!
			And they find all that they did confronting them, and thy Lord
			wrongeth no one.

And (remember) when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate
			before Adam, and they fell prostrate, all save Iblis. He was of
			the Jinn, so he rebelled against his Lord's command. Will ye
			choose him and his seed for your protecting friends instead of
			Me, when they are an enemy unto you? Calamitous is the exchange
			for evil doers!
I made them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth, nor their own creation; nor choose I misleaders for (My)\n\t\t\thelpers.

And (be mindful of) the Day when He will say: Call those partners
			of Mine whom ye pretended. Then they will cry unto them, but they
			will not hear their prayer, and We shall set a gulf of doom
			between them.
And the guilty behold the Fire and know that they are about to\n\t\t\tfall therein, and they find no way of escape thence:
And verily We have displayed for mankind in this Qur'an all\n\t\t\tmanner of similitudes, but man is more than anything contentious.

And naught hindereth mankind from believing when the guidance
			cometh unto them, and from asking for forgiveness of their Lord,
			unless (it be that they wish) that the judgment of the men of old
			should come upon them or (that) they should be confronted with
			the Doom.

We send not the messengers save as bearers of good news and
			warners. Those who disbelieve contend with falsehood in order to
			refute the Truth thereby. And they take Our revelations and that
			wherewith they are threatened as a jest.

And who doth greater wrong than he who hath been reminded of the
			revelations of his Lord, yet turneth away from them and
			forgetteth what his hands send forward (to the Judgment)? Lo! on
			their hearts We have placed coverings so that they understand
			not, and in their ears a deafness. And though thou call them to
			the guidance, in that case they can never be led aright.

Thy Lord is the Forgiver, Full of Mercy. If He took them to task
			(now) for what they earn, He would hasten on the doom for them;
			but their is an appointed term from which they will find no
			escape.
And (all) those townships! We destroyed them when they did wrong,\n\t\t\tand We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.
And when Moses said unto his servant: I will not give up until I\n\t\t\treach the point where the two rivers meet, though I march on for\n\t\t\tages.
And when they reached the point where the two met, they forgot\n\t\t\ttheir fish, and it took its way into the waters, being free.
And when they had gone further, he said unto his servant: Bring\n\t\t\tus our breakfast. Verily we have found fatigue in this our\n\t\t\tjourney.
He said: Didst thou see, when we took refuge on the rock, and I\n\t\t\tforgot the fish and none but Satan caused me to forget to mention\n\t\t\tit, it took its way into the waters by a marvel.
He said: This is that which we have been seeking. So they\n\t\t\tretraced their steps again.
Then found they one of Our slaves, unto whom We had given mercy\n\t\t\tfrom Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our presence.
Moses said unto him: May I follow thee, to the end that thou\n\t\t\tmayst teach me right conduct of that which thou hast been taught?
He said: Lo! thou canst not bear with me.
How canst thou bear with that whereof thou canst not compass any\n\t\t\tknowledge?
He said: Allah willing, thou shalt find me patient and I shall\n\t\t\tnot in aught gainsay thee:
He said: Well, if thou go with me, ask me not concerning aught\n\t\t\ttill I myself mention of it unto thee.

So the twain set out till, when they were in the ship, he made a\n\t\t\thole therein. (Moses) said: Hast thou made a hole therein to\n\t\t\tdrown the folk thereof? Thou verily hast done a dreadful thing.
He said: Did I not tell thee thou couldst not bear with me?
(Moses) said: Be not wroth with me that I forgot, and be not hard\n\t\t\tupon me for my fault.
So the twain journeyed on till, when they met a lad, he slew him.\n\t\t\t(Moses) said: What! Hast thou slain an innocent soul who hath\n\t\t\tslain no man? Verily thou hast done a horrid thing.
He said: Did I not tell thee that thou couldst not bear with me? \n\t\t\t\t `
(Moses) said: If I ask thee after this concerning aught, keep not\n\t\t\tcompany with me. Thou hast received an excuse from me.

So they twain journeyed on till, when they came unto the folk of
			a certain township, they asked its folk for food, but they
			refused to make them guests. And they found therein a wall upon
			the point of falling into ruin, and he repaired it. (Moses) said
			: If thou hadst wished, thou couldst have taken payment for it.
He said: This is the parting between thee and me! I will announce\n\t\t\tunto thee the interpretation of that thou couldst not bear with\n\t\t\tpatience.
As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working on the river,\n\t\t\tand I wished to mar it, for there was a king behind them who is\n\t\t\ttaking every ship by force.
And as for the lad, his parents were believers and We feared lest\n\t\t\the should oppress them by rebellion and disbelief.
And We intended that their Lord should change him for them for\n\t\t\tone better in purity and nearer to mercy.

And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city,
			and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them and their
			father had been righteous, and thy Lord intended that they should
			come to their full strength and should bring forth their treasure
			as a mercy from their Lord; and I did it not upon my own command.
			Such is the interpretation of that wherewith thou couldst not
			bear.
They will ask thee of Dhul-Qarneyn. Say: I shall recite unto you\n\t\t\ta remembrance of him.
Lo! We made him strong in the land and gave unto every thing a\n\t\t\troad.
And he followed a road
Till, when he reached the setting place of the sun, he found it\n\t\t\tsetting in a muddy spring, and found a people thereabout: We\n\t\t\tsaid: O Dhul-Qarneyn! Either punish or show them kindness.
He said: As for him who doeth wrong, we shall punish him, and\n\t\t\tthen he will be brought back unto, his Lord, who will punish him\n\t\t\twith awful punishment!
But as for him who believeth and doeth right, good will be his\n\t\t\treward, and We shall speak unto him a mild command.
Then he followed a road
Till, when he reached the rising place of the sun, he found it\n\t\t\trising on a people for whom We had appointed no helper therefrom.
So (it was). And We knew all concerning him.
Then he followed a road
Till, when he came between the two mountains, he found upon their\n\t\t\thither side a folk that scarce could understand a saying.
They said: O Dhul-Qarneyn! Lo! Gog and Magog are spoiling the\n\t\t\tland. So may we pay thee tribute on condition that thou set a\n\t\t\tbarrier between us and them?
He said: That wherein my Lord hath established me better (than\n\t\t\tyour tribute). Do but help me with strength (of men), I will set\n\t\t\tbetween you and them a bank.
Give me pieces of iron--till, when he had levelled up (the gap)\n\t\t\tbetween the cliffs, he said: Blow!--till, when he had made it a\n\t\t\tfire, he said: Bring me molten copper to pour thereon.
And (Gog and Magog) were not able to surmount, nor could they\n\t\t\tpierce (it).
He said: This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my\n\t\t\tLord cometh to pass, He will lay it low, for the promise of my\n\t\t\tLord is true.
And on that day We shall let some of them surge against others,\n\t\t\tand the Trumpet will be blown. Then We shall gather them together\n\t\t\tin one gathering.
On that day We shall present hell to the disbelievers, plain to\n\t\t\tview,
Those whose eyes were hoodwinked from My reminder, and who could\n\t\t\tnot bear to hear.
Do the disbelievers reckon that they can choose My bondmen as\n\t\t\tprotecting friends beside Me? Lo! We have prepared hell as a\n\t\t\twelcome for the disbelievers.
Say: Shall We inform you who will be the greatest losers by their\n\t\t\tworks?
Those whose effort goeth astray in the life of the world, and yet\n\t\t\tthey reckon that they do good work.
Those are they who disbelieve in the revelations of their Lord\n\t\t\tand in the meeting with Him. Therefore their works are vain, and\n\t\t\ton the Day of Resurrection We assign no weight to them.
That is their reward: hell, because they disbelieved, and made a\n\t\t\tjest of Our revelations and Our messengers.
Lo! those who believe and do good works, theirs are the Gardens\n\t\t\tof Paradise, for welcome,
Wherein they will abide, with no desire to be removed from\n\t\t\tthence.
Say: Though the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, verily\n\t\t\tthe sea would be used up before the Words of my Lord were\n\t\t\texhausted, even though We brought the like thereof to help.

Say: I am only a mortal like you. My Lord inspireth in me that
			your God is only One God. And whoever hopeth for the meeting with
			his Lord, let him do righteous work, and make none sharer of the
			worship due unto his Lord.
Kaf. Ha. Ya. Ain. Sad.
A mention of the mercy of thy Lord unto His servant Zachariah.
When he cried unto his Lord a cry in secret,
Saying: My Lord! Lo! the bones of me wax feeble and my head is\n\t\t\tshining with grey hair, and I have never been unblest in prayer\n\t\t\tto Thee, my Lord.
Lo! I fear my kinsfolk after me, since my wife is barren. Oh,\n\t\t\tgive me from Thy presence a successor
Who shall inherit of me and inherit (also) of the house of Jacob.\n\t\t\tAnd make him, my Lord, acceptable ( unto Thee).
(It was said unto him): O Zachariah! Lo! We bring thee tidings of\n\t\t\ta son whose name is John; We have given the same name to none\n\t\t\tbefore (him).
He said: My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife is barren and\n\t\t\tI have reached infirm old age?
He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me, even\n\t\t\tas I created thee before, when thou wast naught.
He said: My Lord! Appoint for me some token. He said: Thy token\n\t\t\tis that thou, with no bodily defect, shalt not speak unto mankind\n\t\t\tthree nights.
Then he came forth unto his people from the sanctuary, and\n\t\t\tsignified to them: Glorify your Lord at break of day and fall of\n\t\t\tnight.
(And it was said unto his son): O John! Hold the Scripture. And\n\t\t\tWe gave him wisdom when a child.
And compassion from Our presence, and purity; and he was devout,
And dutiful toward his parents. And he was not arrogant,\n\t\t\trebellious.
Peace on him the day be was born, and the day he dieth and the\n\t\t\tday he shall be raised alive!
And make mention of Mary in the Scripture, when she had withdrawn\n\t\t\tfrom her people to a chamber looking East,
And had chosen seclusion from them. Then We sent unto her Our\n\t\t\tspirit and it assumed for her the likeness of a perfect man.
She said: Lo! I seek refuge in the Beneficent One from thee, if\n\t\t\tthou art God fearing.
He said: I am only a messenger of thy Lord, that I may bestow on\n\t\t\tthee a faultless son.
She said: How can I have a son when no mortal hath touched me,\n\t\t\tneither have I been unchaste!
He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord saith: It is easy for Me. And\n\t\t\t(it will be) that We may make of him a revelation for mankind and\n\t\t\ta mercy from Us, and it is a thing ordained.
And she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a place.
And the pangs of childbirth drove her unto the trunk of the palm\n\t\t\ttree. She said: Oh, would that I had died ere this and had become\n\t\t\ta thing of naught, forgotten!
Then (one) cried unto her from below her, saying: Grieve not! Thy\n\t\t\tLord hath placed a rivulet beneath thee,
And shake the trunk of the palm tree toward thee, thou wilt cause\n\t\t\tripe dates to fall upon thee.
So eat and drink and be consoled. And if thou meetest any mortal,\n\t\t\tsay: Lo! I have vowed a fast unto the Beneficent, and may not\n\t\t\tspeak this day to any mortal.
Then she brought him to her own folk, carrying him. They said: O\n\t\t\tMary! Thou hast come with an amazing thing.
Oh sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a wicked man nor was thy\n\t\t\tmother a harlot.
Then she pointed to him. They said How can we talk to one who is\n\t\t\tin the cradle, a young boy?
He spake: Lo! I am the slave of Allah. He hath given me the\n\t\t\tScripture and hath appointed me a Prophet,
And hath made me blessed wheresoever I may be, and hath enjoined\n\t\t\tupon me prayer and almsgiving so long as I remain alive,
And (hath made me) dutiful toward her who bore me, and hath not\n\t\t\tmade me arrogant, unblest.
Peace on me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I\n\t\t\tshall be raised alive!
Such was Jesus, son of Mary: (this is) a statement of the truth\n\t\t\tconcerning which they doubt.
It befitteth not (the Majesty of) Allah that He should take unto\n\t\t\tHimself a son. Glory be to Him! When He decreeth a thing, He\n\t\t\tsaith unto it only: Be! and it is.
And lo! Allah is my Lord and your Lord. So serve Him. That is the\n\t\t\tright path.
The sects among them differ: but woe unto the disbelievers from\n\t\t\tthe meeting of an awful Day.
See and hear them on the Day they come unto Us! Yet the\n\t\t\tevil-doers are today in error manifest.
And warn them of the Day of anguish when the case hath been\n\t\t\tdecided. Now they are in a state of carelessness, and they\n\t\t\tbelieve not.
Lo! We inherit the earth and all who are thereon, and unto Us\n\t\t\tthey are returned.
And make mention (O Muhammad) in the Scripture of Abraham. Lo! he\n\t\t\twas a saint, a Prophet.
When he said unto his father: O my father! Why worshippest thou\n\t\t\tthat which heareth not nor seeth, nor can in aught avail thee?
O my father! Lo! there hath come unto me of knowledge that which\n\t\t\tcame not unto thee. So follow me, and I will lead thee on a right\n\t\t\tpath.
O my father! Serve not the devil. Lo! the devil is a rebel unto\n\t\t\tthe Beneficent.
O my father! Lo! I fear lest a punishment from the Beneficent\n\t\t\tovertake thee so that thou become a comrade of the devil.
He said: Rejectest thou my gods, O Abraham? If thou cease not, I\n\t\t\tshall surely stone thee. Depart from me a long while!
He said: Peace be unto thee! I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord\n\t\t\tfor thee. Lo! He was ever gracious unto me.
I shall withdraw from you and that unto which ye pray beside\n\t\t\tAllah, and I shall pray unto my Lord. It may be that, in prayer\n\t\t\tunto my Lord, I shall not be unblest.
So, when he had withdrawn from them and that which they were\n\t\t\tworshipping beside Allah. We gave him Isaac and Jacob. Each of\n\t\t\tthem We made a Prophet.
And We gave them of Our mercy, and assigned to them a high and\n\t\t\ttrue renown.
And make mention in the Scripture of Moses. Lo! he was chosen,\n\t\t\tand he was a messenger (of Allah), a Prophet.
We called him from the right slope of the Mount, and brought him\n\t\t\tnigh in communion.
And We bestowed upon him of Our mercy his brother Aaron, a\n\t\t\tProphet (likewise).
And make mention in the Scripture of Ishmael. Lo! he was a keeper\n\t\t\tof his promise, and he was a messenger (of Allah) a Prophet.
He enjoined upon his people worship and almsgiving, and was\n\t\t\tacceptable in the sight of his Lord.
And make mention in the Scripture of Idris. Lo! he was a saint, a\n\t\t\tProphet;
And We raised him to high station.

These are they unto whom Allah showed favor from among the
			Prophets, of the seed of Adam and of those whom We carried (in
			the ship) with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and
			from among those whom We guided and chose. When the revelations
			of the Beneficent were recited unto them, they fell down, adoring
			and weeping.
Now there hath succeeded them a later generation who have ruined\n\t\t\tworship and have followed lusts. But they will meet deception.
Save him who shall repent and believe and do right. Such will\n\t\t\tenter the Garden and they will not be wronged in aught.
Gardens of Eden, which the Beneficent hath promised to His slaves\n\t\t\tin the Unseen. Lo! His promise is ever sure of fulfillment--
They hear therein no idle talk, but only Peace! and therein they\n\t\t\thave food for morn and evening.
Such is the Garden which We cause the devout among Our bondmen to\n\t\t\tinherit.

We (angels) come not down save by commandment of thy Lord. Unto\n\t\t\tHim belongeth all that is before us and all that is behind us and\n\t\t\tall that is between those two, and thy Lord was never forgetful

Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them!
			Therefor, worship thou Him and be thou steadfast in His service.
			Knowest thou one that can be named along with Him?   66.      
			And man saith: When I am dead, shall I forsooth be brought forth
			alive?
Man says: "What! when I am dead shall I then be raised up alive?"
Doth not man remember that We created him before, when he was\n\t\t\tnaught?
And, by thy Lord, verily We shall assemble them and the devils,\n\t\t\tthen We shall bring them, crouching, around hell.
Then We shall pluck out from every sect whichever of them was\n\t\t\tmost stern in rebellion to the Beneficent.
And surely We are best aware of those most worthy to be burned\n\t\t\ttherein.
There is not one of you but shall approach it. That is a fixed\n\t\t\tordinance of thy Lord.
Then We shall rescue those who kept from evil, and leave the\n\t\t\tevil-doers crouching there.

And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them those who
			disbelieve say unto those who believe: Which of the two parties
			(yours or ours) is better in position, and more imposing as an
			army?
How many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were\n\t\t\tmore imposing in respect of gear and outward seeming!

Say: As for him who is in error, the Beneficent will verily
			prolong his span of life until, when they behold that which they
			were promised, whether it be punishment (in the world), or Hour
			(of Doom), they will know who is worse in position and who is
			weaker as an army.
Allah increaseth in right guidance those who walk aright, and the\n\t\t\tgood deeds which endure are better in thy Lord's sight for\n\t\t\treward, and better for resort.
Hast thou seen him who disbelieveth in Our revelations and saith:\n\t\t\tAssuredly I shall be given wealth and children!
Hath he perused the Unseen, or hath he made a pact with the\n\t\t\tBeneficent?
Nay, but We shall record that which he saith and prolong for him\n\t\t\ta span of torment.
And We shall inherit from him that whereof he spake, and he will\n\t\t\tcome unto Us, alone (without his wealth and children).
And they have chosen (other) gods beside Allah that they may be a\n\t\t\tpower for them.
Nay, but they will deny their worship of them, and become\n\t\t\topponents unto them.
Seest thou not that We have set the devils on the disbelievers to\n\t\t\tconfound them with confusion?
So make no haste against them (O Muhammad). We do but number unto\n\t\t\tthem a sum (of days).
On the Day when We shall gather the righteous unto the\n\t\t\tBeneficent, a goodly company.
And drive the guilty unto Hell, a weary herd,
They will have no power of intercession, save him who hath made a\n\t\t\tcovenant with his Lord.
And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son.
Assuredly ye utter a disastrous thing,
Whereby almost the heavens are torn, and the earth is split\n\t\t\tasunder and the mountains fall in ruins,
That ye ascribe unto the Beneficent a son,
When it is not meet for (the Majesty of) the Beneficent that He\n\t\t\tshould choose a son.
There is none in the heavens and the earth but cometh unto the\n\t\t\tBeneficent as a slave.
Verily He knoweth them and numbereth them with (right) numbering.
And each one of them will come unto Him on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection, alone.
Lo! those who believe and do good works, the Beneficent will\n\t\t\tappoint for them love.
And We make (this Scripture) easy in thy tongue, (O Muhammad)\n\t\t\tonly that thou mayst bear good tidings therewith unto those who\n\t\t\tward off (evil), and warn therewith the froward folk.
And how many a generation before them have We destroyed! Canst\n\t\t\tthou (Muhammad) see a single man of them, or hear from them the\n\t\t\tslightest sound?
Ta. Ha.
We have not revealed unto thee (Muhammad) this Qur'an that thou\n\t\t\tshouldst be distressed,
But as a reminder unto him who feareth,
A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens,
The Beneficent One, Who is established on the Throne
Unto Him belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is\n\t\t\tin the earth, and whatsoever is between them, and whatsoever is\n\t\t\tbeneath the sod.
And if thou speakest aloud, then Lo! He knoweth the secret\n\t\t\t(thought) and (that which is yet) more hidden.
Allah! There is no God save Him. His are the most beautiful\n\t\t\tnames.
Hath there come unto thee the story of Moses?
When he saw a fire and said unto his folk: Wait! I see a fire\n\t\t\tafar off. Peradventure I may bring you a brand therefrom or may\n\t\t\tfind guidance at the fire.
And when he reached it, he was called by name: O Moses!
Lo! I, even I, am thy Lord. So take off thy shoes, for Lo! thou\n\t\t\tart in the holy valley of Tuwa.
And I have chosen thee, so hearken unto that which is inspired.
Lo! I, even I, am Allah. There is no God save Me. So serve Me and\n\t\t\testablish worship for My remembrance.
Lo! the Hour is surely coming. But I will to keep it hidden, that\n\t\t\tevery soul may be rewarded for that which it striveth (to\n\t\t\tachieve).
Therefor, let not him turn thee aside from (the thought of) it\n\t\t\twho believeth not therein but followeth his own desire, lest thou\n\t\t\tperish.
And what is that in thy right hand, O Moses?
He said: This is my staff whereon I lean, and wherewith I beat\n\t\t\tdown branches for my sheep, and wherein I find other uses.
He said: Cast it down, O Moses!
So he cast it down, and Lo! it was a serpent, gliding.
He said: Grasp it and fear not. We shall return it to its former\n\t\t\tstate.
And thrust thy hand within thine armpit, it will come forth white\n\t\t\twithout hurt. (That will be) another token.
That We may show thee (some) of Our greater portents,
Go thou unto Pharaoh! Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds).
(Moses) said: My Lord! Relieve my mind
And ease my task for me;
And loose a knot from my tongue,
That they may understand my saying.
Appoint for me a henchman from my folk,
Aaron, my brother.
Confirm my strength with him.
And let him share my task,
That we may glorify Thee much.
And much remember Thee.
Lo! Thou art ever Seeing us.
He said: Thou art granted thy request, O Moses.
And indeed, another time, already We have shown thee favor,
When We inspired in thy mother that which is inspired,

Saying: Throw him into the ark, and throw it into the river, then
			the river shall throw it on to the bank, and there an enemy to Me
			and an enemy to him shall take him. And I endued thee with love
			from Me that thou mightest be trained according to My will,

When thy sister went and said: Shall I show you one who will
			nurse him? and We restored thee to thy mother that her eyes might
			be refreshed and might not sorrow. And thou didst kill a man and
			We delivered thee from great distress, and tried thee with a
			heavy trial. And thou didst tarry years among the folk of Midian.
			Then comest thou (hither) by (My) providence, O Moses,
And I have attached thee to Myself.
Go, thou and thy brother, with My tokens, and be not faint in\n\t\t\tremembrance of Me.
Go, both of you, unto Pharaoh. Lo! he hath transgressed (the\n\t\t\tbounds).
And speak unto him a gentle word, that peradventure he may heed\n\t\t\tor fear.
They said: Our Lord! Lo! we fear that he may be beforehand with\n\t\t\tus or that he may play the tyrant.
He said: Fear not. Lo! I am with you twain, Hearing and Seeing.

So go ye unto him and say: Lo! we are two messengers of thy Lord.
			So let the Children of Israel go with us, and torment them not.
			We bring thee a token from thy Lord And peace will be for him who
			followeth right guidance.
Lo! it hath been revealed unto us that the doom will be for him\n\t\t\twho denieth and turneth away.
(Pharaoh) said: Who then is the Lord of you twain, O Moses?
He said: Our Lord is He Who gave unto evening its nature, then\n\t\t\tguided it aright.
He said : What then is the state of the generations of old?
He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a Record. My\n\t\t\tLord neither erreth nor forgetteth,
Who hath appointed the earth as a bed and hath threaded roads for\n\t\t\tyou therein and hath sent down water from the sky and thereby We\n\t\t\thave brought forth divers kinds of vegetation,
(Saying): Eat ye and feed your cattle. Lo! herein verily are\n\t\t\tportents for men of thought.
Thereof We created you, and thereunto we return you and thence We\n\t\t\tbring you forth a second time.
And We verily did show him all Our tokens, but he denied them and\n\t\t\trefused.
He said: Hast come to drive us out from our land by thy magic, O\n\t\t\tMoses?
But we surely can produce magic the like thereof; so appoint a\n\t\t\ttryst between us and you, which neither we nor thou shall fail to\n\t\t\tkeep, at a place convenient (to us both).
(Moses) said: Your tryst shall be the day of the feast, and let\n\t\t\tthe people assemble when the sun hath risen high.
Then Pharaoh went and gathered his strength, then came (to the\n\t\t\tappointed tryst).
Moses said unto them: Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against\n\t\t\tAllah, lest He extirpate you by some punishment. He who lieth\n\t\t\tfaileth miserably.
Then they debated one with another what they must do, and they\n\t\t\tkept their counsel secret.
They said: Lo! these are two wizards who would drive you out from\n\t\t\tyour country by their magic, and destroy your best traditions;
So arrange your plan, and come in battle line. Whoso is uppermost\n\t\t\tthis day will be indeed successful.
They said: O Moses! Either throw first, or let us be the first to\n\t\t\tthrow?
He said: Nay, do ye throw! Then Lo! their cords and their staves,\n\t\t\tby their magic, appeared to him as though they ran.
And Moses conceived a fear in his mind
We said: Fear not! Lo! thou art the higher.

Throw that which is in thy right hand! It will eat up that which
			they have made. Lo! that which they have made but a wizards
			artifice, and a wizard shall not be successful to whatever point
			(of skill) he may attain.
Then the wizards were (all) flung down prostrate, crying: We\n\t\t\tbelieve in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.

(Pharaoh) said: Ye put faith in him before I give you leave. Lo!
			he is your chief who taught you magic. Now surely I shall cut off
			your hands and your feet alternately, and I shall crucify you on
			the trunks of palm trees, and ye shall know for certain which of
			us hath sterner and more lasting punishment.

They said: We choose thee not above the clear proofs that have\n\t\t\tcome unto us, and above Him Who created us. So decree what thou\n\t\t\twilt decree. Thou wilt end for us only the life of the world.
Lo! we believe in our Lord, that He may forgive us our sins and\n\t\t\tthe magic unto which thou didst force us. Allah is better and\n\t\t\tmore lasting.
Lo! whoso cometh guilty unto his Lord, verily for him is hell.\n\t\t\tThere he will neither die nor live.
But whoso cometh unto Him a believer, having done good works, for\n\t\t\tsuch are the high stations;
Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will\n\t\t\tabide for ever. That is the reward of him who groweth.
And verily We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by\n\t\t\tnight and strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not to\n\t\t\tbe overtaken, neither being afraid (of the sea).
Then Pharaoh followed with his hosts and there covered them that\n\t\t\twhich did cover them of the sea.
And Pharaoh led his folk astray, he did not guide them.
O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and We\n\t\t\tmade a covenant with you on the holy mountain's side, and sent\n\t\t\tdown on you the manna and the quails,
(Saying): Eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you,\n\t\t\tand transgress not in respect thereof lest My wrath come upon\n\t\t\tyou; and he on whom My wrath cometh, he is lost indeed.
And lo! verily I am Forgiving toward him who repenteth and\n\t\t\tbelieveth and doeth good, and afterward walketh aright.
And (it was said): What hath made thee hasten from thy folk, O\n\t\t\tMoses?
He said: They are close upon my track. I hastened unto Thee that\n\t\t\tThou mightest be well pleased.
He said: Lo! We have tried thy folk in thine absence, and\n\t\t\tAs-Samiri hath misled them.

Then Moses went back unto his folk, angry and sad. He said: O my
			people! Hath not your Lord promised you a fair promise? Did the
			time appointed then appear too long for you, or did ye wish that
			wrath from your Lord should come upon you, that ye broke tryst
			with me?
They said: We broke not tryst with thee of our own will, but we\n\t\t\twere laden with burdens of ornaments of the folk, then cast them\n\t\t\t(in the fire), for thus As-Samiri proposed;
Then he produced for them a calf, of saffron hue, which gave\n\t\t\tforth a lowing sound. And they cried: This is your God and the\n\t\t\tGod of Moses, but he hath forgotten.
See they not, then, that it returneth no saying unto them and\n\t\t\tpossesseth for them neither hurt nor use?
And Aaron indeed had told them beforehand: O my people! Ye are\n\t\t\tbut being seduced therewith, for lo! your Lord is the Beneficent,\n\t\t\tso follow me and obey my order.
They said: We shall by no means cease to be its votaries till\n\t\t\tMoses return unto us.
He (Moses) said: O Aaron! What held thee back when thou didst see\n\t\t\tthem gone astray,
That thou followedst me not? Hast thou then disobeyed my order?
He said: O son of my mother! Clutch not my beard nor my head! I\n\t\t\tfeared lest thou shouldst say: Thou hast caused division among\n\t\t\tthe Children of Israel, and hast not waited for my word.
(Moses) said: And what has thou to say, O Samiri?
He said: I perceived what they perceive not, so I seized a\n\t\t\thandful from the footsteps of the messenger, and then threw it\n\t\t\tin. Thus my soul commended to me.

(Moses) said: Then go! And lo! in this life it is for thee to
			say: Touch me not! and lo! there is for thee a tryst thou canst
			not break. Now look upon thy god of which thou hast remained a
			votary. Verily we will burn it and will scatter its dust over the
			sea.
Your God is only Allah, than Whom there is no other God He\n\t\t\tembraceth all things in His knowledge.
Thus relate Who unto thee (Muhammad) some tidings of that which\n\t\t\thappened of old, and We have given thee from Our presence a\n\t\t\tReminder.
Whoso turneth away from it, he verily will bear a burden on the\n\t\t\tDay of Resurrection,
Abiding under it an evil burden for them on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection,
The day when the Trumpet is blown. On that day we assemble the\n\t\t\tguilty white eyed (with terror),
Murmuring among themselves: Ye have tarried but ten (days).
We are best aware of what they utter when their best in conduct\n\t\t\tsay: Ye have tarried but a day.
They will ask thee of the mountains (on that day). Say: My Lord\n\t\t\twill break them into scattered dust.
And leave it as an empty plain,
Wherein thou seest neither curve nor ruggedness.
On that day they follow the summoner who deceiveth not, and\n\t\t\tvoices are hushed for the Beneficent, and thou hearest but a\n\t\t\tfaint murmur.
On that Day no intercession availeth save (that of) him unto whom\n\t\t\tthe Beneficent hath given leave and whose He accepteth:
He knoweth (all) that is before them and (all) that is behind\n\t\t\tthem, while they cannot compass it in knowledge.
And faces humble themselves before the Living, the Eternal. And\n\t\t\the who beareth (a burden of) wrongdoing is indeed a failure (on\n\t\t\tthat Day).
And he who hath done some good works, being a believer, he\n\t\t\tfeareth not injustice nor begrudging (of his wage).
Thus We have revealed it as a Lecture in Arabic, and have\n\t\t\tdisplayed therein certain threats, that peradventure they may\n\t\t\tkeep from evil or that it may cause them to take heed.
Then exalted be Allah, the True King! And hasten not (O Muhammad)\n\t\t\twith the Quran ere its revelation hath been perfected unto thee,\n\t\t\tand say: My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.
And verily We made a covenant of old with Adam, but he forgot,\n\t\t\tand We found no constancy in him.
And when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam,\n\t\t\tthey fell prostrate (all) save Iblis; he refused.
Therefor We said: O Adam! This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy\n\t\t\twife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that\n\t\t\tthou come to toil.
It is (vouchsafed) unto thee that thou hungerest not therein nor\n\t\t\tart naked,
And thou thirstest not therein nor art exposed to the sun's heat.
But the Devil whispered to him, saying: O Adam! Shall I show thee\n\t\t\tthe tree of immortality and power that wasteth not away?

Then they twain ate thereof, so that their shame became apparent
			unto them, and they began to hide by heaping on themselves some
			of the leaves of the Garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord, so went
			astray.
Then his Lord chose him, and relented toward him, and guided him.

He said: Go down hence, both of you, one of you a foe unto the\n\t\t\tother. But if there come unto you from Me a guidance, then whoso\n\t\t\tfolloweth My guidance, he will not go astray nor come to grief.
But he who turneth away from remembrance of Me, his will be a\n\t\t\tnarrow life, and I shall bring him blind to the assembly on the\n\t\t\tDay of Resurrection.
He will say: My Lord! Wherefore hast Thou gathered me (hither)\n\t\t\tblind, when I was wont to see?
He will say: So (it must be). Our revelations came unto thee but\n\t\t\tthou didst forget them. In like manner thou art forgotten this\n\t\t\tDay.
Thus do We reward him who is prodigal and believeth not the\n\t\t\trevelations of his Lord; and verily the doom of the Hereafter\n\t\t\twill be sterner and more lasting.
Is it not a guidance for them (to know) how many a generation We\n\t\t\tdestroyed before them, amid whose dwellings they walk? Lo!\n\t\t\ttherein verily are signs for men of thought.
And but for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Lord,\n\t\t\tand a term already fixed, the judgment would (have) been\n\t\t\tinevitable (in this world).

Therefor (O Muhammad), bear with what they say, and celebrate the
			praises of thy Lord ere the rising of the sun and ere the going
			down thereof. And glorify Him some hours of the night and at the
			two ends of the day, that thou mayst find acceptance.

And strain not thine eyes toward that which We cause some wedded
			pairs among them to enjoy, the flower of the life of the world,
			that We may try them thereby. The provision of thy Lord is better
			and more lasting.
And enjoin upon thy people worship, and be constant therein. We\n\t\t\task not of thee a provision: We provide for thee. And the sequel\n\t\t\tis for righteousness.
And they say: If only he would bring us a miracle from his Lord!\n\t\t\tHath there not come unto them the proof of what is in the former\n\t\t\tScriptures?

And if We had destroyed them with some punishment before it, they
			would assuredly have said: Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent unto
			us a messenger, so that we might have followed Thy revelations
			before we were (thus) humbled and disgraced!
Say: Each is awaiting; so await ye! Ye will come to know who are\n\t\t\tthe owners of the path of equity, and who is right.
Their reckoning draweth nigh for mankind, while they turn away in\n\t\t\theedlessness.
Never cometh there unto them a new reminder from their Lord but\n\t\t\tthey listen to it while they play.
With hearts preoccupied. And they confer in secret The\n\t\t\twrong-doers say: Is this other than a mortal like you? Will ye\n\t\t\tthen succumb to magic when ye see (it)?
He saith: My Lord knoweth what is spoken in the heaven and the\n\t\t\tearth. He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Nay, say they, (these are but) muddled dreams; nay, he hath but
			invented it; nay, he is but a poet. Let him bring us a portent
			even as those of old (who were God's messengers) were sent (with
			portents).
Not a township believed of those which We destroyed before them\n\t\t\t(though We sent them portents): would they then believe?
And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men\n\t\t\twhom We inspired. Ask the followers of the Reminder if ye know\n\t\t\tnot?
We gave them not bodies that would not eat food, nor were they\n\t\t\timmortals.
Then We fulfilled the promise unto them. So We delivered them and\n\t\t\twhom We would, and We destroyed the prodigals.
Now We have revealed unto you a Scripture wherein is your\n\t\t\tReminder. Have ye then no sense?
How many a community that dealt unjustly have We shattered, and\n\t\t\traised up after them another folk!
And, when they felt Our might, behold them fleeing from it!
(But it was said unto them): Flee not, but return to that\n\t\t\t(existence) which emasculated you and to your dwellings, that ye\n\t\t\tmay be questioned.
They cried: Alas for us! Lo! we were wrongdoers.
And this their crying ceased not till We made them as reaped\n\t\t\tcorn, extinct.
We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between\n\t\t\tthem in play.
If We had wished to find a pastime, We could have found it in Our\n\t\t\tpresence if We ever did.
Nay, but We hurl the true against the false, and it doth break\n\t\t\tits head and lo! it vanisheth. And yours will be woe for that\n\t\t\twhich ye ascribe (unto Him).
Unto Him belongeth whosoever is in the heavens and the earth. And\n\t\t\tthose who dwell in His presence are not too proud to worship Him\n\t\t\tnor do they weary;
They glorify (Him) night and day; they flag not.
Or have they chosen Gods from the earth who raise the dead?

If there were therein Gods beside Allah, then verily both (the\n\t\t\theavens and the earth) had been disordered. Glorified be Allah,\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Throne, from all that they ascribe (unto Him).
He will not be questioned as to that which He doeth, but they\n\t\t\twill be questioned.

Or have they chosen other gods beside Him? Say: Bring your proof
			(of their godhead). This is the Reminder of those with me and
			those before me, but most of them know not the Truth and so they
			are averse.
And We sent no messenger before thee but We inspired him,\n\t\t\t(saying): There is no God save Me (Allah), so worship Me.
And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son. Be He\n\t\t\tglorified! Nay, but (those whom they call sons) are honored\n\t\t\tslaves;
They speak not until He hath spoken, and they act by His command.
He knoweth what is before them and what is behind them, and they\n\t\t\tcannot intercede except for him whom He accepteth, and they quake\n\t\t\tfor awe of Him.
And one of them who should say: Lo! I am a God beside Him, that\n\t\t\tone We should repay with hell. Thus We repay wrong-doers.
Have not those who disbelieve known that the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth were of one piece, then We parted them, and We made every\n\t\t\tliving thing of water? Will they not then believe?
And We have placed in the earth firm hills lest it quake with\n\t\t\tthem, and We have placed therein ravines as roads that haply they\n\t\t\tmay find their way.
And We have made the sky a roof withheld (from them). Yet they\n\t\t\tturn away from its portents.
And He it is Who created the night and the day, and the sun and\n\t\t\tthe moon. They float, each in an orbit.
We appointed immortality for no mortal before thee. What! if thou\n\t\t\tdiest, can they be immortal?
Every soul must taste of death, and We try you with evil and with\n\t\t\tgood, for ordeal. And unto Us ye will be returned.
And when those who disbelieve behold thee, they but choose thee\n\t\t\tout for mockery, (saying): Is this he who maketh mention of your\n\t\t\tgods? And they would deny all mention of the Beneficent.
Man is made of haste. I shall show you My portents, but ask Me\n\t\t\tnot to hasten.
And they say: When will this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are\n\t\t\ttruthful?
If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not be\n\t\t\table to drive off the fire from their faces and from their backs,\n\t\t\tand they will not be helped!
Nay, but it will come upon them unawares so that it will stupefy\n\t\t\tthem, and they will be unable to repel it, neither will they be\n\t\t\treprieved.
Messengers before thee, indeed, were mocked, but that whereat\n\t\t\tthey mocked surrounded those who scoffed at them.
Say: Who guardeth you in the night or in the day from the\n\t\t\tBeneficent? Nay, but they turn away from mention of their Lord,
Or have they gods who can shield them from Us? They cannot help\n\t\t\tthemselves nor can they be defended from Us.
Nay, but We gave these and their fathers ease until life grew\n\t\t\tlong for them. See they not how we visit the land, reducing it of\n\t\t\tits outlying parts? Can they then be the victors?
Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I warn you only by the\n\t\t\tInspiration. But the deaf hear not the call when they are warned.
And if a breath of thy Lord's punishment were to touch them, they\n\t\t\tassuredly would say: Alas for us! Lo! we were wrong-doers.

And We set a just balance for the Day of Resurrection so that no\n\t\t\tsoul is wronged in aught. Though it be of the weight of a grain\n\t\t\tof mustard seed, We bring it. And We suffice for reckoners.
And We verily gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion (of right and\n\t\t\twrong) and a light and a Reminder for those who keep from evil--
Those who fear their Lord in secret and who dread the Hour (of\n\t\t\tdoom).
This is a blessed Reminder that We have revealed: Will ye then\n\t\t\treject it?
And We verily gave Abraham of old his proper course, and We were\n\t\t\tAware of him,
When he said unto his father and his folk: What are these images\n\t\t\tunto which ye pay devotion?
They said: We found our fathers worshippers of them.
He said: Verily ye and your fathers were in plain error.
They said: Bringest thou unto us the truth, or art thou some\n\t\t\tjester?
He said: Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth, Who created them; and I am of those who testify unto that.
And, by Allah, I shall circumvent your idols after ye have gone\n\t\t\taway and turned your backs.
Then he reduced them to fragments, all save the chief of them,\n\t\t\tthat haply they might have recourse to it.
They said: Who hath done this to our gods? Surely it must be some\n\t\t\tevil-doer.
They said: We heard a youth make mention of them, who is called\n\t\t\tAbraham.
They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes that\n\t\t\tthey may testify.
They said: Is it thou who hast done this to our gods, O Abraham?
He said: But this, their chief hath done it. So question them, if\n\t\t\tthey can speak.
Then gathered they apart and said: Lo! ye yourselves are the\n\t\t\twrong doers.
And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou\n\t\t\tknowest that these speak not.
He said: Worship ye then instead of Allah that which cannot\n\t\t\tprofit you at all, nor harm you?
Fie on you and all that ye worship instead of Allah! Have ye then\n\t\t\tno sense?
They cried: Burn him and stand by your gods, if ye will be doing.
We said: O fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham.
And they wished to set a snare for him, but We made them the\n\t\t\tgreater losers.
And We rescued him and Lot (and brought them) to the land which\n\t\t\tWe have blessed for (all) peoples.
And We bestowed upon him Isaac, and Jacob as a grandson. Each of\n\t\t\tthem We made righteous.

And We made them chiefs who guide by Our command, and We inspired
			in them the doing of good deeds and the right establishment of
			worship and the giving of alms and they were worshippers of Us
			(alone).
And unto Lot We gave judgment and knowledge, and We delivered him\n\t\t\tfrom the community that did abominations. Lo! they were folk of\n\t\t\tevil, lewd.
And We brought him in unto Our mercy. Lo! he was of the\n\t\t\trighteous.
And Noah, when he cried of old, We heard his prayer and saved him\n\t\t\tand his household from the great affliction.
And delivered him from the people who denied Our revelations. Lo!\n\t\t\tthey were folk of evil, therefor did We drown them all.
And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the\n\t\t\tfield, when people's sheep had strayed and browsed therein by\n\t\t\tnight; and We were witnesses to their judgment.

And We made Solomon to understand (the case); and unto each of
			them We gave judgment and knowledge. And We subdued the hills and
			the birds to hymn (His) praise along with David. We were the
			doers (thereof).
And We taught him the art of making garments (of mail) to protect\n\t\t\tyou in your daring. Are ye then thankful?
And unto Solomon (We subdued) the wind in its raging. It set by\n\t\t\tHis command toward the land which We had blessed. And of\n\t\t\teverything We are aware.
And of the evil ones (subdued We unto him) some who dived (for\n\t\t\tpearls) for him and did other work, and We were warders unto\n\t\t\tthem.
And Job, when he cried unto his Lord, (saying): Lo! adversity\n\t\t\tafflicteth me, and Thou art Most Merciful of all who show mercy.

Then We heard his prayer and removed that adversity from which he
			suffered, and We gave him his household (that he had lost) and
			the like thereof along with them, a mercy from Our store, and a
			remembrance for the worshippers;
And (mention) Ishmael, and Idris, and Dhul-Kifl. All were of the\n\t\t\tsteadfast.
And We brought them in unto Our mercy. Lo! they are among the\n\t\t\trighteous.

And (mention) Dhun Nun, when he went off in anger and deemed that
			We had no power over him, but he cried out in the darkness,
			saying: There is no God save Thee. Be Thou glorified! I have been
			a wrong-doer.
Then We heard his prayer and saved him from the anguish. Thus We\n\t\t\tsave believers.
And Zachariah, when he cried unto his Lord: My Lord! Leave me not\n\t\t\tchildless, though Thou art the best of inheritors.

Then We heard his prayer, and bestowed upon him John, and
			adjusted his wife (to bear a child) for him. Lo! they used to vie
			one with the other in good deeds, and they cried unto Us in
			longing and in fear, and were submissive unto Us.
And she who was chaste, therefor We breathed into her (something)\n\t\t\tof Our spirit and made her and her son a token for (all) peoples.
Lo! this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so\n\t\t\tworship Me.
And they have broken their religion (into fragments) among them,\n\t\t\t(yet) all are returning unto Us.
Then whoso doeth good works and is a believer, there will be no\n\t\t\trejection of his effort. Lo! We record (it) for him.
And there is a ban upon any community which We have destroyed:\n\t\t\tthat they shall not return,
Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they hasten out of\n\t\t\tevery mound.

And the True Promise draweth nigh; then behold them, staring wide
			(in terror), the eyes of those who disbelieve! (They say): Alas
			for us! We (lived) in forgetfulness of this. Ah, but we were
			wrong doers!
Lo! ye (idolaters) and that which ye worship beside Allah are\n\t\t\tfuel of hell. Thereunto ye will come.
If these had been Gods they would not have come thither, but all\n\t\t\twilt abide therein.
Therein wailing is their portion, and therein they hear not.
