Lo! those unto whom kindness hath gone forth before from Us, they\n\t\t\twilt be far removed from thence.
They will not hear the slightest sound thereof, while they abide\n\t\t\tin that which their souls desire.
The Supreme Horror will not grieve them, and the angels will\n\t\t\twelcome them, (saying): This is your Day which ye were promised;

The Day when We shall roll up the heavens and a recorder rolleth
			up a written scroll. As We began the first creation, We shall
			repeat it. (It is) a promise (binding) upon Us. Lo! We are to
			perform it.
And verity We have written in the Scripture, after the Reminder:\n\t\t\tMy righteous slaves will inherit the earth:
Lo! there is a plain statement for folk who are devout.
We sent thee not save as a mercy for the peoples.
Say: It is only inspired in me that your God is One God. Will ye\n\t\t\tthen surrender (unto Him)!
But if they are averse, then say: I have warned you all alike,\n\t\t\talthough I know not whether nigh or far is that which ye are\n\t\t\tpromised.
Lo! He knoweth that which is said openly, and that which ye\n\t\t\tconceal.
And I know not but that this may be a trial for you, and\n\t\t\tenjoyment for a while.
He saith: My Lord! Judge Thou with truth. Our Lord is the\n\t\t\tBeneficent, whose help is to be implored against that which ye\n\t\t\tascribe (unto Him).
O mankind! Fear your Lord. Lo! the earthquake of the Hour (of\n\t\t\tDoom) is a tremendous thing.

On the day when ye behold it, every nursing mother will forget
			her nursling and every pregnant one will be delivered of her
			burden, and thou (Muhammad) wilt see mankind as drunken, yet they
			will not be drunken, but the Doom of Allah will be strong (upon
			them).
Among mankind is he who disputeth concerning Allah without\n\t\t\tknowledge, and followeth each froward devil;
For him it is decreed that whoso taketh him for friend, be verily\n\t\t\twill mislead him and will guide him to the punishment of the\n\t\t\tFlame.

O mankind! if ye are in doubt concerning the Resurrection, then
			lo! We have created you from dust, then from a drop of seed, then
			from a clot, then from a little lump of flesh shapely and
			shapeless, that We may make (it) clean for you. And We cause what
			We will to remain in the wombs for an appointed time, and
			afterward We bring you forth as infants, then (give you growth)
			that ye attain your full strength. And among you there is he who
			dieth (young), and among you there is he who is brought back to
			the most abject time of life, so that, after knowledge, he
			knoweth naught. And thou (Muhammad) seest the earth barren, but
			when We send down water thereon, it doth thrill and swell and put
			forth every lovely kind (of growth).
That is because Allah, He is the Truth. Lo! He quickeneth the\n\t\t\tdead, and lo! He is Able to do all things;
And because the Hour will come, there is no doubt thereof; and\n\t\t\tbecause Allah will raise those who are in the graves.
And among mankind is he who disputeth concerning Allah without\n\t\t\tknowledge or guidance or a Scripture giving light.
Turning away in pride to beguile (men) from the way of Allah. For\n\t\t\thim in this world is ignominy, and on the Day of Resurrection We\n\t\t\tmake him taste the doom of burning.
(And unto him it will be said): This is for that which thy two\n\t\t\thands have sent before, and because Allah is no oppressor of His\n\t\t\tslaves.

And among mankind is he who worshippeth Allah upon a narrow marge
			so that if good befalleth him he is content therewith, but if a
			trial befalleth him, he falleth away utterly. He loseth both the
			world and the Hereafter. That is the sheer loss.
He calleth, beside Allah, unto that which hurteth him not nor\n\t\t\tbenefiteth him. That is the far error.
He calleth unto him whose harm is nearer than his benefit; verily\n\t\t\tan evil patron and verily an evil friend!
Lo! Allah causeth those who believe and do good works to enter\n\t\t\tthe Gardens underneath which rivers flow. Lo! Allah doth what He\n\t\t\tintendeth.

Whoso is wont to think (through envy) that Allah will not give
			him (Muhammad) victory in the world and the Hereafter (and is
			enraged at the thought of his victory), let him stretch a rope up
			to the roof (of his dwelling), and let him hang himself. Then let
			him see whether his strategy dispelleth that whereat he rageth!
Thus We reveal it as plain revelations, and verily Allah guideth\n\t\t\twhom He will.

Lo! those who believe (this Revelation), and those who are Jews,
			and the Sabaeans and the Christians and the Magians and the
			idolaters--Lo! Allah will decide between them on the Day of
			Resurrection. Lo! Allah is Witness over all things.

Hast thou not seen that unto Allah payeth adoration whosoever is
			in the heavens and whosoever is in the earth, and the sun, and
			the moon, and the stars, and the hills, and the trees, and the
			beasts, and many of mankind, while there are many unto whom the
			doom is justly due. He whom Allah scorneth, there is none to give
			him honor. Lo! Allah doeth what He will.

These twain (the believers and the disbelievers) are two
			opponents who contend concerning their Lord. But as for those who
			disbelieve, garments of fire will be cut out for them; boiling
			fluid will be poured down on their heads.
Whereby that which is in their bellies, and their skins too, will\n\t\t\tbe melted;
And for them are hooked rods of iron.
Whenever, in their anguish, they would go forth from thence they\n\t\t\tare driven back therein and (it is said unto them): Taste the\n\t\t\tdoom of burning.

Lo! Allah will cause those who believe and do good works to enter
			Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will be
			allowed armlets of gold, and pearls, and their raiment therein
			will be silk.
They are guided unto gentle speech; they are guided unto the path\n\t\t\tof the Glorious One.

Lo! those who disbelieve and bar (men) from the way of Allah and
			from the Inviolable Place of Worship, which We have appointed for
			mankind together, the dweller therein and the nomad; whosoever
			seeketh wrongful partiality therein, him We shall cause to taste
			a painful doom.

And (remember) when We prepared for Abraham the place of the
			(holy) House, saying: Ascribe thou no thing as partner unto Me,
			and purify My House for those who make the round (thereof) and
			those who stand and those who bow and make prostration.
And proclaim unto mankind the Pilgrimage. They will come unto\n\t\t\tthee on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every\n\t\t\tdeep ravine.

That they may witness things that are of benefit to them, and
			mention the name of Allah on appointed days over the beast of
			cattle that He hath bestowed upon them. Then eat thereof and feed
			therewith the poor unfortunate.
Then let them make an end of their unkemptness and pay their vows\n\t\t\tand go around the ancient House.

That (is the command). And whoso magnifieth the sacred things of
			Allah, it will be well for him in the sight of his Lord. The
			cattle are lawful unto you save that which hath been told you. So
			shun the filth of idols, and shun lying speech.

Turning unto Allah (only), not ascribing partners unto Him; for
			whoso ascribeth partners unto Allah, it is as if he had fallen
			from the sky and the birds had snatched him or the wind had blown
			him to a far off place.
That (is the command). And whoso magnifieth the offerings\n\t\t\tconsecrated to Allah, it surely is from devotion of the hearts.
Therein are benefits for you for an appointed term; and afterward\n\t\t\tthey are brought for sacrifice unto the ancient House.

And for every nation have We appointed a ritual, that they may
			mention the name of Allah over the beast of cattle that He hath
			given them for food; and your God is One God, therefor surrender
			unto Him. And give good tidings (O Muhammad) to the humble.
Whose hearts fear when Allah is mentioned, and the patient of\n\t\t\twhatever may befall them, and those who establish worship and who\n\t\t\tspend of that We have bestowed on them.

And the camels! We have appointed them among the ceremonies of
			Allah. Therein ye have much good. So mention the name of Allah
			over them when they are drawn up in lines. Then when their flanks
			fall (dead), eat thereof and feed the beggar and the suppliant.
			Thus have We made them subject unto you, that haply ye may give
			thanks.

Their flesh and their blood reach not Allah, but the devotion
			from you reacheth Him. Thus have We made them subject unto you
			that ye may magnify Allah that He hath guided you. And give good
			tidings (O Muhammad) to the good.
Lo! Allah defendeth those who are true. Lo! Allah loveth not each\n\t\t\ttreacherous ingrate.
Sanction is given unto those who fight because they have been\n\t\t\twronged; and Allah is indeed Able to give them victory;

Those who have been driven from their homes unjustly only because
			they said: Our Lord is Allah--For had it not been for Allah's
			repelling some men by means of others, cloisters and churches and
			oratories and mosques, wherein the name of Allah is oft
			mentioned, would assuredly have been pulled down. Verily Allah
			helpeth one who helpeth Him. Lo! Allah is Strong, Almighty.
Those who, if We give them power in the land, establish worship\n\t\t\tand pay the poor due and enjoin kindness and forbid iniquity. And\n\t\t\tAllah's is the sequel of events.
If they deny thee (Muhammad), even so the folk of Noah, and (the\n\t\t\ttribes of) Aad and Thamud, before thee, denied (Our messengers);
And the folk of Abraham and the folk of Lot;
(And) the dwellers in Midian. And Moses was denied; but I\n\t\t\tindulged the disbelievers a long while, then I seized them, and\n\t\t\thow (terrible) was My abhorrence!
How many a township have We destroyed while it was sinful, so\n\t\t\tthat it lieth (to this day) in, and (how many) a deserted well\n\t\t\tand lofty tower!

Have they not travelled in the land, and have they hearts
			wherewith to feel and ears wherewith to hear? For indeed it is
			not the eyes that grow blind, but it is the hearts, which are
			within the bosoms, that grow blind.
And they will bid thee hasten on the Doom, and Allah faileth not\n\t\t\tHis promise, but lo! a Day with Allah is as a thousand years of\n\t\t\twhat ye reckon.
And how many a township did I suffer long though it was sinful!\n\t\t\tThen I grasped it. Unto Me is the return.
Say: O mankind! I am only a plain warner unto you.
Those who believe and do good works, for them pardon and a rich\n\t\t\tprovision;
While those who strive to thwart Our revelations, such are\n\t\t\trightful owners of the Fire.

Never sent We a messenger or a Prophet before thee but when He
			recited (the message) Satan proposed (opposition) in respect of
			that which he recited thereof. But Allah abolisheth that which
			Satan proposeth. Then Allah establisheth His revelations. Allah
			is Knower, Wise;
That He may make that which the devil proposeth a temptation for\n\t\t\tthose in whose hearts is a disease, and those whose hearts are\n\t\t\thardened--Lo! the evil-doers are in open schism--

And that those who have been given knowledge may know that it is
			the truth from thy Lord, so that they may believe therein and
			their hearts may submit humbly unto Him. Lo! Allah verily is
			guiding those who believe unto a right path.
And those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt thereof\n\t\t\tuntil the Hour come upon them unawares, or there come unto them\n\t\t\tthe doom of a disastrous day.
The Sovereignty on that day will be Allah's. He will judge\n\t\t\tbetween them. Then those who believed and did good works will be\n\t\t\tin Gardens of Delight,
While those who disbelieved and denied Our revelations, for them\n\t\t\twill be a shameful doom.

Those who fled their homes for the cause of Allah and then were
			slain or died, Allah verily will provide for them a good
			provision. Lo! Allah, He verily is Best of all who make
			provision.
Assuredly He will cause them to enter by an entry that they will\n\t\t\tlove. Lo! Allah verily is Knower, Indulgent.

That (is so). And whoso hath retaliated with the like of that\n\t\t\twhich he was made to suffer and then hath (again) been wronged,\n\t\t\tAllah will succour him. Lo! Allah verily is Mild, Forgiving.
That is because Allah maketh the night to pass into the day and\n\t\t\tmaketh the day to pass into the night, and because Allah is\n\t\t\tHearer, Seer.
That is because Allah, He is the True, and that whereon they call\n\t\t\tinstead of Him, it is the False, and because Allah, He is the\n\t\t\tHigh, the Great.
Seest thou not how Allah sendeth down water from the sky and then\n\t\t\tthe earth becometh green upon the morrow? Lo! Allah is Subtile,\n\t\t\tAware.
Unto Him belongeth all that is in the heavens and all that is in\n\t\t\tthe earth. Lo! Allah, He verily is the Absolute, the Owner of\n\t\t\tPraise.

Hast thou not seem how Allah hath made all that is in the earth
			subservient unto you? And the sap runneth upon the sea by His
			command, and He holdeth back the heaven from falling on the earth
			unless by His leave. Lo! Allah is, for mankind, Full of Pity,
			Merciful.
And He it is Who gave you life, then He will cause you to die,\n\t\t\tand then will give you life (again). Lo! man is verily an\n\t\t\tingrate.

Unto each nation have We given sacred rites which they are to
			perform; so let them not dispute with thee of the matter, but
			summon thou unto thy Lord. Lo! thou indeed followest right
			guidance.
And if thy wrangle with thee, say: Allah is best aware of what ye\n\t\t\tdo.
Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection\n\t\t\tconcerning that wherein ye used to differ.
Hast thou not known that Allah knoweth all that is in the heaven\n\t\t\tand the earth? Lo! it is in a record. Lo! that is easy for Allah.
And they worship instead of Allah that for which no warrant hath\n\t\t\tbeen revealed unto them, and that whereof they have no knowledge.\n\t\t\tFor evil-doers there is no helper.

And when Our revelations are recited unto them, thou knowest the
			denial in the faces of those who disbelieve; they all but attack
			those who recite Our revelations unto them. Say: Shall I proclaim
			unto you worse than that? The Fire! Allah hath promised it for
			those who disbelieve. A hapless journey's end!

O mankind! A similitude is coined, so pay ye heed to it: Lo!
			those on whom ye call beside Allah will never create a fly though
			they combine together for the purpose. And if the fly took
			something from them, they could not rescue it from him. So weak
			are (both) the seeker and the sought!
They measure not Allah His rightful measure. Lo! Allah is Strong,\n\t\t\tAlmighty.
Allah chooseth from the angels messengers, and (also) from\n\t\t\tmankind. Lo! Allah is Hearer, Seer.
He knoweth all that is before them and all that is behind them,\n\t\t\tand unto Allah all things are returned.
O, ye who believe! Bow down and prostrate yourselves, and worship\n\t\t\tyour Lord, and do good, that haply ye may prosper.

And strive for Allah with the endeavor which is His right. He
			hath chosen you and hath not laid upon you in religion any
			hardship; the faith of your father Abraham (is yours). He hath
			named you Muslims of old time and in this (Scripture), that the
			messenger may be a witness against you, and that ye may be
			witnesses against mankind. So establish worship, pay the poor
			due, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protecting Friend. A
			blessed Patron and a blessed Helper!
Successful indeed are the believers
Who are humble in their prayers,
And who shun vain conversation,
And who are payers of the poor due;
And who guard their modesty
Save from their wives or the (slaves) that their right hands\n\t\t\tpossess, for then they are not blameworthy,
But whoso craveth beyond that, such are transgressors,
And who are shepherds of their pledge and their covenant,
And who pay heed to their prayers.
These are the heirs
Who will inherit Paradise: There they will abide.
Verily We created man from a product of wet earth;
Then placed him as a drop (of seed) in a safe lodging;

Then fashioned We the drop a clot, then fashioned We the clot a
			little lump, then fashioned We the little lump bones, then
			clothed the bones with flesh, and then produced it another
			creation. So blessed be Allah, the Best of Creators!
Then lo! after that ye surely die.
Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection ye are raised (again).
And We have created above you seven paths, and We are never\n\t\t\tunmindful of creation.
And We send down from the sky water in measure, and We give it\n\t\t\tlodging in the earth, and lo! We are able to withdraw it.
Then We produce for you therewith gardens of date palms and\n\t\t\tgrapes, wherein is much fruit for you and whereof ye eat;
And a tree that springeth forth from Mount Sinai that groweth oil\n\t\t\tand relish for the eaters.
And lo! in the cattle there is verily a lesson for you. We give\n\t\t\tyou to drink of that which is in their bellies, and many uses\n\t\t\thave ye in them, and of them do ye eat;
And on them and on the ship ye are carried.
And We verily sent Noah unto his folk, and he said: O my people!\n\t\t\tServe Allah. Ye have no other god save Him. Will ye not ward off\n\t\t\t(evil)?

But the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved, said: This is
			only a mortal like you who would make himself superior to you.
			Had Allah willed, He surely could have sent down angels. We heard
			not of this in the case of our fathers of old.
He is only a man in whom is a madness, so watch him for a while.
He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me.

Then We inspired in him, saying: Make the ship under Our eyes and
			Our inspiration. Then, when Our command cometh and the oven
			gusheth water, introduce therein of every (kind ) two spouses,
			and thy household save him thereof against whom the Word hath
			already gone forth. And plead not with Me on behalf of those who
			have done wrong: Lo! they will be drowned.
And when thou art on board the ship, thou and whoso is with thee,\n\t\t\tthen say: Praise be to Allah Who hath saved us from the\n\t\t\twrongdoing folk!
And say: My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing place,\n\t\t\tfor Thou art best of all who bring to land.
Lo! herein verily are portents, for lo! We are ever putting\n\t\t\t(mankind) to the test.
Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;
And We sent among them a messenger of their own saying: Serve\n\t\t\tAllah. Ye have no other god save Him. Will ye not ward off\n\t\t\t(evil)?

And the chieftains of his folk, who disbelieved and denied the
			meeting of the Hereafter, and whom We had made soft in the life
			of the world, said: This is only a mortal like you, who eateth of
			that whereof ye eat and drinketh of that ye drink.
If ye were to obey a mortal like yourselves, ye surely would be\n\t\t\tlosers.
Doth he promise you that you, when ye are dead and have become\n\t\t\tdust and bones, will (again) be brought forth?
Begone, begone, with that which ye are promised!
There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live,\n\t\t\tand we shall not be raised (again).
He is only a man who hath invented a lie about Allah. We are not\n\t\t\tgoing to put faith in him.
He said: My Lord! Help me because they deny me,
He said: In a little while they surely will become repentant.
So the (Awful) Cry overtook them rightfully, and We made them\n\t\t\tlike as wreckage (that a torrent hurleth). A far removal for\n\t\t\twrongdoing folk!
Then after them We brought forth other generations.
No nation can outstrip its term, nor yet postpone it.

Then We sent our messengers one after another. Whenever its
			messenger came unto a nation they denied him; so We caused them
			to follow one another (to disaster) and We made them bywords. A
			far removal for folk who believe not!
Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our tokens and a\n\t\t\tclear warrant
Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they scorned (them) and they\n\t\t\twere despotic folk.
And they said: Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves,\n\t\t\tand whose folk are servile unto us?
So they denied them, and became of those who were destroyed.
And we verily gave Moses the Scripture, that haply they might go\n\t\t\taright.
And We made the son of Mary and his mother a portent, and We gave\n\t\t\tthem refuge on a height, a place of flocks and water springs.
O ye messengers! Eat of the good thing, and do right. Lo! I am\n\t\t\tAware of what ye do.
And lo! this your religion is one religion and I am your Lord, so\n\t\t\tkeep your duty unto Me.
But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into\n\t\t\tsects, each sect rejoicing in its tenets.
So leave them in their error till a time.
Think they that in the wealth and sons wherewith We provide them
We hasten unto them with good things? Nay, but they perceive not.
Lo! those who go in awe for fear of their Lord,
And those who believe in the revelations of their Lord,
And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lord,
And those who give that which they give with hearts afraid\n\t\t\tbecause they are about to return unto their Lord,
These race for the good things, and they shall win them in the\n\t\t\trace.
And We task not any soul beyond its scope, and with Us is a\n\t\t\tRecord which speaketh the truth, and they will not be wronged.
Nay, but their hearts are in ignorance of this (Qur'an), and they\n\t\t\thave other works, besides, which they are doing;
Till when We grasp their luxurious ones with the punishment,\n\t\t\tbehold! they supplicate.
Supplicate not this day! Assuredly ye will not be helped by Us.
My revelations were recited unto you, but ye used to turn back on\n\t\t\tyour heels,
In scorn thereof. Nightly did ye rave together.
Have they not pondered the Word, or hath that come unto them\n\t\t\twhich came not unto their fathers of old?
Or know they not their messenger, and so reject him?
Or say they: There is a madness in him? Nay, but he bringeth them\n\t\t\tthe Truth; and most of them are haters of the Truth.

And if the Truth had followed their desires, verily the heavens
			and the earth and whosoever is therein had been corrupted. Nay,
			We have brought them their Reminder, but from their Reminder they
			now turn away.
Or dost thou ask of them (O Muhammad) any tribute? But! the\n\t\t\tbounty of thy Lord is better, for He is best of all who make\n\t\t\tprovision.
And lo! thou summonest them indeed unto a right path.
And lo! those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed astray\n\t\t\tfrom the path.
Though We had mercy on them and relieved them of the harm\n\t\t\tafflicting them, they still would wander blindly on in their\n\t\t\tcontumacy.
Already have We grasped them with punishment, but they humble not\n\t\t\tthemselves unto their Lord, nor do they pray,
Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme punishment,\n\t\t\tbehold! they are aghast thereat.
He it is Who hath created for you ears and eyes and hearts. Small\n\t\t\tthanks give ye!
And He it is Who hath sown you broadcast in the earth, and unto\n\t\t\tHim ye will be gathered.
And He it is Who giveth life and causeth death, and His is the\n\t\t\tdifference of night and day. Have ye then no sense?
Nay, but they say the like of that which said the men of old;
They say: When we are dead and have become (mere) dust and bones,\n\t\t\tshall we then, forsooth, be raised again?
We were already promised this, we and our forefathers. Lo! this\n\t\t\tis naught but fables of the men of old.
Say: Unto Whom (belongeth) the earth and whosoever is therein, if\n\t\t\tye have knowledge?
They will say: Unto Allah. Say: Will ye not then remember?
Say: Who is Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Tremendous\n\t\t\tThrone?
They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: Will ye not\n\t\t\tthen keep duty (unto Him)?
Say: In Whose hand is the dominion over all things and He\n\t\t\tprotecteth, while against Him there is no protection, if ye have\n\t\t\tknowledge?
They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: How then are\n\t\t\tye bewitched?
Nay, but We have brought them the Truth, and lo! they are liars.

Allah hath not chosen any son, nor is there any God along with
			Him; else would each God have assuredly championed that which he
			created, and some of them would assuredly have overcome others.
			Glorified be Allah above all that they allege.
Knower of the invisible and the visible! and exalted be He over\n\t\t\tall that they ascribe as partners (unto Him)!
Say: My Lord! If thou shouldst show me that which they are\n\t\t\tpromised,
My Lord! then set me not among the wrongdoing folk.
And verily We are Able to show thee that which We have promised\n\t\t\tthem.
Repel evil with that which is better. We are best Aware of that\n\t\t\twhich they allege.
And say: My Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from suggestions of the\n\t\t\tevil ones,
And I seek refuge in Thee, my Lord, lest they be present with me,
Until, when death cometh unto one of them, he saith: My Lord!\n\t\t\tSend me back,
That I may do right in that which I have left behind! But nay! It\n\t\t\tis but a word that he speaketh; and behind them is a barrier\n\t\t\tuntil the day when they are raised.
And when the trumpet is blown there will be no kinship among them\n\t\t\tthat day, nor will they ask of one another.
Then those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful.
And those whose scales are light are those who lose their souls,\n\t\t\tin hell abiding.
The fire burneth their faces, and they are glum therein.
(It will be said): Were not My revelations recited unto you, and\n\t\t\tthen ye used to deny them?
They will say: Our Lord! Our evil fortune conquered us, and we\n\t\t\twere erring folk.
Our Lord! Oh, bring us forth from hence! If we return (to evil)\n\t\t\tthen indeed we shall be wrongdoers.
He saith: Begone therein, and speak not unto Me.
Lo! there was a party of My slaves who said: Our Lord! We\n\t\t\tbelieve, therefor forgive us and have mercy on us for Thou art\n\t\t\tbest of all who show mercy;
But ye chose them from a laughingstock until they caused you to\n\t\t\tforget remembrance of Me, while ye laughed at them.
Lo! I have rewarded them this day forasmuch as they were\n\t\t\tsteadfast; and they verily are the triumphant.
He will say: How long tarried ye in the earth, counting by years?
They will say: We tarried but a day or part of a day. Ask of\n\t\t\tthose who keep count!
He will say: Ye tarried but a little if ye only knew.
Deemed ye then that We had created you for naught, and that ye\n\t\t\twould not be returned unto Us?
Now Allah be exalted, the True King! There is no God save Him,\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Throne of Grace.
He who crieth unto any other god along with Allah hath no proof\n\t\t\tthereof. His reckoning is only with his Lord. Lo! disbelievers\n\t\t\twill not be successful.
And (O Muhammad) say: My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for Thou\n\t\t\tart best of all who show mercy.
(Here is) a Surah which We have revealed and enjoined, and\n\t\t\twherein We have revealed plain tokens, that haply we may take\n\t\t\theed.

The adulterer and the adulteress, scourge ye each one of them
			(with) a hundred stripes. And let not pity for the twain withhold
			you from obedience to Allah, if ye believe in Allah and the Last
			Day. And let a party of believers witness their punishment.
The adulterer shall not marry save an adulteress or an\n\t\t\tidolatress, and the adulteress none shall marry save an adulterer\n\t\t\tor an idolater. All that is forbidden unto believers.
And those who accuse honorable women but bring not four\n\t\t\twitnesses, scourge them (with) eighty stripes and never\n\t\t\t(afterward) accept their testimony--They indeed are evildoers--
Save those who afterward repent and make amends. (For such) lo!\n\t\t\tAllah is Forgiving, Merciful.

As for those who accuse their wives but have no witnesses except\n\t\t\tthemselves; let the testimony of one of them be four testimonies,\n\t\t\t(swearing) by Allah that he is of those who speak the truth;
And yet a fifth, invoking the curse of Allah on him if he is of\n\t\t\tthose who lie.
And it shall avert the punishment from her if she bear witness\n\t\t\tbefore Allah four times that the thing he saith is indeed false,
And a fifth (time) that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he\n\t\t\tspeaketh truth.
And had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto\n\t\t\tyou, and that Allah is Clement, Wise, (ye had been undone).

Lo! they who spread the slander are a gang among you. Deem it not
			a bad thing for you; say, it is good for you. Unto every man of
			them (will be paid that which he hath earned of the sin; and as
			for him among them who had the greater share therein, his will be
			an awful doom.
Why did not the believers, men and women, when ye heard it, think\n\t\t\tgood of their own folk; and say: It is a manifest untruth?
Why did they not produce four witnesses? Since they produce not\n\t\t\twitnesses, they verily are liars in the sight of Allah.
Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you in\n\t\t\tthe world and the Hereafter an awful doom had overtaken you for\n\t\t\tthat whereof ye murmured.
When ye welcomed it with your tongues, and uttered with your\n\t\t\tmouths that whereof ye had no knowledge, ye counted it a trifle.\n\t\t\tIn the sight of Allah it is very great.
Wherefore, when ye heard it, said ye not: It is not for us to\n\t\t\tspeak of this. Glory be to Thee (O Allah); This is awful calumny.
Allah admonisheth you that ye repeat not the like thereof ever,\n\t\t\tif ye are (in truth) believers.
And He expoundeth unto you His revelations. Allah is Knower,\n\t\t\tWise.
Lo! those who love that slander should be spread concerning those\n\t\t\twho believe, theirs will be a painful punishment in the world and\n\t\t\tthe Hereafter. Allah knoweth. Ye know not.
Had it not been for the grace of Allah and His mercy unto you,\n\t\t\tand that Allah is Clement, Merciful, (ye had been undone).

O ye who believe! Follow not the footsteps of the devil. Unto
			whomsoever followeth the footsteps of the devil, lo! he
			commandeth filthiness and wrong. Had it not been for the grace of
			Allah and His mercy unto you, not one of you would ever have
			grown pure. But Allah causeth whom He will to grow. And Allah is
			Hearer, Knower.

And let not those who possess dignity and ease among you swear
			not to give to the near of kin and to the needy, and to fugitives
			for the cause of Allah. Let them forgive and show indulgence.
			Yearn ye not that Allah may forgive you? Allah is Forgiving,
			Merciful.
Lo! as for those who traduce virtuous, believing women (who are)\n\t\t\tcareless, cursed are they in the world and the Hereafter. Theirs\n\t\t\twill be an awful doom.
On the day when their tongues and their hands and their feet\n\t\t\ttestify against them as to what they used to do,
On that day Allah will pay them their just due, and they will\n\t\t\tknow that Allah, He is the Manifest Truth.

Vile women are for vile men, and vile men for vile women. Good
			women are for good men, and good men for good women; such are
			innocent of that which people say: For them is pardon and a
			bountiful provision.
O ye who believe! Enter not houses other than your own without\n\t\t\tfirst announcing your presence and invoking peace upon the folk\n\t\t\tthereof. That is better for you, that ye may be heedful.

And if ye find no one therein, still enter not until permission\n\t\t\thath been given. And if it be said unto you: Go away again, then\n\t\t\tgo away, for it is purer for you. Allah knoweth what ye do.
(It is) no sin for you to enter uninhabited houses wherein is\n\t\t\tcomfort for you. Allah knoweth what ye proclaim and what ye hide.
Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and be modest. That is\n\t\t\tpurer for them. Lo! Allah is Aware of what they do.

And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and be modest,
			and to display of their adornment only that which is apparent,
			and to draw their veils over their bosoms, and not to reveal
			their adornment save to their own husbands or fathers or
			husbands' fathers, or their sons or their husbands' sons, or
			their brothers or their brothers' sons or sisters' sons, or their
			women, or their slaves, or male attendants who lack vigor, or
			children who know naught of women's nakedness. And let them not
			stamp their feet so as to reveal what they hide of their
			adornment. And turn unto Allah together, O believers, in order
			that ye may succeed.
And marry such of you as are solitary and the pious of your\n\t\t\tslaves and maid servants. If they be poor; Allah will enrich them\n\t\t\tof His bounty. Allah is of ample means, Aware.

And let those who cannot find a match keep chaste till Allah give
			them independence by His grace. And such of your slaves as seek a
			writing (of emancipation), write it for them if ye are aware of
			aught of good in them, and bestow upon them of the wealth of
			Allah which He hath bestowed upon you. Force not your slave girls
			to whoredom that ye may seek enjoyment of the life of the world,
			if they would preserve their chastity. And if one force them,
			then (unto them), after their compulsion, Lo! Allah will be
			Forgiving, Merciful.
And verily We have sent down for you revelations that make plain,\n\t\t\tand the example of those who passed away before you. An\n\t\t\tadmonition unto those who ward off (evil).

Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The similitude
			of His light is as a niche wherein is a lamp. The lamp is in a
			glass. The glass is as it were a shining star. (This lamp is)
			kindled from a blessed tree, an olive neither of the East nor of
			the West, whose oil would almost glow forth (of itself) though no
			fire touched it. Light upon light, Allah guideth unto His light
			whom He will. And Allah speaketh to mankind in allegories, for
			Allah is knower of all things.
(This lamp is found) in houses which Allah hath allowed to be\n\t\t\texalted and that His name shall be remembered therein. Therein do\n\t\t\toffer praise to Him at morn and evening--

Men whom neither merchandise nor sale beguileth from remembrance\n\t\t\tof Allah and constancy in prayer and paying to the poor their\n\t\t\tdue; who fear a day when hearts and eyeballs will be overturned;
That Allah may reward them with the best of what they did, and\n\t\t\tincrease reward for them of His bounty. Allah giveth blessings\n\t\t\twithout stint to whom He will.

As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are as a mirage in a
			desert. The thirsty one supposeth it to be water till he cometh
			unto it and findeth it naught, and findeth, in the place thereof,
			Allah, Who payeth him his due; and Allah is swift at reckoning.

Or as darkness on a vast, abysmal sea. There covereth him a wave,
			above which is a wave, above which is a cloud. Layer upon layer
			of darkness. When he holdeth out his hand he scarce can see it.
			And he for whom Allah hath not appointed light, for him there is
			no light.

Hast thou not seen that Allah, He it is Whom all who are in the
			heavens and the earth praise; and the birds in their flight? Of
			each He knoweth verily the worship and the praise; and Allah is
			Aware of what they do.
And unto Allah belongeth the sovereignty of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth, and unto Allah is the journeying.

Hast thou not seen how Allah wafteth the clouds, then gathereth
			them, then maketh them layers, and thou seest the rain come forth
			from between them; He sendeth down from the heaven mountains
			wherein is hail, and smiteth therewith whom He will, and averteth
			it from whom He will. The flashing of His lightning all but
			snatcheth away the sight.
Allah causeth the revolution of the day and the night. Lo! herein\n\t\t\tis indeed a lesson for those who see.

Allah hath created every animal of water. Of them is (a kind)
			that goeth upon its belly and (a kind) that goeth upon two legs
			and (a kind) that goeth upon four. Allah createth what He will.
			Lo! Allah is Able to do all things.
Verily We have sent down revelations and explained them. Allah\n\t\t\tguideth whom He will unto a straight path.
And they say: We believe in Allah and the messenger, and we obey;\n\t\t\tthen after that a faction of them turn away. Such are not\n\t\t\tbelievers.
And when they appeal unto Allah and His messenger to judge\n\t\t\tbetween them, lo! a faction of them are averse;
But if right had been with them they would have come unto him\n\t\t\twillingly.
Is there in their hearts a disease, or have they doubts, or fear\n\t\t\tthey lest Allah and His messenger should wrong them in judgment?\n\t\t\tNay, but such are evil-doers.
The saying of (all true) believers when they appeal unto Allah\n\t\t\tand His messenger to judge between them is only that they say: We\n\t\t\thear and we obey. And such are the successful.
He who obeyeth Allah and His messenger, and feareth Allah, and\n\t\t\tkeepeth duty (unto Him): such indeed are the victorious.
They swear by Allah solemnly that, if thou order them, they will\n\t\t\tgo forth. Say: Swear not; known obedience (is better). Lo! Allah\n\t\t\tis Informed of what ye do.

Say: Obey Allah and obey the messenger. But if ye turn away, then
			(it is) for him (to do) only that wherewith he hath been charged,
			and for you (to do) only that wherewith ye have been charged. If
			ye obey him, ye will go aright. But the messenger hath no other
			charge than to convey (the message), plainly.

Allah hath promised such of you as believe and do good works that
			He will surely make them to succeed (the present rulers) in the
			earth even as He caused those who were before them to succeed
			others); and that He will surely establish for them their
			religion which He hath approved for them, a will give them in
			exchange safety after their fear. They serve Me. They ascribe no
			thing as partner unto Me. Those who disbelieve henceforth, they
			are the miscreants.
Establish worship and pay the poor due and obey the messenger,\n\t\t\tthat haply ye may find mercy.
Think not that the disbelievers can, escape in the land. Fire\n\t\t\twill be their home, a hapless journey's end!

O ye who believe! Let your slaves, and those of you who have not
			come to puberty, ask leave of you at three times (before they
			come into your presence): Before the prayer of dawn, and when ye
			lay aside your raiment for the heat of noon, and after the prayer
			of night. Three times of privacy for you. It is no sin for them
			or for you at other times, when some of you go round attendant
			upon others (if they come into your presence without leave). Thus
			Allah maketh clear the revelations for you. Allah is Knower,
			Wise.
And when the children among you come to puberty then let them ask\n\t\t\tleave even as those before them used to ask it. Thus Allah maketh\n\t\t\tclear His revelations for you. Allah is knower, Wise.

As for women past child-bearing, who have no hope of marriage, it
			is no sin for them if they discard their (outer) clothing in such
			a way as not to show adornment. But to refrain is better for
			them. Allah is Hearer, Knower.

No blame is there upon the blind nor any blame upon the lame nor
			any blame upon the sick nor on yourselves if ye eat from your
			houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses of your
			mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of your
			sisters, or the houses of your fathers' brothers, or the houses
			of your fathers' sisters, or the houses of your mothers'
			brothers, or the houses of your mothers' sisters, or (from that)
			whereof ye hold the keys, or (from the house) of a friend. No sin
			shall it be for you whether ye eat together or apart. But when ye
			enter houses, salute one another with a greeting from Allah,
			blessed and sweet. Thus Allah maketh clear His revelations for
			you, that haply ye may understand.

They only are the true believers who believe in Allah and His
			messenger and, when they are with him on some common errand, go
			not away until they have asked leave of him. Lo! those who ask
			leave of thee, those are they who believe in Allah and His
			messenger. So, if they ask thy leave for some affair of theirs,
			give leave to whom thou wilt of them, and ask for them
			forgiveness of Allah. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

Make not the calling of the messenger among you as your calling
			one of another. Allah knoweth those of you who steal away, hiding
			themselves. And let those who conspire to evade orders beware
			lest grief or painful punishment befall them.

Lo! verily unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and
			the earth. He knoweth your condition. And (He knoweth) the Day
			when they are returned unto Him so that He may inform them of
			what they did. Allah is Knower of all things.
Blessed is He Who hath revealed unto His slave the Criterion (of\n\t\t\tright and wrong), that he may be a warner to the peoples.

He unto Whom belongeth the sovereignty of the heavens and the
			earth. He hath chosen no son nor hath He any partne in the
			sovereignty. He hath created everything and hath meted out for it
			a measure.

Yet they choose beside Him other gods who create naught but are
			themselves created, and possess not hurt nor profit for
			themselves, and possess not death nor life, nor power to raise
			the dead.
Those who disbelieve say: This is naught but a lie that he hath\n\t\t\tinvented, and other folk have helped him with it, so that they\n\t\t\thave produced a slander and a lie.
And they say: Fables of the men of old which he hath had written\n\t\t\tdown so that they are dictated to him morn and evening.
Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He Who knoweth the secret of the\n\t\t\theavens and the earth hath revealed it. Lo! He ever is Forgiving,\n\t\t\tMerciful.
And they say: What aileth this messenger (of Allah) that he\n\t\t\teateth food and walketh in the markets? Why is not an angel sent\n\t\t\tdown unto him, to be a warner with him?
Or (why is not) a treasure thrown down unto him, or why hath he\n\t\t\tnot a paradise from whence to eat? And the evil-doers say: Ye are\n\t\t\tbut following a man bewitched.
See how they coin similitudes for thee, so that they are all\n\t\t\tastray and cannot find a road!
Blessed is He Who, if He will, will assign thee better than (all)\n\t\t\tthat--Gardens underneath which rivers flow--and will assign thee\n\t\t\tmansions.
Nay, but they deny (the coming of) the Hour, and for those who\n\t\t\tdeny (the coming of) the Hour We have prepared a flame.
When it seeth them from afar, they bear the cracking and the roar\n\t\t\tthereof.
And when they are flung into a narrow place thereof, chained\n\t\t\ttogether, they pray for destruction there.
Pray not that day for one destruction, but pray for many\n\t\t\tdestructions!
Say: Is that (doom) better or the Garden of Immortality which is\n\t\t\tpromised unto those who ward off (evil)? It will be their reward\n\t\t\tand journey's end.
Therein abiding, they have all that they desire. It is for thy\n\t\t\tLord a promise that must be fulfilled.
And on the day when He will assemble them and that which they\n\t\t\tworship instead of Allah and will say: Was it ye who misled these\n\t\t\tmy slaves or did they (themselves) wander from the way?

They will say: Be Thou glorified! It was not for us to choose any
			protecting friends beside Thee; but Thou didst give them and
			their fathers ease till they forgot the warning and became lost
			folk.
Thus they will give you the lie regarding what ye say, then ye\n\t\t\tcan neither avert (the doom) nor obtain help. And whoso among you\n\t\t\tdoeth wrong, We shall make him taste great torment.

We never sent before thee any messengers but lo! they ate food\n\t\t\tand walked in the markets. And We have appointed some of you a\n\t\t\ttest for others: Will ye be steadfast? And thy Lord is ever Seer.

And those who look not for a meeting with Us say: Why are angels
			not sent down unto us and (why) do we not see our Lord? Assuredly
			they think too highly of themselves and are scornful with great
			pride.
On the day when they behold the angels, on that day there will be\n\t\t\tno good tidings for the guilty; and they will cry: A forbidding\n\t\t\tban!
And We shall turn unto the work they did and make it scattered\n\t\t\tmotes.
Those who have earned the Garden on that day will be better in\n\t\t\ttheir home and happier in their place of noonday rest;
A day when the heaven with the clouds will be rent asunder and\n\t\t\tthe angels will be sent down, a grand descent.
The Sovereignty on that day will be the True (Sovereignty)\n\t\t\tbelonging to the Beneficent One, and it will be a hard day for\n\t\t\tdisbelievers.
On the day when the wrongdoer gnaweth his hands, he will say: Ah,\n\t\t\twould that I had chosen a way together with the messenger (of\n\t\t\tAllah)!
Alas for me! Ah, would that I had never taken such an one for\n\t\t\tfriend!
He verily led me astray from the Reminder after it had reached\n\t\t\tme. Satan was ever man's deserter in the hour of need.
And the messenger saith: O my Lord! Lo! mine own folk make this\n\t\t\tQur'an of no account.
Even so have We appointed unto every Prophet an opportent from\n\t\t\tamong the guilty; but Allah sufficeth for a Guide and Helper.

And those who disbelieve say: Why is the Qur'an not revealed unto\n\t\t\thim all at once? (It is revealed) thus that We may strengthen thy\n\t\t\theart therewith; and We have arranged it in right order.
And they bring thee no similitude but We bring thee the Truth (as\n\t\t\tagainst it), and better (than their similitude) as argument.
Those who will be gathered on their faces unto Hell: such are\n\t\t\tworse in plight and further from the right road.
We verily gave Moses the Scripture and placed with him his\n\t\t\tbrother Aaron as henchman.
Then We said: Go together unto the folk who have denied Our\n\t\t\trevelations. Then We destroyed them, a complete destruction.
And Noah's folk, when they denied the messengers, We drowned them\n\t\t\tand made of them a portent for mankind. We have prepared a\n\t\t\tpainful doom for evil-doers.
And (the tribes of) Aad and Thamud, and the dwellers in Ar-Rass,\n\t\t\tand many generations in between.
Each (of them) We warned by examples, and each (of them) We\n\t\t\tbrought to utter ruin.
And indeed they have passed by the township whereon was rained\n\t\t\tthe fatal rain. Can it be that they have not seen it? Nay, but\n\t\t\tthey hope for no resurrection.
And when they see thee (O Muhammad) they treat thee only as a\n\t\t\tjest (saying): Is this he whom Allah sendeth as a messenger?
He would have led us far away from our gods if we had not been\n\t\t\tstaunch to them. They will know, when they behold the doom, who\n\t\t\tis more astray as to the road.
Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust? Wouldst\n\t\t\tthou then be guardian over him?
Or deemest thou that most of them hear or understand? They are\n\t\t\tbut as the cattle, nay, but they are farther astray!
Hast thou not seen how thy Lord hath spread the shade. And if He\n\t\t\twilled He could have made it still, then We have made the sun its\n\t\t\tpilot;
Then We withdraw it unto Us, a gradual withdrawal?
And He it is Who maketh night a covering for you, and sleep\n\t\t\trepose, and maketh day a resurrection.
And He it is Who sendeth the winds, glad tidings heralding His\n\t\t\tmercy, and We send down purifying water from the sky.
That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give many\n\t\t\tbeasts and men that We have created to drink thereof.
And verily We have repeated it among them that they may remember,\n\t\t\tbut most of mankind begrudge aught save in gratitude.
If We willed, We could raise up a warner in every village.
So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them herewith\n\t\t\twith a great endeavor.
And He it is Who hath given independence to the two seas (though\n\t\t\tthey meet); one palatable, sweet, and the other saltish, bitter;\n\t\t\tand hath set a bar and a forbidding ban between them.
And He it is Who hath created man from water, and hath appointed\n\t\t\tfor him kindred by blood and kindred by marriage; for thy Lord is\n\t\t\tever Powerful.
Yet they worship instead of Allah that which can neither benefit\n\t\t\tthem nor hurt them. The disbeliever was ever a partisan against\n\t\t\this Lord.
And We have sent thee (O Muhammad) only as a bearer of good\n\t\t\ttidings and a warner.
Say: I ask of you no reward for this, save that whoso will may\n\t\t\tchoose a way unto his Lord.
And trust thou in the Living One Who dieth not, and hymn His\n\t\t\tpraise. He sufficeth as the Knower of His bondmen's sins,
Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between\n\t\t\tthem in six Days, then He mounted the Throne. The Beneficent! Ask\n\t\t\tany one informed concerning Him!
And when it is said unto them: Adore the Beneficent! they say:\n\t\t\tAnd what is the Beneficent? Are we to adore whatever thou\n\t\t\t(Muhammad) biddest us? And it increaseth aversion in them.
Blessed be He Who hath placed in the heaven mansions of the\n\t\t\tstars, and hath placed therein a great lamp and a moon giving\n\t\t\tlight!
And He it is Who hath appointed night and day in succession, for\n\t\t\thim who desireth to remember, or desireth thankfulness.
The (faithful) slaves of the Beneficent are they who walk upon\n\t\t\tthe earth modestly, and when the foolish ones address them\n\t\t\tanswer: Peace;
And who spend the night before their Lord, prostrate and\n\t\t\tstanding,
And who say: Our Lord! Avert from us the doom of hell; lo! the\n\t\t\tdoom thereof is anguish;
Lo! it is wretched as abode and station;
And those who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor\n\t\t\tgrudging; and there is ever a firm station between the two;

And those who cry not unto any other god along with Allah, nor
			take the life which Allah hath forbidden save in (course of)
			justice, nor commit adultery and whoso doeth this shall pay the
			penalty;
The doom will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and\n\t\t\the will abide therein disdained for ever;
Save him who repenteth and believeth and doth righteous work; as\n\t\t\tfor such, Allah will change their evil deeds to good deeds. Allah\n\t\t\tis ever Forgiving, Merciful.
And whosoever repenteth and doeth good, he verily repenteth\n\t\t\ttoward Allah with true repentance.
And those who will not witness vanity, but when they pass near\n\t\t\tsenseless play, pass by with dignity.
And those who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their\n\t\t\tLord, fall not deaf and blind thereat.
And who say: Our Lord! Vouchsafe us comfort of our wives and of\n\t\t\tour offspring, and make us patterns for (all) those who ward off\n\t\t\t(evil).
They will be awarded the high place forasmuch as they were\n\t\t\tsteadfast, and they will meet therein with welcome and the word\n\t\t\tof peace,
Abiding there for ever. Happy is it as abode and station!
Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): My Lord would not\n\t\t\tconcern himself with you but for your prayer. But now ye have\n\t\t\tdenied (the Truth), therefor there will be judgment.
Ta. Sin. Mim.
These are revelations of the Scripture that maketh plain.
It may be that thou tormentest thyself (O Muhammad) because they\n\t\t\tbelieve not.
If We will, We can send down on them from the sky a portent so\n\t\t\tthat their necks would remain bowed before it.
Never cometh there unto them a fresh reminder from the Beneficent\n\t\t\tOne, but they turn away from it.
Now they have denied (the Truth); but there will come unto them\n\t\t\ttidings of that whereat they used to scoff.
Have they not seen the earth, how much of every fruitful kind We\n\t\t\tmake to grow therein?
Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not\n\t\t\tbelievers.
And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
And when thy Lord called Moses, saying: Go unto the wrongdoing\n\t\t\tfolk,
The folk of Pharaoh. Will they not ward off (evil)?
He said: My Lord! Lo! I fear that they will deny me,
And I shall be embarrassed, and my tongue will not speak plainly,\n\t\t\ttherefor send for Aaron (to help me).
And they have a crime against me, so I fear that they will kill\n\t\t\tme.
He said: Nay, verily. So go ye twain with Our tokens. Lo! We\n\t\t\tshall be with you, Hearing.
And come together unto Pharaoh and say: Lo! we bear a message of\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Worlds,
(Saying): Let the Children of Israel go with Us.
(Pharaoh) said (unto Moses): Did we not rear thee among us as a\n\t\t\tchild? And thou didst dwell many years of thy life among us,
And thou didst that thy deed which thou didst, and thou wast one\n\t\t\tof the ingrates,
He said: I did it then, when I was of those who are astray.
Then I fled from you when I feared you, and my Lord vouchsafed me\n\t\t\ta command and appointed me (of the number) of those sent (by\n\t\t\tHim).
And this is the past favor wherewith thou reproachest me: that\n\t\t\tthou hast enslaved the Children of Israel.
Pharaoh said: And what is the Lord of the Worlds?
(Moses) said: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is\n\t\t\tbetween them, if ye had but sure belief.
(Pharaoh) said unto those around him: Hear ye not?
He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers.
(Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is\n\t\t\tindeed a madman!
He said: Lord of the East and the West and all that is between\n\t\t\tthem, if ye did but understand.
(Pharaoh) said: If thou choosest a god other than me, I assuredly\n\t\t\tshall place thee among the prisoners.
He said: Even though I show thee something plain?
(Pharaoh) said: Produce it then, if thou art of the truthful!
Then he flung down his staff and it became a serpent manifest,
And he drew forth his hand and lo! it was white to the beholders.
(Pharaoh) said unto the chiefs about him: Lo, this is verily a\n\t\t\tknowing wizard,
Who would drive you out of your land by his magic. Now what\n\t\t\tcounsel ye?
They said: Put him off, (him) and his brother, and send them into\n\t\t\tthe cities summoners
Who shall bring unto thee every knowing wizard.
So the wizards were gathered together at a set time on a day\n\t\t\tappointed.
And it was said unto the people: Are ye (also) gathering?
(They said): Aye, so that we may follow the wizards if they are\n\t\t\tthe winners.
And when the wizards came they said unto Pharaoh: Will there\n\t\t\tsurely be a reward for us if we are the winners?
He said: Aye, and ye will then surely be of those brought near\n\t\t\t(to me).
Moses said unto them: Throw what ye are going to throw!
Then they threw down their cords and their staves and said: By\n\t\t\tPharaoh's might, lo! we verily are the winners.
Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they\n\t\t\tdid falsely show.
And the wizards were flung prostrate,
Crying: We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,
The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

(Pharaoh) said, Ye put your faith in him before I give you leave.
			Lo! he doubtless is your chief who taught you magic! But verily
			ye shall come to know. Verily I will cut off your hands and your
			feet alternately, and verily I will crucify you everyone.
They said: It is no hurt, for lo! unto our Lord we shall return.
Lo! we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins\n\t\t\tbecause we are the first of the believers.
And We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night, for\n\t\t\tye will be pursued.
Then Pharaoh sent into the cities summoners,
(Who said): Lo! these indeed are but a little troop,
And lo! they are offenders against us.
And lo! we are a ready host.
Thus did We take them away from gardens and water springs,
And treasures and a fair estate.
Thus (were those things taken from them) and We caused the\n\t\t\tChildren of Israel to inherit them.
And they overtook them at sunrise.
And when the two hosts saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo!\n\t\t\twe are indeed caught.
He said: Nay, verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide\n\t\t\tme.
Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And\n\t\t\tit parted, and each part was as a mountain vast.
Then brought We near the others to that place.
And We saved Moses and those with him, every one;
We drowned the others.
Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not\n\t\t\tbelievers.
And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
Recite unto them the story of Abraham:
When he said unto his father and his folk: What worship ye?
They said: We worship idols, and are ever devoted unto them.
He said: Do they hear you when ye cry?
Or do they benefit or harm you?
They said: Nay, but we found our fathers acting on this use.
He said: See now that which ye worship,
Ye and your forefathers!
Lo! they are (all) an enemy unto me, save the Lord of the Worlds.
Who created me, and He doth guide me,
And Who feedeth me and watereth me.
And when I sicken, then He healeth me,
And Who causeth me to die, the giveth me life (again),
And Who, I ardently hope, will forgive me my sin on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgement.
My Lord! Vouchsafe me wisdom and unite me to the righteous.
And give unto me a good report in later generations.
And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Delight,
And forgive my father. Lo! he is of those who err.
And abase me not on the day when they are raised,
The day when wealth and sons avail not (any man)
Save him who bringeth unto Allah a whole heart.
And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off\n\t\t\t(evil).
And hell will appear plainly to the erring.
And it will be said unto them: Where is (all) that ye used to\n\t\t\tworship
Instead of Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?
Then they will be hurled therein, they and the seducers
And the hosts of Iblis, together.
And they will say, when they are quarrelling therein:
By Allah, of a truth we were in error manifest
When we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds.
It was but the guilty who misled us.
Now we have no intercessors
Nor any loving friend.
Oh, that we had another turn (on earth), that we might be of the\n\t\t\tbelievers!
Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not\n\t\t\tbelievers!
And lo, thy Lord! He is Indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah),
When their brother Noah said unto them: Will ye not ward off\n\t\t\t(evil)?
Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,
So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.
And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Worlds.
So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.
They said: Shall we put faith in thee, when the lowest (of the\n\t\t\tpeople) follow thee?
He said: And what knowledge have I of what they may have been\n\t\t\tdoing (in the past)?
Lo! their reckoning is my Lord's concern, if ye but knew;
And I am not (here) to repulse believers.
I am only a plain warner.
They said: If thou cease not, O Noah, thou wilt surely be among\n\t\t\tthose stoned (to death).
He said: My Lord! Lo! my own folk deny me.
Therefor judge Thou between us, a (conclusive) judgment, and save\n\t\t\tme and those believers who are with me.
And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
Then afterward We drowned the others.
Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not\n\t\t\tbelievers.
And lo, thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
(The tribe of) Aad denied the messengers (of Allah),
When their brother Hud said unto them: Will ye not ward off\n\t\t\t(evil)?
Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,
So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.
And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Worlds.
Build ye on every high place a monument for vain delight?
And seek ye out strongholds, that haply ye may last for ever?
And if ye seize by force, seize ye as tyrants?
Rather keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.
Keep your duty toward Him who hath aided you with (the good\n\t\t\tthings) that ye know,
Hath aided you with cattle and sons.
And gardens and watersprings.
Lo! I fear for you the retribution of an awful day.
They said: It is all one to us whether thou preachest or art not\n\t\t\tof those who preach;
This is but a fable of the men of old,
And we shall not be doomed.
And they denied him; therefor We destroyed them. Lo! herein is\n\t\t\tindeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.
And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
(The tribe of) Thamud denied the messengers (of Allah)
When their brother Salih said unto them: Will ye not ward off\n\t\t\t(evil)?
Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,
So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.
And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Worlds.
Will ye be left secure in that which is here before us,
In gardens and watersprings
And tilled fields and heavy sheathed palm trees,
Though ye hew out dwellings in the mountain, being skilful?
Therefor keep your duty to Allah and obey me,
And obey not the command of the prodigal,
Who spread corruption in the earth, and reform not.
They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched;
Thou art but a mortal like us. So bring some token if thou art of\n\t\t\tthe truthful.
He said: (Behold) this she-camel. She hath the right to drink (at\n\t\t\tthe well), and ye have the right to drink, (each) on an appointed\n\t\t\tday.
And touch her not with ill lest there come on you the retribution\n\t\t\tof an awful day.
But they hamstrung her, and then were penitent.
So the retribution came on them. Lo! herein is indeed a portent,\n\t\t\tyet most of them are not believers.
And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
The folk of Lot denied the messengers (of Allah),
When their brother Lot said unto them: Will ye not ward off\n\t\t\t(evil)?
Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,
So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.
And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Worlds.
What! Of all creatures do ye come unto the males,
And leave the wives your Lord created for you? Nay, but ye are\n\t\t\tfroward folk.
They said: If thou cease not, O Lot, thou wilt soon be of the\n\t\t\toutcast.
He said: I am in truth of those who hate your conduct.
My Lord! Save me and my household from what they do.
So We saved him and his household, every one,
Save an old woman among those who stayed behind.
Then afterward We destroyed the others.
And We rained on them a rain. And dreadful is the rain of those\n\t\t\twho have been warned.
Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not\n\t\t\tbelievers.
And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
The dwellers in the wood (of Midian) denied the messengers (of\n\t\t\tAllah),
When Shueyb said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?
Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,
So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.
And I ask of you no wage for it; my wage is the concern only of\n\t\t\tthe Lord of the Worlds.
Give full measure, and be not of those who give less (than the\n\t\t\tdue).
And weigh with the true balance.
Wring not mankind in their goods, and do not evil, making\n\t\t\tmischief, in the earth.
And keep your duty unto Him Who created you and the generations\n\t\t\tof the men of old.
They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched;
Thou art but a mortal like us, and lo! we deem thee of the liars.
Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us, if thou art of\n\t\t\tthe truthful.
He said: My Lord is best aware of what ye do.
But they denied him, so there came on them the retribution of the\n\t\t\tday of gloom. Lo! it was the retribution of an awful day.
Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not\n\t\t\tbelievers.
And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
And lo! it is a revelation of the Lord of the Worlds,
Which the True Spirit hath brought down
Upon thy heart, that thou mayest be (one) of the warners,
In plain Arabic speech.
And lo, it is in the Scriptures of the men of old.
Is it not a token for them that the doctors of the Children of\n\t\t\tIsrael know it?
And if We had revealed it unto one of any other nation than the\n\t\t\tArabs,
And he had read it unto them, they would not have believed in it.
Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty.
They will not believe in it till they behold the painful doom,
So that it will come upon them suddenly, when they perceive not.
Then they will say: Are we to be reprieved?
Would they (now) hasten on Our doom?
Hast thou then seen, We content them for (long) years,
And then cometh that which they were promised,
(How) that wherewith they were contented naught availeth them?
And We destroyed no township but it had its warners
For reminder, for We never were oppressors.
The devils did not bring it down.
It is not meet for them, nor is it in their power,
Lo! verily they are banished from the hearing.
Therefor invoke not with Allah another god, lest thou be one of\n\t\t\tthe doomed.
And warn thy tribe of near kindred,
And lower thy wing (in kindness) unto those believers who follow\n\t\t\tthee.
And if they (thy kinsfolk) disobey thee, say: Lo! I am innocent\n\t\t\tof what they do.
And put thy trust in the Mighty, the Merciful.
Who seeth thee when thou standest up (to pray)
And (seeth) thine abasement among those who fall prostrate (in\n\t\t\tworship).
Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the Knower.
Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
They descend on every sinful, false one.
They listen eagerly, but most of them are liars.
As for poets, the erring follow them.
Hast thou not seen how they stray in every valley,
And how they say that which they do not?

Save those who believe and do good works, and remember Allah
			much, and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged.
			Those who do wrong will come to know by what a (great) reverse
			they will be overturned!
Ta. Sin. These are revelations of the Qur'an and a Scripture that\n\t\t\tmaketh plain;
A guidance and good tidings for believers
Who establish worship and pay the poor due and are sure of the\n\t\t\tHereafter.
Lo! as for those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made\n\t\t\ttheir works fair seeming unto them so that they are all astray.
Those are they for whom is the worst of punishment, and in the\n\t\t\tHereafter they will be the greatest losers.
Lo! as for thee (Muhammad), thou verily receivest the Quran from\n\t\t\tthe presence of One Wise, Aware.
(Remember) when Moses said unto his household: Lo! I spy afar off\n\t\t\ta fire; I will bring you tidings thence, or bring to you a\n\t\t\tborrowed flame that ye may warm yourselves.
But when he reached it, he was called, saying: Blessed is\n\t\t\twhosoever is in the fire and whosoever is round about it! And\n\t\t\tglorified be Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!
O Moses! Lo! it is I, Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.

And throw down thy staff! But when he saw it writhing as it were\n\t\t\ta demon, he turned to flee headlong; (but it was said unto him):\n\t\t\tO Moses! Fear not! Lo! the emissaries fear not in My presence,
Save him who hath done wrong and afterward hath changed evil for\n\t\t\tgood. And lo! I am Forgiving, Merciful.
And put thy hand into the bosom of thy robe, it will come forth\n\t\t\twhite but unhurt. (This will be one) among name tokens unto\n\t\t\tPharaoh and his people. Lo! they were ever evil living folk.
But when Our tokens came unto them, plain to see, they said: This\n\t\t\tis mere magic,
And they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, for\n\t\t\tspite and arrogance. Then see the nature of the consequence for\n\t\t\tthe wrong-doers!
And We verily gave knowledge unto David and Solomon, and they\n\t\t\tsaid: Praise be to Allah, Who hath preferred us above many of His\n\t\t\tbelieving slaves!
And Solomon was David's heir. And he said: O mankind! Lo! we have\n\t\t\tbeen taught the language of birds, and have been given\n\t\t\t(abundance) of all things. This surely is evident favor.
And there were gathered together unto Solomon his armies of the\n\t\t\tjinn and humankind, and of the birds, and they were set in battle\n\t\t\torder;
Till, when they reached the Valley of the Ants, an ant exclaimed:\n\t\t\tO ants! Enter your dwellings lest Solomon and his armies crush\n\t\t\tyou, unperceiving.

And (Solomon) smiled, laughing at her speech, and said: My Lord,
			arouse me to be thankful for Thy favor wherewith Thou hast
			favored me and my parents, and to do good that shall be pleasing
			unto Thee, and include me in (the number of) Thy righteous
			slaves.
And he sought among the birds and said: How is it that I see not\n\t\t\tthe hoopoe, or is he among the absent?
I verily will punish him with hard punishment or I verily will\n\t\t\tslay him, or he verily shall bring me a plain excuse.
But he was not long in coming, and he said: I have found out (a\n\t\t\tthing) that thou apprehendest not, and I come unto thee from\n\t\t\tSheba with sure tidings.
Lo! I found a woman ruling over them, and she hath been given\n\t\t\t(abundance) of all things, and hers is a mighty throne.

I found her and her people worshipping the sun instead of Allah;
			and Satan maketh their works fair seeming unto them, and
			debarreth them from the way (of Truth), so that they go not
			aright:
So that they worship not Allah, Who bringeth forth the hidden in\n\t\t\tthe heavens and the earth, and knoweth what ye hide and what ye\n\t\t\tproclaim,
Allah; there is no God save Him, the Lord of the tremendous\n\t\t\tThrone.
(Solomon) said: We shall see whether thou speakest truth or\n\t\t\twhether thou art of the liars.
Go with this my letter and throw it down unto them; then turn\n\t\t\taway and see what (answer) they return,
(The Queen of Sheba ) said (when she received the letter): O\n\t\t\tchieftains! Lo! there hath been thrown unto me a noble letter.
Lo! it is from Solomon, and lo! it is: In the name of Allah the\n\t\t\tBeneficent, the Merciful;
Exalt not yourselves against me, but come unto me as those who\n\t\t\tsurrender.
She said: O chieftains! Pronounce for me in my case. I decide no\n\t\t\tcase till ye are present with me.
They said: We are lords of might and lords of great prowess, but\n\t\t\tit is for thee to command; so consider what thou wilt command.
She said: Lo! kings, when they enter a township, ruin it and make\n\t\t\tthe honor of its people shame. Thus will they do.
But lo! I am going to send a present unto them, and to see with\n\t\t\twhat (answer) the messengers return.

So when (the envoy) came unto Solomon, (the King) said: What!
			Would ye help me with wealth? But that which Allah hath given me
			is better than that which He hath given you. Nay it is ye (and
			not I) who exult in your gift.
Return unto them. We verily shall come unto them with hosts that\n\t\t\tthey cannot resist, and we shall drive them out from thence with\n\t\t\tshame, and they will be abased.
He said: O chiefs! Which of you will bring me her throne before\n\t\t\tthey come unto me, surrendering?
A stalwart of the Jinn said: I will bring it thee before thou\n\t\t\tcanst rise from thy place. Lo! I verily am strong and trusty for\n\t\t\tsuch work.

One with whom was knowledge of the Scripture said: I will bring
			it thee before thy gaze returneth unto thee. And when he saw it
			set in his presence, (Solomon said: This is of the bounty of my
			Lord, that He may try me whether I give thanks or am ungrateful.
			Whosoever giveth thanks he only giveth thanks for (the good of)
			his own soul: and whosoever is ungrateful (is ungrateful only to
			his own soul's hurt). For lo! my Lord is Absolute in
			independence, Bountiful.
He said: Disguise her throne for her that we may see whether she\n\t\t\twill go aright or be of those not rightly guided.

So, when she came, it was said (unto her): Is thy throne like
			this? She said: (It is) as though it were the very one. And
			(Solomon said): We were given the knowledge before her and we had
			surrendered (to Allah).
And (all) that she was wont to worship instead of Allah hindered\n\t\t\ther, for she came of disbelieving folk.

It was said unto her: Enter the hall. And when she saw it she
			deemed it a pool and bared her legs. (Solomon) said: Lo! it is a
			hall, made smooth, of glass. She said: My Lord! Lo! I have
			wronged myself, and I surrender with Solomon unto Allah, the Lord
			of the Worlds.
And We verily sent until Thamud their brother Salih, saying:\n\t\t\tWorship Allah. And lo! they (then) became two parties\n\t\t\tquarrelling.
He said: O my people! Why will ye hasten on the evil rather than\n\t\t\tthe good? Why will ye not ask pardon of Allah, that ye may\n\t\t\treceive mercy.
They said: We augur evil of thee and those with thee. He said:\n\t\t\tYour evil augury is with Allah. Nay, but ye are folk that are\n\t\t\tbeing tested.
And there were in the city nine persons who made mischief in the\n\t\t\tland and reformed not.

They said: Swear one to another by Allah that we verily will
			attack him and his household by night, and afterward we will
			surely say unto his friend: We witnessed not the destruction of
			his household. And lo! we are truthtellers.
So they plotted a plot: and We plotted a plot, while they\n\t\t\tperceived not.
Then see the nature of the consequence of their plotting, for lo!\n\t\t\tWe destroyed them and their people, every one.
See, yonder are their dwellings empty and in ruins because they\n\t\t\tdid wrong. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for a people who have\n\t\t\tknowledge.
And we saved those who believed and used to ward off (evil).
And Lot! when he said unto his folk: will ye commit abomination\n\t\t\tknowingly?
Must ye needs lust after men instead of women? Nay, but ye are\n\t\t\tfolk who act senselessly.
But the answer of his folk was naught save that they said: Expel\n\t\t\tthe household of Lot from your township, for they (forsooth) are\n\t\t\tfolk who would keep clean!
Then we saved him and his household save his wife; We destined\n\t\t\ther to be of those who stayed behind.
And We rained a rain upon them. Dreadful is the rain of those who\n\t\t\thave been warned.
Say (O Muhammad): Praise be to Allah, and peace be on His slaves\n\t\t\twhom He hath chosen! Is Allah best, or (all) that ye ascribe as\n\t\t\tpartners (unto Him)?

Is not He (best) who created the heavens and the earth, and
			sendeth down for you water from the sky wherewith We cause to
			spring forth joyous orchards, whose trees it never hath been
			yours to cause to grow. Is there any God beside Allah? Nay, but
			they are folk who ascribe equals (unto Him)!

Is not He (best) Who made the earth a fixed abode, and placed
			rivers in the folds thereof, and placed firm hills therein, and
			hath set a barrier between the two seas? Is there any God beside
			Allah? Nay, but most of them know not!

Is not He (best) who answereth the wronged one when he crieth\n\t\t\tunto Him and removeth the evil, and hath made you viceroys of the\n\t\t\tearth? Is there any God beside Allah? Little do they reflect!

Is not He (best) Who guideth you in the darkness of the land and
			the sea, He Who sendeth the winds as heralds of His mercy? Is
			there any God beside Allah? High exalted be Allah from all that
			they ascribe as partner (unto Him)!

Is not He (best), Who produceth creation, then reproduceth it,\n\t\t\tand Who provideth for you from the heaven and the earth? Is there\n\t\t\tany God beside Allah? Say: Bring your proof, if ye are truthful!
Say (O Muhammad): None in the heavens and the earth knoweth the\n\t\t\tUnseen save Allah; and they know not when they will be raised\n\t\t\t(again).
Nay, but doth their knowledge reach to the Hereafter? Nay, for\n\t\t\tthey are in doubt concerning it. Nay, for they cannot see it.
Yet those who disbelieve say: when we have become dust like our\n\t\t\tfathers, shall we verily be brought forth (again)?
We were promised this, forsooth, we and our fathers. (All) this\n\t\t\tis naught but fables of the men of old.
Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Travel in the land and see the\n\t\t\tnature of the sequel for the guilty!
And grieve thou not for them, nor be in distress because of what\n\t\t\tthey plot (against thee).
And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are\n\t\t\ttruthful?
Say: It may be that a part of that which ye would hasten on is\n\t\t\tclose behind you.
Lo! thy Lord is full of bounty for mankind, but most of them do\n\t\t\tnot give thanks.
Lo! thy Lord knoweth surely all that their bosoms hide, and all\n\t\t\tthat they proclaim.
And there is nothing hidden in the heaven or the earth but it is\n\t\t\tin a clear Record.
Lo! this Qur'an narrateth unto the Children of Israel most of\n\t\t\tthat concerning which they differ.
And lo! it is a guidance and a mercy for believers.
Lo! thy Lord will judge between them of His wisdom, and He is the\n\t\t\tMighty, the Wise.
Therefor (O Muhammad) put thy trust in Allah, for thou (standest)\n\t\t\ton the plain Truth.
Lo! thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the\n\t\t\tdeaf to hear the call when they have turned to flee;
Nor canst thou lead the blind out of their error. Thou canst make\n\t\t\tnone to hear, save those who believe Our revelations and who have\n\t\t\tsurrendered.
And when the word is fulfilled concerning them, We shall bring\n\t\t\tforth a beast of the earth to speak unto them because mankind had\n\t\t\tnot faith in Our revelations.
And (remind them of) the Day when We shall gather out of every\n\t\t\tnation a host of those who denied Our revelations, and they will\n\t\t\tbe set in array;
Till, when they come (before their Lord), He will say: Did ye\n\t\t\tdeny My revelations when ye could not compass them in knowledge,\n\t\t\tor what was it that ye did?
And the Word will be fulfilled concerning them because they have\n\t\t\tdone wrong, and they will not speak.
Have they not seen how We have appointed the night that they may\n\t\t\trest therein, and the day sight giving? Lo! therein verily are\n\t\t\tportents for a people who believe.

And (remind them of) the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, and\n\t\t\tall who are in the heavens and the earth will start in fear, save\n\t\t\thim whom Allah willeth. And all come unto Him, humbled.
And thou seest the hills thou deemest solid flying with the\n\t\t\tflight of clouds: the doing of Allah Who perfecteth all things.\n\t\t\tLo! He is Informed of what ye do.
Whoso bringeth a good deed will have better than its worth; and\n\t\t\tsuch are safe from fear that Day.
And whoso bringeth an ill deed, such will be flung down on their\n\t\t\tfaces in the Fire. Are ye rewarded aught save what ye did?
(Say): I (Muhammad) am commanded only to serve the Lord of this\n\t\t\tland which He hath hallowed, and unto Whom all things belong. And\n\t\t\tI am commanded to be of those who surrender (unto Him),
And to recite the Qur'an. And whoso goeth right, goeth right only\n\t\t\tfor (the good of) his own soul; and as for him who goeth astray\n\t\t\t(unto him) say: Lo! I am only a warner.
And say: Praise be to Allah who will show you His portents so\n\t\t\tthat ye shall know them. And thy Lord is not unaware of what ye\n\t\t\t(mortals) do.
Ta.Sin.Mim.
These are revelations of the Scripture that maketh plain.
We narrate unto thee (somewhat) of the story of Moses and Pharaoh\n\t\t\twith truth, for folk who believe.

Lo! Pharaoh exalted himself in the earth and made its people\n\t\t\tcastes. A tribe among them he suppressed, killing their sons and\n\t\t\tsparing their women. Lo! he was of those who work corruption.
