(The people of the city) said: We augur ill of you. If ye desist\n\t\t\tnot, we shall surely stone you, and grievous torture will befall\n\t\t\tyou at our hands.
They said: Your evil augury be with you! Is it because ye are\n\t\t\treminded (of the truth)? Nay, but ye are froward folk?
And there came from the uttermost part of the city a man running.\n\t\t\tHe cried: O my people! Follow those who have been sent!
Follow those who ask of you no fee, and who are rightly guided.
For what cause should I not serve Him Who hath created me, and\n\t\t\tunto Whom ye will be brought back?
Shall I take (other) gods in place of Him when, if the Beneficent\n\t\t\tshould wish me any harm, their intercession will avail me naught,\n\t\t\tnor can they save?
Then truly I should be in error manifest.
Lo! I have believed in your Lord, so hear me!
It was said (unto him): Enter Paradise. He said: Would that my\n\t\t\tpeople knew
With what (munificence) my Lord hath pardoned me and made me of\n\t\t\tthe honored ones!
We sent not down against his people after him a host from heaven,\n\t\t\tnor do We ever send.
It was but one Shout, and lo! they were extinct.
Ah, the anguish for the bondmen! Never came there unto them a\n\t\t\tmessenger but they did mock him!
Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them,\n\t\t\twhich indeed return not unto them;
But all, without exception, will be brought before Us.
A token unto them is the dead earth. We revive it, and We bring\n\t\t\tforth from it grain so that they eat thereof;
And We have placed therein gardens of the date palm and grapes,\n\t\t\tand We have caused springs of water to gush forth therein.
That they may eat of the fruit thereof, and their hand made it\n\t\t\tnot. Will they not, then, give thanks?
Glory be to Him Who created all the sexual pairs, of that which\n\t\t\tthe earth groweth, and of themselves, and of that which they know\n\t\t\tnot!
A token unto them is night. We strip it of the day, and lo! they\n\t\t\tare in darkness.
And the sun runneth on unto a resting place for him. That is the\n\t\t\tmeasuring of the Mighty, the Wise.
And for the moon We have appointed mansions till she return like\n\t\t\tan old shrivelled palm leaf.
It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor doth the night\n\t\t\toutstrip the day. They float each in an orbit.
And a token unto them is that We bear their offspring in the\n\t\t\tladen ship,
And have created for them of the like thereof whereon they ride.
And if We will, We drown them, and there is no help for them,\n\t\t\tneither can they be saved;
Unless by mercy from Us and as comfort for a while.
When it is said unto them: Beware of that which is before you and\n\t\t\tthat which is behind you, that haply ye may find mercy (they are\n\t\t\theedless).
Never came a token of the tokens of their Lord to them, but they\n\t\t\tdid turn away from it!

And when it is said unto them: Spend of that wherewith Allah hath
			provided you. those who disbelieve say unto those who believe:
			Shall we feed those whom Allah, if He willed, would feed? Ye are
			in naught else than error manifest.
And they say: When will this promise be fulfilled, if ye are\n\t\t\ttruthful?
They await but one Shout, which will surprise them while they are\n\t\t\tdisputing.
Then they cannot make bequest, nor can they return to their own\n\t\t\tfolk.
And the trumpet is blown and lo! from the graves they hie unto\n\t\t\ttheir Lord,
Crying: Woe upon us! Who hath raised us from our place of sleep?\n\t\t\tThis is that which the Beneficent did promise, and the messengers\n\t\t\tspoke truth,
It is but one Shout, and behold them brought together before Us!
This day no soul is wronged in aught; nor are ye requited aught\n\t\t\tsave what ye used to do.
Lo! those who merit paradise this day are happily employed,
They and their wives, in pleasant shade, on thrones reclining;
Theirs the fruit (of their good deeds) and theirs (all) that they\n\t\t\task;
The word from a Merciful Lord (for them) is: Peace!
But avaunt ye, O ye guilty, this day!
Did I not charge you, O ye sons of Adam, that ye worship not the\n\t\t\tdevil Lo! he is your open foe!
But that ye worship Me? That was the right path.
Yet he hath led astray of you a great multitude. Had ye then no\n\t\t\tsense?
This is hell which ye were promised (if ye followed him).
Burn therein this day for that ye disbelieved.
This day We seal up mouths, and hands speak out and feet bear\n\t\t\twitness as to what they used to earn.
And had We willed, We verily could have quenched their eyesight\n\t\t\tso that they should struggle for the way. Then how could they\n\t\t\thave seen?
And had We willed, We verily could have fixed them in their\n\t\t\tplace, making them powerless to go forward or turn back.
He whom We bring unto old age, We reverse him in creation (making\n\t\t\thim go back to weakness after strength). Have ye then no sense?
And we have not taught him (Muhammad) poetry, nor is it meet for\n\t\t\thim. This is naught else than a Reminder and a Lecture making\n\t\t\tplain,
To warn whosoever liveth, and that the word may be fulfilled\n\t\t\tagainst the disbelievers.
Have they not seen how We have created for them of Our handiwork\n\t\t\tthe cattle, so that they are their owners,
And have subdued them unto them, so that some of them they have\n\t\t\tfor riding, some for food?
Benefits and (divers) drinks have they from them. Will they not\n\t\t\tthen give thanks?
And they have taken (other) gods beside Allah, in order that they\n\t\t\tmay be helped.
It is not in their power to help them; but they (the worshippers)\n\t\t\tare unto them a host in arms.
So let not their speech grieve thee (O Muhammad). Lo! We know\n\t\t\twhat they conceal and what proclaim.
Hath not man seen that We have created him from a drop of seed?\n\t\t\tYet lo! he is an open opponent.
And he hath coined for Us a similitude, and hath forgotten the\n\t\t\tfact of his creation, saying: Who will revive these bones when\n\t\t\tthey have rotted away?
Say: He will revive them Who produced them at the first, for He\n\t\t\tis Knower of every creation,
Who hath appointed for you fire from the green tree, and behold!\n\t\t\tye kindle from it.
Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth Able to create\n\t\t\tthe like of them? Aye, that He is! for He is the All-Wise\n\t\t\tCreator,
But His command, when He intendeth a thing, is only that he saith\n\t\t\tunto it: Be! and it is.
Therefor glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion over all\n\t\t\tthings! Unto Him ye will be brought back.
By those who set the ranks in battle order
And those who drive away (the wicked) with reproof
And those who read (the Word) for a reminder,
Lo! thy Lord is surely One.
Lord of the heavens and of the earth and all that is between\n\t\t\tthem, and Lord of the sun's risings.
Lo! We have adorned the lowest heaven with an ornament, the\n\t\t\tplanets:
With security from every froward devil.
They cannot listen to the Highest Chiefs for they are pelted from\n\t\t\tevery side,
Outcast, and theirs is a perpetual torment;
Save him who snatcheth a fragment, and there pursueth him a\n\t\t\tpiercing flame.
Then ask them (O Muhammad): Are they stronger as a creation, or\n\t\t\tthose (others) whom We have created? Lo! We created them of\n\t\t\tplastic clay.
Nay, but thou dost marvel when they mock
And heed not when they are reminded,
And seek to scoff when they behold a portent
And they say: lo! this is mere magic;
When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then,\n\t\t\tforsooth, be raised (again)?
And our forefathers?
Say (O Muhammad): Yea, in truth; and ye will be brought low.
There is but one Shout, and lo! they behold
And say: Ah, woe for us! This is the Day of Judgment.
This is the Day of Separation, which ye used to deny.
(And it is said unto the angels): Assemble those who did wrong,\n\t\t\ttogether with their wives and what they used to worship
Instead of Allah, and lead them to the path to hell;
And stop them, for they must be questioned.
What aileth you that ye help not one another?
Nay, but this day they make full submission.
And some of them draw near unto others, mutually questioning.
They say: Lo! ye used to come unto us, imposing, (swearing that\n\t\t\tye spoke the truth).
They answer: Nay, but ye (yourselves) were not believers.
We had no power over you, but ye were wayward folk.
Now the Word of our Lord hath been fulfilled concerning us. Lo!\n\t\t\twe are about to taste (the doom).
Thus we misled you. Lo! we were (ourselves) astray.
Then lo! this day they (both) are sharers in the doom.
Lo! thus deal We with the guilty.
For when it was said unto them, There is no god save Allah, they\n\t\t\twere scornful
And said: Shall we forsake our gods for a mad poet?
Nay, but he brought the Truth, and he confirmed those sent\n\t\t\t(before him).
Lo! (now) verily ye taste the painful doom--
Ye are requited naught save what ye did--
Save single-minded slaves of Allah;
For them there is a known provision,
Fruits. And they will be honored
In the Gardens of delight,
On couches facing one another
A cup from a gushing spring is brought round for them,
White, delicious to the drinkers,
Wherein there is no headache nor are they made mad thereby.
And with them are those of modest gaze, with lovely eyes,
(Pure) as they were hidden eggs (of the ostrich).
And some of them draw near unto others, mutually questioning.
A speaker of them saith: Lo! I had a comrade
Who used to say: Art thou in truth of those who put faith (in his\n\t\t\twords)?
Can we, when we are dead and have become mere dust and bones, can\n\t\t\twe (then) verily be brought to book?
He saith: Will ye look?
Then looketh he and seeth him in the depth of hell.
He saith: By Allah, thou verily didst all but cause my ruin,
And had it not been for the favor of my Lord, I too had been of\n\t\t\tthose haled forth (to doom).
Are we then not to die
Saving our former death, and are we not to be punished?
Lo! this is the supreme triumph.
For the like of this, then, let the workers work.
Is this better as a welcome, or the tree of Zaqqam?
Lo! We have appointed it a torment for wrong-doers.
Lo! it is a tree that springeth in the heart of hell
Its crop is as it were the heads of devils
And lo! they verily must eat thereof, and fill (their) bellies\n\t\t\ttherewith.
And afterward, lo! thereupon they have a drink of boiling water
And afterward, lo! their return is surely unto hell.
They indeed found their fathers astray,
But they make haste (to follow) in their footsteps.
And verily most of the men of old went astray before them,
And verily We sent among them warners.
Then see the nature of the consequence for those warned,
Save single-minded slaves of Allah.
And Noah verily prayed unto Us, and gracious was the Hearer of\n\t\t\this prayer
And We saved him and his household from the great distress,
And made his seed the survivors,
And left for him among the later folk (the salutation):
Peace be unto Noah among the peoples!
Lo! thus do We reward the good.
Lo! he is one of Our believing slaves.
Then We did drown the others.
And lo! of his persuasion verily was Abraham
When he came unto his Lord with a whole heart;
When he said unto his father and his folk: What is it that ye\n\t\t\tworship?
Is it a falsehood--gods beside Allah--that ye desire?
What then is your opinion of the Lord of the Worlds?
And he glanced a glance at the stars
Then said: Lo! I feel sick!
And they turned their backs and went away from him
Then turned he to their gods and said: Will ye not eat?
What aileth you that ye speak not?
Then he attacked them, striking with his right hand.
And (his people) came toward him, hastening.
He said: Worship ye that which ye yourselves do carve
When Allah hath created you and what ye make?
They said: Build for him a building and fling him in the red hot\n\t\t\tfire.
And they designed a snare for him, but We made them the\n\t\t\tundermost.
And he said: Lo! I am going unto my Lord Who will guide me.
My Lord! Vouchsafe me of the righteous.
So We gave him tidings of a gentle son.

And when (his son) was old enough to walk with him, (Abraham)
			said: O my dear son, I have seen in a dream that I must sacrifice
			thee. So look, what thinkest thou? He said: O my father! Do that
			which thou art commanded. Allah willing, thou shalt find me of
			the steadfast.
Then, when they had both surrendered (to Allah), and he had flung\n\t\t\thim down upon his face,
We called unto him: O Abraham:
Thou hast already fulfilled the vision. Lo! thus do We reward the\n\t\t\tgood.
Lo! that verily was a clear test.
Then We ransomed him with a tremendous victim.
And We left for him among the later folk (the salutation):
Peace be unto Abraham!
Thus do We reward the good.
Lo! he is one of Our believing slaves.
And We gave him tidings of the birth of Isaac, a Prophet of the\n\t\t\trighteous.
And We blessed him and Isaac. And of their seed are some who do\n\t\t\tgood, and some who plainly wrong themselves.
And We verily gave grace unto Moses and Aaron,
And saved them and their people from the great distress,
And helped them so that they became the victors.
And We gave them the clear Scripture
And showed them the right path.
And We left for them, among the later folk (the salutation):
Peace be unto Moses and Aaron!
Lo! thus do We reward the good.
Lo! they are two of our believing slaves.
And lo! Elias was of those sent (to warn)
When he said unto his folk: Will ye not ward off (evil)?
Will ye cry unto Baal and forsake the best of Creators,
Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?
But they denied him, so they surely will be haled forth (to the\n\t\t\tdoom)
Save single-minded slaves of Allah.
And we left for him among the later folk (the salutation):
Peace be unto Elias!
Lo! thus do We reward the good.
Lo! he is one of our believing slaves.
And lo! Lot verily was of those sent (to warn),
When We saved him and his household, every one,
Save an old woman among those who stayed behind;
Then We destroyed the others.
And Lo! ye verily pass by (the ruin of) them in the morning
And at night time; have ye then no sense?
And lo! Jonah verily was of those sent (to warn)
When he fled unto the laden ship,
And then drew lots and was of those rejected;
And the fish swallowed him while be was blameworthy;
And had he not been one of those who glorify (Allah)
He would have tarried in its belly till the day when they are\n\t\t\traised;
Then We cast him on a desert shore while he was sick;
And We caused a tree of gourd to grow above him;
And We sent him to a hundred thousand (folk) or more
And they believed, therefor We gave them comfort for a while.
Now ask them (O Muhammad): Hath thy Lord daughters whereas they\n\t\t\thave sons?
Or created We the angels females while they were present?
Lo! it is of their falsehood that they say:
Allah hath begotten. And lo! verily they tell a lie.
(And again of their falsehood): He hath preferred daughters to\n\t\t\tsons
What aileth you? How judge ye?
Will ye not then reflect?
Or have ye a clear warrant?
Then produce your writ, if ye are truthful.
And they imagine kinship between him and the jinn, whereas the\n\t\t\tjinn know well that they will be brought before (Him).
Glorified be Allah from that which they attribute (unto Him),
Save single-minded slaves of Allah.
Lo! verily, ye and that which ye worship,
Ye cannot excite (anyone) against Him
Save him who is to burn in hell.
There is not one of Us but hath his known position.
Lo! We, even We are they who set the ranks.
Lo! We, even We are they who hymn His praise
And indeed they used to say:
If we had but a reminder from the men of old
We would be single-minded slaves of Allah.
Yet (now that it is come) the, disbelieve therein: but they will\n\t\t\tcome to know.
And verily Our word went forth of old unto Our bondmen sent (to\n\t\t\twarn)
That they verily would be helped,
And that Our host, they verily would be the victors.
So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) awhile,
And watch, for they will (soon) see.
Would they hasten on Our doom?
But when it cometh home to them, then it will be a hapless morn\n\t\t\tfor those who have been warned.
Withdraw from them awhile
And watch, for they will (soon) see.
Glorified be thy Lord, the Lord of Majesty, from that which they\n\t\t\tattribute (unto Him)
And peace be unto those sent (to warn).
And praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds!
Sad. By the renowned Quran,
Nay, but those who disbelieve are in false pride and schism.
How many a generation We destroyed before them, and they cried\n\t\t\tout when it was no longer the time for escape!
And they marvel that a warner from among themselves hath come\n\t\t\tunto them, and the disbelievers say: This is a wizard, a\n\t\t\tcharlatan.
Maketh he the gods One God? Lo! that is an astounding thing.
The chiefs among them go about, exhorting: Go and be staunch to\n\t\t\tyour gods! Lo! this is a thing designed.
We have not heard of this in later religion. This is naught but\n\t\t\tan invention.
Hath the reminder been revealed unto him (alone) among us? Nay,\n\t\t\tbut they are in doubt concerning My reminder; nay but they have\n\t\t\tnot yet tasted My doom.
Or are theirs the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord, the Mighty,\n\t\t\tthe Bestower?
Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is\n\t\t\tbetween them theirs? Then let them ascend by ropes!
A defeated host are (all) the factions that are there.
The folk of Noah before them denied (their messenger) and (so did\n\t\t\tthe tribe of) Aad, and Pharaoh firmly planted,
And (the tribe of) Thamud; and the folk of Lot, and the dwellers\n\t\t\tin the wood: these were the factions.
Not one of them but did deny the messengers, therefor My doom was\n\t\t\tjustified,
These wait for but one Shout, there will be no second thereto.
They say: Our Lord! Hasten on for us our fate before the Day of\n\t\t\tReckoning.
Bear with what they say, and remember Our bondman David, lord of\n\t\t\tmight. Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).
Lo! We subdued the hills to hymn the praises (of their Lord) with\n\t\t\thim at nightfall and sunrise,
And the birds assembled; all were turning unto Him
We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom and decisive\n\t\t\tspeech.
And hath the story of the litigants come unto thee? How they\n\t\t\tclimbed the wall into the royal chamber;

How they burst in upon David, and he was afraid of them! They
			said: Be not afraid! (We are) two litigants, one of whom hath
			wronged the other, therefor judge aright between us; be not
			unjust; and show us the fair way.
Lo! this my brother hath ninety and nine ewes while I had one\n\t\t\tewe; and he said: Entrust it to me, and he conquered me in\n\t\t\tspeech.

(David) said: He hath wronged thee in demanding thine ewe in
			addition to his ewes, and lo! many partners oppress one another,
			save such as believe and do good works, and they are few. And
			David guessed that We had tried him, and he sought forgiveness of
			his Lord, and he bowed himself and fell down prostrate and
			repented.
So We forgave him that; and lo! he had access to Our presence and\n\t\t\ta happy journey's end.

(And it was said unto him): O David! Lo! We have set thee as a
			viceroy in the earth; therefor judge aright between mankind, and
			follow not desire that it beguile thee from the way of Allah. Lo!
			those who wander from the way of Allah have an awful doom,
			forasmuch as they forgot the Day of Reckoning.
And We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is\n\t\t\tbetween them in vain. That is the opinion of those who\n\t\t\tdisbelieve. And woe unto those who disbelieve, from the Fire!
Shall We treat those who believe and do good works as those who\n\t\t\tspread corruption in the earth; or shall We treat the Pious as\n\t\t\tthe wicked?
(This is) a Scripture that We have revealed unto thee, full of\n\t\t\tblessing, that they may ponder its revelations, and that men of\n\t\t\tunderstanding may reflect.
And We bestowed on David, Solomon. How excellent a slave! Lo! he\n\t\t\twas ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).
When there were shown to him at eventide lightfooted coursers
And he said: Lo! I have preferred the good things (of the world)\n\t\t\tto the remembrance of my Lord; till they were taken out of sight\n\t\t\tbehind the curtain.
(Then he said): Bring them back to me, and fell to slashing (with\n\t\t\this sword their) legs and necks.
And verily We tried Solomon, and set upon his throne a (mere)\n\t\t\tbody. Then did he repent.
He said: My Lord! Forgive me and bestow on me sovereignty such\n\t\t\tshall not belong to any after me. Lo! Thou art the Bestower.
So We made the wind subservient unto him, setting fair by his\n\t\t\tcommand whithersoever he intended.
And the unruly, every builder and diver (made We subservient),
And others linked together in chains,
(Saying): This is Our gift, so bestow thou, or withhold, without\n\t\t\treckoning.
And lo! he hath favor with Us, and a happy journey's end.
And make mention (O Muhammad) of Our bondman Job, when he cried\n\t\t\tunto his Lord (saying): Lo! the devil doth afflict me with\n\t\t\tdistress and torment.
(And it was said unto him): Strike the ground with thy foot. This\n\t\t\t(spring) is a cool bath and a refreshing drink.
And We bestowed on him (again) his household and therewith the\n\t\t\tlike thereof, a mercy from Us, and a memorial for men of\n\t\t\tunderstanding.

And (it was said unto him): Take in thine hand a branch and smite
			therewith, and break not twine oath. Lo! We found him steadfast,
			how excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (to
			his Lord).
And me mention of our bondmen, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of\n\t\t\tparts and vision.
Lo! We purified them with a pure thought, remembrance of the Home\n\t\t\t(of the Hereafter).
Lo! in Our sight they are verily of the elect, the excellent.
And make mention of Ishmael and Elisha and Dhul Kifl. All are of\n\t\t\tthe chosen.
This is a reminder. And lo! for those who ward off (evil) is a\n\t\t\thappy journey's end,
Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are opened for them.
Wherein, reclining, they call for plenteous fruit and cool drink\n\t\t\t(that is) therein.
And with them are those of modest gaze, companions.
This it is that ye are promised for the Day of Reckoning.
Lo! this in truth is Our provision, which will never waste away.
This (is for the righteous). And lo! for the transgressors there\n\t\t\twill be an evil journey's end,
Hell, where they will burn, an evil resting place.
Here is a boiling and an ice cold draught, so let them taste it,
And other (torment) of the kind in pairs (the two extremes)!
Here is an army rushing blindly with you. (Those who are already\n\t\t\tin the fire say): No word of welcome for them. Lo! they will\n\t\t\troast at the Fire.
They say: Nay, but you (misleaders), for you there is no word of\n\t\t\twelcome. Ye prepared this for us (by your misleading). Now\n\t\t\thapless is the plight.
They say: Our Lord! Whoever did prepare this for Us, oh, give him\n\t\t\tdouble portion of the Fire!
And they say: What aileth us that we behold not men whom we were\n\t\t\twont to count among the wicked?
Did we take them (wrongly) for a laughing-stock, or have our eyes\n\t\t\tmissed them?
Lo! that is very truth: the wrangling of the dwellers in the\n\t\t\tFire.
Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I am only a warner, and there is no\n\t\t\tGod save Allah, the One, the Absolute,
Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them,\n\t\t\tthe Mighty, the Pardoning.
Say: It is tremendous tidings
Whence ye turn away!
I had no knowledge of the Highest Chiefs when they disputed;
It is revealed unto me only that I may be a plain warner.
When thy Lord said unto the angels: lo! I am about to create a\n\t\t\tmortal out of mire,
And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My spirit,\n\t\t\tthen fall down before him prostrate,
The angels fell down prostrate, every one.
Saving Iblis; he was scornful and became one of the disbelievers.
He said: O Iblis! What hindereth thee from falling prostrate\n\t\t\tbefore that which I have created with both My hands? Art thou too\n\t\t\tproud or art thou of the high exalted?
He said: I am better than him. Thou createdst me of fire, whilst\n\t\t\thim Thou didst create of clay.
He said: Go forth from hence, for lo! thou art outcast,
And lo! My curse is on thee till the Day of Judgment.
He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.
He said: Lo! thou art of those reprieved
Until the day of the time appointed.
He said: Then, by Thy might, I surely will beguile them every\n\t\t\tone,
Save Thy single-minded slaves among them.
He said: The Truth is, and the Truth I speak,
That I shall fill hell with thee and with such of them as follow\n\t\t\tthee, together.
Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I ask of you no fee for this, and\n\t\t\tI am no impostor.
Lo! it is naught else than a reminder for all peoples
And ye will come in time to know the truth thereof.
The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the\n\t\t\tWise.
Lo! We have revealed the Scripture unto thee (Muhammad) with\n\t\t\ttruth; so worship Allah, making religion pure for Him (only).

Surely Pure religion is for Allah only. And those who choose
			protecting friends beside Him (say): We worship them only that
			they may bring us near unto Allah. Lo! Allah will judge between
			them concerning that wherein they differ. Lo! Allah guideth not
			him who is a liar, an ingrate.
If Allah had willed to choose a son, he could have chosen what he\n\t\t\twould of that which He hath created. Be He glorified! He is\n\t\t\tAllah, the One, the Absolute.

He hath created the heavens and the earth with truth. He maketh
			night to succeed day, and He maketh day to succeed night, and He
			constraineth the sun and the moon to give service, each running
			on for an appointed term. Is not He the Mighty, the Forgiver?

He created you from one being, then from that (being) He made its
			mate; and He hath provided for you of cattle eight kinds. He
			created you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after
			creation, in a threefold gloom. Such is Allah, your Lord. His is
			the Sovereignty. There is no God save Him. How then are ye turned
			away?

If ye are thankless, yet Allah is Independent of you, though He
			is not pleased with thanklessness for His bondmen; and if ye are
			thankful He is pleased therewith for you. No laden soul will bear
			another's load. Then unto your Lord is your return; and He will
			tell you what ye used to do. Lo! He knoweth what is in the
			breasts (of men).

And then some hurt toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning
			unto Him (repentant). Then, when He granteth him a boon from Him
			he forgetteth that for which he cried unto Him before, and
			setteth up rivals to Allah that he may beguile (men) from His
			way. Say (O Muhammad, unto such an one): Take pleasure in thy
			disbelief a while. Lo! thou art of the owners of the Fire.

Is he who payeth adoration in the watches of the night, prostrate
			and standing, bewaring of the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy
			of his Lord, (to be accounted equal with a disbeliever)? Say
			(unto them, O Muhammad): Are those who know equal with those who
			know not? But only men of understanding will pay heed.

Say: O My bondmen who believe! Observe your duty to your Lord.
			For those who do good in this world there is good, and Allah's
			earth is spacious. Verily the steadfast will be paid their wages
			without stint.
Say (O Muhammad): Lo! I am commanded to worship Allah, making\n\t\t\treligion pure for Him (only).
And I am commanded to be the first of those who surrender (unto\n\t\t\tHim).
Say: Lo! if I should disobey my Lord, I fear the doom of a\n\t\t\ttremendous Day.
Say: Allah I worship, making my religion pure for Him (only).
Then worship what ye will beside Him. Say: The losers will be\n\t\t\tthose who lose themselves and their housefolk on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection. Ah, that will be the manifest loss!
They have an awning of fire above them and beneath them a dais\n\t\t\t(of fire). With this doth Allah appall His bondmen. O My bondmen,\n\t\t\ttherefor fear Me!
And those who put away false gods lest they should worship them\n\t\t\tand turn to Allah in repentance, for them there are glad tidings.\n\t\t\tTherefor give good tidings (O Muhammad) to my bondmen
Who hear advice and follow the best thereof. Such are those whom\n\t\t\tAllah guideth, and such are men of understanding.
Is he on whom the word of doom is fulfilled (to be helped), and\n\t\t\tcanst thou (O Muhammad) rescue him who is in the Fire?

But those who keep their duty to their Lord, for them are lofty
			halls with lofty halls above them, built (for them), beneath
			which rivers flow. (It is) a promise of Allah. Allah faileth not
			His promise.

Hast thou not seen how Allah hath sent down water from the sky
			and hath caused it to penetrate the earth as water springs, and
			afterward thereby produceth crops of divers hues; and afterward
			they wither and thou seest them turn yellow; then He maketh them
			chaff. Lo! herein verily is a reminder for men of understanding.

Is he whose bosom Allah hath expanded for the Surrender (unto
			Him), so that he followeth a light from His Lord, (as he who
			disbelieveth)? Then woe unto those whose hearts are hardened
			against remembrance of Allah. Such are in plain error.

Allah hath (now) revealed the fairest of statements, a Scripture
			consistent, (wherein promises of reward are) paired (with threats
			of punishment), whereat doth creep the flesh of those who fear
			their Lord, so that their flesh and their hearts soften to
			Allah's reminder. Such is Allah's guidance, where with He guideth
			whom He will. And him whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is
			no guide.
Is he then, who will strike his face against the awful doom upon\n\t\t\tthe Day of Resurrection (as he who doeth right)? And it will be\n\t\t\tsaid unto the wrong doers: Taste what ye used to earn.
Those before them denied, and so the doom came on them whence\n\t\t\tthey knew not.
Thus Allah made them taste humiliation in the life of the world,\n\t\t\tand verily the doom of the Hereafter will be greater if they did\n\t\t\tbut know.
And verily We have coined for mankind in this Qur'an all kinds of\n\t\t\tsimilitudes, that haply they may reflect;
A Lecture in Arabic, containing no crookedness, that haply they\n\t\t\tmay ward off (evil).

Allah coineth a similitude: A man in relation to whom are several
			part owners, quarrelling, and a man belonging wholly to one man.
			Are the two equal in similitude? Praise be to Allah! But most of
			them know not.
Lo! thou wilt die, and lo! they will die;
Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord ye will\n\t\t\tdispute.
And who doth greater wrong than he who telleth a lie against\n\t\t\tAllah, and denieth the truth when it reacheth him? Will not the\n\t\t\thome of disbelievers be in hell?
And whoso bringeth the truth and believeth therein--Such are the\n\t\t\tdutiful.
They shall have what they will of their Lord's bounty. That is\n\t\t\tthe reward of the good:
That Allah will remit from them the worst of what they did, and\n\t\t\twill pay them for reward the best they used to do.
Will not Allah defend His slave? Yet they would frighten thee\n\t\t\twith those beside Him. He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him\n\t\t\tthere is no guide.
And he whom Allah guideth, for him there can be no misleader. Is\n\t\t\tnot Allah Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong)?

And verily, if thou shouldst ask them: Who created the heavens
			and the earth? they will say: Allah. Say: Bethink you then of
			those ye worship beside Allah, if Allah willed some hurt for me,
			could they remove from me His hurt; or if He willed some mercy
			for me, could they restrain His mercy? Say: Allah is my all. In
			Him do (all) the trusting put their trust.
Say: O my people! Act in your manner. I too am acting. Thus ye\n\t\t\twill come to know
Who it is unto whom cometh a doom that will abase him, and on\n\t\t\twhom there falleth everlasting doom.

Lo! We have revealed unto thee (Muhammad) the Scripture for
			mankind with truth. Then whosoever goeth right it is for his
			soul, and whosoever strayeth, strayeth only to its hurt. And thou
			art not a warder over them.

Allah receiveth (men's) souls at the time of their death, and
			that (soul) which dieth not (yet) in its sleep. He keepeth that
			(soul) for which He hath ordained death and dismisseth the rest
			till an appointed term. Lo herein verily are portents for people
			who take thought.
Or choose they intercessors other than Allah? Say: What! Even\n\t\t\tthough they have power over nothing and have no intelligence?
Say: Unto Allah belongeth all intercession. His is the\n\t\t\tSovereignty of the heavens and the earth. And afterward unto Him\n\t\t\tye will be brought back.
And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who\n\t\t\tbelieve not in the Hereafter are repelled, and when those (whom\n\t\t\tthey worship) beside Him are mentioned, behold! they are glad.
Say: O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of the\n\t\t\tinvisible and the visible! Thou wilt judge between Thy slaves\n\t\t\tconcerning that wherein they used to differ.

And though those who do wrong possess all that is in the earth,
			and therewith as much again, the verily will seek to ransom
			themselves therewith on the Day of Resurrection from the awful
			doom; and there will appear unto them, from their Lord, that
			wherewith they never reckoned.
And the evils that they earned will appear unto them, and that\n\t\t\twhereat they used to scoff will surround them.

Now when hurt toucheth a man he crieth unto Us, and afterward
			when We have granted him a boon from Us, he saith: Only by force
			of knowledge I obtained it. Nay, but it is a test. But most of
			them know not.
Those before them said it, yet (all) that they had earned availed\n\t\t\tthem not;
But the evils that they earned smote them; and such of these as\n\t\t\tdo wrong, the evils that they earn will smite them; they cannot\n\t\t\tescape.
Know they not that Allah enlargeth providence for whom He will,\n\t\t\tand straiteneth it (for whom He will). Lo! herein verily are\n\t\t\tportents for people who believe.
Say: My slaves who have been prodigal to their own hurt! Despair\n\t\t\tnot of the mercy of Allah, Who forgiveth all sins. Lo! He is the\n\t\t\tForgiving, the Merciful.
Turn unto Him repentant, and surrender unto Him, before there\n\t\t\tcome unto you the doom, when ye cannot be helped.
And follow the better (guidance) of that which is revealed unto\n\t\t\tyou from your Lord, before the doom cometh on you suddenly when\n\t\t\tye know not,
Lest any soul should say Alas, my grief that I was unmindful of\n\t\t\tAllah, and I was indeed among the scoffers!
Or should say: if Allah had but guided me I should have been\n\t\t\tamong the dutiful!
Or should say, when it seeth the doom: Oh, that I had but a\n\t\t\tsecond chance that I might be among the righteous!
(But now the answer will be): Nay, for My revelations came unto\n\t\t\tthee, but thou didst deny them and wast scornful and wast among\n\t\t\tthe disbelievers.
And on the Day of Resurrection thou (Muhammad) seest those who\n\t\t\tlied concerning Allah with their faces blackened. Is not the home\n\t\t\tof the scorners in hell?
And Allah delivereth those who ward off (evil) because of their\n\t\t\tdeserts. Evil toucheth them not, nor do they grieve.
Allah is Creator of all things, and He is Guardian over all\n\t\t\tthings.
His are the keys of the heavens and the earth, and they who\n\t\t\tdisbelieve the revelations of Allah such are they who are the\n\t\t\tlosers.
Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): Do ye bid me serve other\n\t\t\tthan Allah? O ye fools!
And verily it hath been revealed unto thee as unto those before\n\t\t\tthee (saying): If thou ascribe a partner to Allah thy work will\n\t\t\tfail and thou indeed wilt be among the losers.
Nay, but Allah must thou serve, and be among the thankful!

And they esteem not Allah as He hath the right to be esteemed,
			when the whole earth is His handful on the Day of Resurrection,
			and the heavens are rolled in His right hand. Glorified is He and
			High Exalted from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him).
And the trumpet is blown, and all who are in the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth swoon away, save him whom Allah willeth. Then it is blown a\n\t\t\tsecond time, and behold them standing waiting!

And the earth shineth with the light of her Lord, and the Book is\n\t\t\tset up, and the Prophets and the witnesses are brought, and it is\n\t\t\tjudged between them with truth, and they are not wronged.
And each soul is paid in full for what it did. And He is best\n\t\t\taware of what they do.

And those who disbelieve are driven unto hell in troops till,
			when they reach it and the gates thereof are opened, and the
			warders thereof say unto them: Came there not unto you
			messenger's of your own, reciting unto you the revelations of
			your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this your Day? they
			say Yea, verily. But the word of doom for disbelievers is
			fulfilled.
It is said (unto them): Enter ye the gates of hell to dwell\n\t\t\ttherein. Thus hapless is the journey's end of the scorners.

And those who keep their duty to their Lord are driven unto the
			Garden in troops till, when they reach it, and the gates thereof
			are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Peace be unto
			you! Ye are good, so enter ye (the Garden of delight), to dwell
			therein;
They say: Praise be to Allah, Who hath fulfilled His promise unto\n\t\t\tus and hath made us inherit the land, sojourning in the Garden\n\t\t\twhere we will! So bounteous is the wage of workers.

And thou (O Muhammad) seest the angels thronging round the
			Throne, hymning the praises of their Lord. And they are judged
			aright. And it is said: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the
			Worlds!
Ha. Mim.
The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the\n\t\t\tKnower,
The Forgiver of sin, the Accepter of repentance, the Stern in\n\t\t\tpunishment, the Bountiful. There is no God save Him. Unto Him is\n\t\t\tthe journeying.
None argue concerning the revelations of Allah save those who\n\t\t\tdisbelieve, so let not their turn of fortune in the land deceive\n\t\t\tthee (O Muhammad).

The folk of Noah and the factions after them denied (their
			messengers) before these, and every nation purposed to seize
			their messenger and argued falsely, (thinking) thereby to refute
			the Truth. Then I seized them, and how (awful) was My punishment.
Thus was the word of thy Lord concerning those who disbelieve\n\t\t\tfulfilled: that they are owners of the Fire.

Those who bear the Throne, and all who are round about it, hymn
			the praises of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness
			for those who believe (saying): Our Lord! Thou comprehendest all
			things in mercy and knowledge, therefor forgive those who repent
			and follow Thy way. Ward off from them the punishment of hell!

Our Lord! And make them enter the Gardens of Eden which thou hast
			promised them, with such of their fathers and their wives and
			their descendants as do right. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the
			Mighty, the Wise.
And ward off from them ill deeds; and he from whom Thou wardest\n\t\t\toff ill deeds that day, him verily hast Thou taken into mercy.\n\t\t\tThat is the supreme triumph.

Lo! (on that day) those who disbelieve are informed by
			proclamation: Verily Allah's abhorrence is more terrible than
			your abhorrence one of another, when ye were called unto the
			faith but did refuse.
They say: Our Lord! Twice hast Thou made us die, and twice hast\n\t\t\tThou made us live. Now we confess our sins. Is there any way to\n\t\t\tgo out?

(It is said unto them): This is (your plight) because, when Allah
			only was invoked, ye disbelieved, but when some partner was
			ascribed to Him ye were believing. But the command belongeth only
			to Allah, the Sublime, the Majestic.
He it is who showeth you His portents, and sendeth down for you\n\t\t\tprovision from the sky. None payeth heed save him who turneth\n\t\t\t(unto Him) repentant.
Therefor (O believers) pray unto Allah, making religion pure for\n\t\t\tHim (only), however much the disbelievers be averse--
The Exalter of Ranks, the Lord of the Throne. He casteth the\n\t\t\tSpirit of His command upon whom He will of His slaves, that He\n\t\t\tmay warn of the Day of Meeting--
The day when they come forth, nothing of them being hidden from\n\t\t\tAllah. Whose is the sovereignty this day? It is Allah's, the One,\n\t\t\tthe Almighty.
This day is each soul requited that which it hath earned; no\n\t\t\twrong (is done) this day. Lo! Allah is swift at reckoning.

Warn them (O Muhammad) of the Day of the approaching (doom), when
			the hearts will be choking the throats, (when) there will be no
			friend for the wrong-doers, nor any intercessor who will be
			heard.
He knoweth the traitor of the eyes, and that which the bosoms\n\t\t\thide.
Allah judgeth with truth, while those to whom they cry instead of\n\t\t\tHim judge not at all. Lo! Allah, He is the Nearer, the Seer.

Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the
			consequence for those who disbelieved before them? They were
			mightier than these in power and (in the) traces (which they left
			behind them) in the earth. Yet Allah seized them for their sins,
			and they had no protector from Allah.
That was because their messengers kept bringing them clear proofs\n\t\t\t(of Allah's sovereignty) but they disbelieved; so Allah seized\n\t\t\tthem. Lo! He is Strong, Severe in punishment.
And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant
Unto Pharaoh and Haman and Korah, but they said: A lying\n\t\t\tsorcerer!
And when he brought them the Truth from Our presence, they said:\n\t\t\tSlay the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their\n\t\t\twomen. But the plot of disbelievers is in naught but error.
And Pharaoh said: Suffer me to kill Moses, and let him cry unto\n\t\t\this Lord. Lo! I fear that he will alter your religion or that he\n\t\t\twill cause confusion in the land.
Moses said: Lo! I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every\n\t\t\tscorner who believeth not in a Day of Reckoning.

And a believing man of Pharaoh's family, who hid his faith, said:
			Would ye kill a man because he saith: My Lord is Allah, and hath
			brought you clear proofs from your Lord? If he is lying, then his
			lie is upon him; and if he is truthful then some of that
			wherewith he threateneth you will strike you. Lo! Allah guideth
			not one who is a prodigal, a liar.

O my people! Yours is the kingdom today, ye being uppermost in
			the land. But who would save us from the wrath of Allah should it
			reach us? Pharaoh said: I do but show you what I think, and I do
			but guide you to wise policy.
And he who believed said: O my people! Lo! I fear for you a fate\n\t\t\tlike that of the factions (of old);
A plight like that of Noah's folk, and Aad and Thamud, and those\n\t\t\tafter them, and Allah willeth no injustice for (His) slaves.
And, O my people! Lo! I fear for a Day of Summoning,
A day when ye will turn to flee, having no preserver from Allah:\n\t\t\tand he whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.

And verily Joseph brought you of old clear proofs, yet ye ceased
			not to be in doubt concerning what be brought you till, when he
			died, he said: Allah will not send any messenger after him. Thus
			Allah deceiveth him who is a prodigal, a doubter.

Those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah without any
			warrant that hath come unto them, it is greatly hateful in the
			sight of Allah and in the sight of those who believe. Thus doth
			Allah print on every arrogant, disdainful heart.
And Pharaoh said: O Haman! Build for me a tower that haply I may\n\t\t\treach the roads,

The roads of the heavens, and may look upon the God of Moses,
			though verily I think him a liar. Thus was the evil that he did
			made fair seeming unto Pharaoh, and he was debarred from the
			(right) way. The plot of Pharaoh ended but in ruin.
And he who believed said: O my people! Follow me. I will show you\n\t\t\tthe way of right conduct.
O my people! Lo! this life of the world is but a passing comfort,\n\t\t\tand lo! the Hereafter, that is the enduring home.

Whoso doeth an ill deed, he will be repaid the like thereof,
			while whoso doeth right, whether male or female, and is a
			believer, (all) such will enter the Garden, where they will be
			nourished without stint.
And, O my people! What aileth me that I call you unto deliverance\n\t\t\twhen ye call me unto the Fire?
Ye call me to disbelieve in Allah and ascribe unto Him as\n\t\t\tpartners that whereof I have no knowledge, while I call you unto\n\t\t\tthe Mighty, the Forgiver.
Assuredly that whereunto ye call me hath no claim in the world or\n\t\t\tin the Hereafter, and our return will be unto Allah, and the\n\t\t\tprodigals will be owners of the fire.
And ye will remember what I say unto you. I confide my cause unto\n\t\t\tAllah. Lo! Allah is Seer of (His) slaves.
So Allah warded off from him the evils which they plotted, while\n\t\t\ta dreadful doom encompassed Pharaoh's folk.
The Fire; they are exposed to it morning and evening; and on the\n\t\t\tday when the Hour upriseth (it is said): Cause Pharaoh's folk to\n\t\t\tenter the most awful doom.
And when they wrangle in the fire, the weak say unto those who\n\t\t\twere proud: Lo! we were a following unto you: will ye therefor\n\t\t\trid us of a portion of the Fire?
Those who were proud say: Lo! we are all (together) herein. Lo!\n\t\t\tAllah hath judged between (His) slaves.
And those in the Fire say unto the guards of hell: Entreat your\n\t\t\tLord that He relieve us of a day of the torment.
They say: Came not your messengers unto you with clear proofs?\n\t\t\tThey say: Yea, verily. They say: Then do ye pray, although the\n\t\t\tprayer of disbelievers is in vain.
Lo! We verily do help Our messengers, and those who believe, in\n\t\t\tthe life of the world and on the day when the witnesses arise,
The day when their excuse availeth not the evil doers, and theirs\n\t\t\tis the curse, and theirs the ill abode.
And we verily gave Moses the guidance, and We caused the Children\n\t\t\tof Israel to inherit the Scripture,
A guide and a reminder for men of understanding.
Then have patience (O Muhammad). Lo! the promise of Allah is\n\t\t\ttrue. And ask forgiveness of thy sin, and hymn the praise of thy\n\t\t\tLord at fall of night and in the early hours.

Lo! those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah without
			a warrant having come unto them, there is naught else in their
			breasts save pride which they will never attain. So take thou
			refuge in Allah. Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the Seer.
Assuredly the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater\n\t\t\tthan the creation of mankind; but most of mankind know not.
And the blind man and the seer are not equal, neither are those\n\t\t\twho believe and do good works (equal with) the evil doer. Little\n\t\t\tdo ye reflect!
Lo! the Hour is surely coming, there is no doubt thereof; yet\n\t\t\tmost of mankind believe not.
And your Lord hath said: Pray unto me and I will hear your\n\t\t\tprayer. Lo! those who scorn My service, they will enter hell,\n\t\t\tdisgraced.
Allah it is Who hath appointed for you night that ye may rest\n\t\t\ttherein, and day for seeing. Lo! Allah is a Lord of bounty for\n\t\t\tmankind, yet most of mankind give not thanks.
Such is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no\n\t\t\tGod save Him. How then are ye perverted?
Thus are they perverted who deny the revelations of Allah.

Allah it is Who appointed for you the earth for a dwelling place
			and the sky for a canopy, and fashioned you and perfected your
			shapes, and hath provided you with good things. Such is Allah,
			your Lord. Then blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!
He is the Living One. There is no God save Him. So pray unto Him,\n\t\t\tmaking religion pure for Him (only). Praise be to Allah, the Lord\n\t\t\tof the Worlds!

Say (O Muhammad): I am forbidden to worship those unto whom ye
			cry beside Allah since there have come unto me clear proofs from
			my Lord, and I am commanded to surrender to the Lord of the
			Worlds.

He it is Who created you from dust, then from a drop (of seed)
			then from a clot, then bringeth you forth as a child, then
			(ordaineth) that ye attain full strength and afterward that ye
			become old men though some among you die before and that ye reach
			an appointed term, that haply ye may understand.
He it is who quickeneth and giveth death. When He ordaineth a\n\t\t\tthing, He saith unto it only: Be! and it is.
Hast thou not seen those who wrangle concerning the revelations\n\t\t\tof Allah, how they are turned away?
Those who deny the Scripture and that wherewith we send Our\n\t\t\tmessengers. But they will come to know,
When carcans are about their necks and chains. They are dragged
Through boiling waters; then they are thrust into the Fire.
Then it is said unto them: Where are (all) that ye used to make\n\t\t\tpartners (in the Sovereignty)
Beside Allah? They say: They have failed us: but we used not to\n\t\t\tpray to anything before. Thus doth Allah send astray the\n\t\t\tdisbelievers (in His guidance).
(And it is said unto them): This is because ye exulted in the\n\t\t\tearth without right, and because ye were petulant.
Enter ye the gates of hell, to dwell therein. Evil is the\n\t\t\thabitation of the scornful.

Then have patience (O Muhammad). Lo! the promise of Allah is
			true. And whether we let thee see a part of that which We promise
			them, or (whether) We cause thee to die, still unto us they will
			be brought back.

Verily We sent messengers before thee, among them those of whom
			We have told thee, and some of whom We have not told thee; and it
			was not given to any messenger that he should bring a portent
			cave by Allah's leave, but when Allah's commandment cometh (the
			cause) is judged aright, and the followers of vanity will then be
			lost.
Allah it is Who hath appointed for you cattle, that ye may ride\n\t\t\ton some of them, and eat of some--
(Many) benefits ye have from them and that ye may satisfy by\n\t\t\ttheir means a need that is in your breasts, and may be borne upon\n\t\t\tthem as upon the ship.
And He showeth you His tokens. Which, then, of the tokens of\n\t\t\tAllah do ye deny?

Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the
			consequence for those before them? They were more numerous than
			these, and mightier in power and (in the) traces (which they left
			behind them) in the earth. But all that they used to earn availed
			them not.

And when their messengers brought them clear proofs (of Allah's\n\t\t\tSovereignty) they exulted in the knowledge they (themselves)\n\t\t\tpossessed. And that which they were wont to mock befell them.
Then, when they saw Our doom, they said: We believe in Allah only\n\t\t\tand reject (all) that we used to associate (with Him).
But their faith could not avail them when they saw Our doom. This\n\t\t\tis Allah's law which hath ever taken course for his Bondsmen. And\n\t\t\tthen the disbelievers will be ruined.
Ha. Mim.
A revelation from the Beneficent, the Merciful.
A scripture whereof the verses are expounded, a Lecture in Arabic\n\t\t\tfor people who have knowledge.
Good tidings and a warning. But most of them turn away so that\n\t\t\tthey hear not.

And they say: Our hearts are protected from that unto which thou
			(O Muhammad) callest us, and in our ears there is a deafness, and
			between us and thee there is a veil. Act, then. Lo! we also shall
			be acting.

Say (unto them O Muhammad): I am only a mortal like you. It is
			inspired in me that your God is One God, therefor take the
			straight path unto Him and seek forgiveness of Him. And woe unto
			the idolaters,
Who give not the poor due, and who are disbelievers in the\n\t\t\tHereafter.
Lo! as for those who believe and do good works, for them is a\n\t\t\treward enduring.
Say (O Muhammad, unto the idolaters): Disbelieve ye verily in Him\n\t\t\tWho created the earth in two Days, and ascribe ye unto Him\n\t\t\trivals? He (and none else) is the Lord of the Worlds.
He placed therein firm hills rising above it, and blessed it and\n\t\t\tmeasured therein its sustenance in four Days, alike for (all) who\n\t\t\task;
Then turned He to the heaven when it was smoke, and said unto it\n\t\t\tand unto the earth: Come both of you, willingly or loth. They\n\t\t\tsaid: We come, obedient.

Then He ordained them seven heavens in two Days and inspired in
			each heaven its mandate; and we decked the nether heaven with
			lamps, and rendered it inviolable. That is the measuring of the
			Mighty, the Knower.
But if they turn away, then say: I warn you of a thunderbolt like\n\t\t\tthe thunderbolt (which fell of old upon the tribes) of Aad and\n\t\t\tThamud;

When their messengers came unto them from before them and behind
			them, saying: Worship none but Allah! they said: If our Lord had
			willed, He surely would have sent down angels (unto us), so lo!
			we are disbelievers in that wherewith ye have been sent.

As for Aad, they were arrogant in the land without right, and
			they said: Who is mightier than us in power? Could they not see
			that Allah Who created them, He was mightier than them in power?
			And they denied Our revelations.

Therefor We let loose on them a raging wind in evil days, that We
			might make them taste the torment of disgrace in the life of the
			world. And verily the doom of the Hereafter will be more
			shameful, and they will not be helped.
And as for Thamud, We gave them guidance, but they preferred\n\t\t\tblindness to the guidance, so the bolt of the doom of humiliation\n\t\t\tovertook them because of what they used to earn.
And We delivered those who believed and used to keep their duty\n\t\t\tto Allah.
And (make mention of) the day when the enemies of Allah are\n\t\t\tgathered unto the Fire, they are driven on
Till, when they reach it, their ears and their eyes and their\n\t\t\tskins testify against them as to what they used to do.

And they say unto their skins: Why testify ye against us? They\n\t\t\tsay: Allah hath given us speech Who giveth speech to all things,\n\t\t\tand Who created you at the first, and unto Whom ye are returned.
Ye did not hide yourselves lest your ears and your eyes and your\n\t\t\tskins should testify against you, but ye deemed that Allah knew\n\t\t\tnot much of what ye did.
That, your thought which ye did think about your Lord, hath\n\t\t\truined you; and ye find yourselves (this day) among the lost.
And though they are resigned, yet the Fire is still their home;\n\t\t\tand if they ask for favor, yet they are not of those unto whom\n\t\t\tfavor can be shown.

And We assigned them comrades (in the world), who made their
			present and their past fair seeming unto them. And the Word
			concerning nations of the jinn and humankind who passed away
			before them hath effect for them. Verily they are the losers.
Those who disbelieve say: Heed not this Qur'an, and drown the\n\t\t\thearing of it; haply ye may conquer.
But verily We shall cause those who disbelieve to taste an awful\n\t\t\tdoom, and verily We shall requite them the worst of what they\n\t\t\tused to do.
That is the reward of Allah's enemies: the Fire. Therein is their\n\t\t\timmortal home; payment forasmuch as they denied Our revelations.
And those who disbelieve will say: Our Lord! Show us these who\n\t\t\tbeguiled us of the jinn and humankind. We will place them\n\t\t\tunderneath our feet that they may be among the nethermost.
Lo! those who say: Our Lord is Allah, and afterward are upright,\n\t\t\tthe angels descend upon them, saying: Fear not nor grieve, but\n\t\t\tbear good tidings of the paradise which ye are promised.
We are your protecting friends in the life of the world and in\n\t\t\tthe Hereafter. There ye will have (all) that your souls desire,\n\t\t\tand there ye will have (all) for which ye pray.
A gift of welcome from the Forgiving, the Merciful.
And who is better in speech than him who prayeth unto his Lord\n\t\t\tand doeth right, and saith: Lo! I am of those who surrender (unto\n\t\t\tHim).

The good deed and the evil deed are not alike. Repel the evil\n\t\t\tdeed with one which is better, then lo! he, between whom and thee\n\t\t\tthere was enmity (will become) as though he was a bosom friend.
But none is granted it save those who are steadfast, and none is\n\t\t\tgranted it save the owner of great happiness.
And if a whisper from the devil reach thee (O Muhammad) then seek\n\t\t\trefuge in Allah. Lo! He is the Hearer, the Knower.
And of His portents are the night and the day and the sun and the\n\t\t\tmoon. Adore not the sun nor the moon; but adore Allah Who created\n\t\t\tthem, if it is in truth Him whom ye worship.
But if they are too proud still those who are with thy Lord\n\t\t\tglorify Him night and day, and tire not.

And of His portents (is this): that thou seest the earth lowly,
			but when We send down water thereon it thrilleth and groweth. Lo!
			He who quickeneth it is verily the Quickener of the dead. Lo! He
			is Able to do all things.

Lo! those who distort Our revelations are not hid from Us. Is he
			who is hurled into the Fire better, or he who cometh secure on
			the Day of Resurrection? Do what ye will. Lo! He is Seer of what
			ye do.
Lo! those who disbelieve in the Reminder when it cometh unto them\n\t\t\t(are guilty), for lo! it is an unassailable Scripture.
Falsehood cannot come at it from before it or behind it. (It is)\n\t\t\ta revelation from the Wise, the Owner of Praise.
Naught is said unto thee (Muhammad) save what was said unto the\n\t\t\tmessengers before thee. Lo! thy Lord is owner of forgiveness, and\n\t\t\towner (also) of dire punishment.

And if We had appointed it a Lecture in a foreign tongue they
			would assuredly have said: If only its verses were expounded (so
			that we might understand)? What! A foreign tongue and an Arab?
			Say unto them (O Muhammad): For those who believe it is a
			guidance and a healing; and as for those who disbelieve, there is
			a deafness in their ears, and it is blindness for them. Such are
			called to from afar.

And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, but there hath been
			dispute concerning it; and but for a Word that had already gone
			forth from thy Lord, it would ere now have been judged between
			them; but lo! they are in hopeless doubt concerning it.
Whoso doeth right it is for his soul, and whoso doeth wrong it is\n\t\t\tagainst it. And thy Lord is not at all a tyrant to His slaves.

Unto Him is referred (all) knowledge of the Hour. And no fruits
			burst forth from their sheaths, and no female carrieth or
			bringeth forth but with His knowledge. And on the day when He
			calleth unto them: Where are now My partners? they will say: We
			confess unto Thee, not one of us is a witness (for them).
And those to whom they used to cry of old have failed them, and\n\t\t\tthey perceive they have no place of refuge.
Man tireth not of praying for good, and if all toucheth him, then\n\t\t\the is disheartened, desperate.

And verily, if We cause him to taste mercy after some hurt that
			hath touched him, he will say: This is my own; and I deem not
			that the Hour will ever rise, and if I am brought back to my
			Lord, I surely shall be better off with Him--But We verily shall
			tell those who disbelieve (all) that they did, and We verily
			shall make them taste hard punishment.
When We show favor unto man, he withdraweth and turneth aside,\n\t\t\tbut when ill toucheth him then he aboundeth in prayer.
Bethink you: If it is from Allah and ye reject it--Who is further\n\t\t\tastray than one who is at open feud (with Allah)?

We shall show them Our portents on the horizons and within
			themselves until it will be manifest unto them that it is the
			Truth. Doth not thy Lord suffice, since He is Witness over all
			things?
How! Are they still in doubt about the meeting with their Lord?\n\t\t\tLo! Is not He surrounding all things?
Ha. Mim.
Ain. Sin. Qaf.
Thus Allah the Mighty, the Knower inspireth thee (Muhammad) as\n\t\t\t(He inspired) those before thee.
Unto Him belongeth all that is in the heavens and all that is in\n\t\t\tthe earth, and He is the Sublime, the Tremendous.
Almost might the heavens above be rent asunder while the angels\n\t\t\thymn the praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on\n\t\t\tthe earth. Lo! Allah is the Forgiver, the Merciful.
And as for those who choose protecting friends beside Him, Allah\n\t\t\tis Warden over them, and thou art in no wise a guardian over\n\t\t\tthem.

And thus we have inspired in thee a Lecture in Arabic, that thou
			mayest warn the mother town and those around it, and mayest warn
			of a day of assembling whereof there is no doubt. A host will be
			in the Garden, and a host of them in the Flame.
Had Allah willed, He could have made them one community, but\n\t\t\tAllah bringeth whom He will into His mercy. And the wrong-doers\n\t\t\thave no friend nor helper.
Or have they chosen protecting friends besides Him? But Allah, He\n\t\t\t(alone) is the Protecting Friend. He quickeneth the dead, and He\n\t\t\tis Able to do all things.
And in whatsoever ye differ, the verdict therein belongeth to\n\t\t\tAllah. Such is my Lord, in Whom I put my trust, and unto Whom I\n\t\t\tturn.

The Creator of the heavens and the earth. He hath made for you
			pairs of yourselves, and of the cattle also pairs, whereby He
			multiplieth you. Naught is as His likeness; and He is the Hearer,
			the Seer.
His are the keys of the heavens and the earth. He enlargeth\n\t\t\tprovidence for whom He will and straiteneth (it for whom He\n\t\t\twill). Lo! He is Knower of all things.

He hath ordained for you that religion which He commended unto
			Noah, and that which We inspire in thee (Muhammad), and that
			which We commended unto Abraham and Moses and Jesus, saying:
			Establish the religion, and be not divided therein. Dreadful for
			the idolaters is that unto which thou callest them. Allah
			chooseth for Himself whom He will, and guideth unto Himself him
			who turneth (toward Him).

And they were not divided until after the knowledge came unto
			them, through rivalry among themselves; and had it not been for a
			Word that had already gone forth from thy Lord for an appointed
			term, it surely had been judged between them. And those who were
			made to inherit the Scripture after them are verily in hopeless
			doubt concerning it.

Unto this, then, summon (O Muhammad). And be thou upright as thou
			art commanded, and follow not their lusts, but say: I believe in
			whatever Scripture Allah hath sent down, and I am commanded to be
			just among you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. Unto us our
			works and unto you your works; no argument between us and you.
			Allah will bring us together, and unto Him is the journeying.
And those who argue concerning Allah after He hath been\n\t\t\tacknowledged, their argument hath no weight with their Lord, and\n\t\t\twrath is upon them and theirs will be an awful doom.
Allah it is who hath revealed the Scripture with truth, and the\n\t\t\tBalance. How canst thou know? It may be that the Hour is nigh.

Those who believe not therein seek to hasten it, while those who\n\t\t\tbelieve are fearful of it and know that it is the Truth. Are not\n\t\t\tthey who dispute, in doubt concerning the Hour, far astray?
Allah is gracious unto His slaves. He provideth for whom He will.\n\t\t\tAnd He is the Strong, the Mighty.

Whoso desireth the harvest of the Hereafter, We give him increase\n\t\t\tin its harvest. And Whoso desireth the harvest of the world, We\n\t\t\tgive him thereof, and he hath no portion in the Hereafter.

Or have they partners (of Allah) who have made lawful for them in
			religion that which Allah allowed not? And but for a decisive
			word (gone forth already), it would have been judged between
			them. Lo! for wrong-doers is a painful doom.

Thou seest the wrong-doers fearful of that which they have
			earned, and it will surely befall them; while those who believe
			and do good works (will be) in flowering meadows of the Gardens,
			having what they wish from their Lord. This is the great
			preferment.

This it is which Allah announceth unto His bondmen who believe
			and do good works. Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I ask of you
			no fee therefor, save loving kindness among kinsfolk. And whoso
			scoreth a good deed we add unto its good for him. Lo! Allah is
			Forgiving, Responsive.

Or say they: He hath invented a lie concerning Allah? If Allah
			willed, He could have sealed thy heart (against them). And Allah
			will wipe out the lie and will vindicate the truth by His words.
			Lo! He is aware of what is hidden in the breasts (of men).
And He it is Who accepteth repentance from his bondmen, and\n\t\t\tpardoneth the evil deeds, and knoweth what ye do.
And accepteth those who do good works, and giveth increase unto\n\t\t\tthem of His bounty. And as for disbelievers, theirs will be an\n\t\t\tawful doom.
And if Allah were to enlarge the provision for His slaves they\n\t\t\twould surely rebel in the earth, but He sendeth down by measure\n\t\t\tas He willeth. Lo! He is Informed, a Seer of His bondmen.
And He it is Who sendeth down the saving rain after they have\n\t\t\tdespaired, and spreadeth out His mercy. He is the Protecting\n\t\t\tFriend, the Praiseworthy.
And of His portents is the creation of the heaven and the earth,\n\t\t\tand of whatever beasts He hath dispersed therein. And He is Able\n\t\t\tto gather them when He will.
Whatever of misfortune striketh you, it is what your right hands\n\t\t\thave earned. And He forgiveth much.
Ye cannot escape in the earth, for beside Allah ye have no\n\t\t\tprotecting friend nor any helper.
And of His portents are the ships, like banners on the sea;
If He will He calmeth the wind so that they keep still upon its\n\t\t\tsurface Lo! herein verily are signs for every steadfast grateful\n\t\t\t(heart).
Or he causeth them to perish on account of that which they have\n\t\t\tearned And He forgiveth much--
And that those who argue concerning Our revelations may know they\n\t\t\thave no refuge.

Now whatever ye have been given is but a passing comfort for the\n\t\t\tlife of the world, and that which Allah hath is better and more\n\t\t\tlasting for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.
And those who shun the worst of sins and indecencies and, when\n\t\t\tthey are wroth, forgive,
And those who answer the call of their Lord and establish\n\t\t\tworship, and whose affairs are a matter of counsel, and who spend\n\t\t\tof what We have bestowed on them,
And those who, when great wrong is done to them, defend\n\t\t\tthemselves,
The guerdon of an ill deed is an ill the like thereof. But\n\t\t\twhosoever pardoneth and amendeth, his wage is the affair of\n\t\t\tAllah. Lo! He loveth not wrong doers.
And whoso defendeth himself after he hath suffered wrong for\n\t\t\tsuch, there is no way (of blame) against them.
The way (of blame) is only against those who oppress mankind, and\n\t\t\twrongfully rebel in the earth. For such there is a painful doom.
And verily whoso is patient and forgiveth, lo! that, verily, is\n\t\t\t(of) the steadfast heart of things.

He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no protecting
			friend after Him. And thou (Muhammad) wilt see the evil doers
			when they see the doom, (how) they say: Is there any way of
			return?

And thou wilt see them exposed to (the Fire), made humble by
			disgrace, and looking with veiled eyes. And those who believe
			will say: Lo! the (eternal) losers are they who lose themselves
			and their housefolk on the Day of Resurrection. Lo! are not the
			wrong-doers in perpetual torment?
And they will have no protecting friends to help them instead of\n\t\t\tAllah. He whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no road.
Answer the call of your Lord before there cometh unto you from\n\t\t\tAllah a Day which there is no averting. Ye have no refuge on that\n\t\t\tDay, nor have ye any (power of) refusal.

But if they are averse, We have not sent thee as a warder over
			them. Thine is only to convey (the message). And lo! when We
			cause man to taste of mercy from Us he exulteth therefor. And if
			some evil striketh them because of that which their own hands
			have sent before, then lo! man is an ingrate.

Unto Allah belongeth the sovereignty of the heavens and the
			earth. He createth what He will. He bestoweth female (offspring)
			upon whom He will, and bestoweth male (offspring) upon whom He
			will;
Or He mingleth them, males and females, and He maketh barren whom\n\t\t\tHe will. Lo! He is Knower, Powerful.

And it was not (vouchsafed) to any mortal that Allah should speak
			to him unless (it be) by revelation or from behind a veil, or
			(that) He sendeth a messenger to reveal what He will by His
			leave. Lo! He is Exalted, Wise.

And thus have We inspired in thee (Muhammad) a Spirit of Our
			command. Thou knewest not what the Scripture was, nor what the
			Faith. But We have made it a light whereby We guide whom We will
			of Our bondmen. And lo! thou verily dost guide unto a right path.
The path of Allah, unto Whom belongeth whatsoever is in the\n\t\t\theavens and whatsoever is in the earth. Do not all things reach\n\t\t\tAllah at last?
Ha. Mim.
By the Scripture which maketh plain,
Lo! We have appointed it a Lecture in Arabic that haply ye may\n\t\t\tunderstand.
And lo! in the Source of Decrees, which We possess, it is indeed\n\t\t\tsublime, decisive,
Shall We utterly ignore you because ye are a wanton folk?
How many a Prophet did We send among the men of old!
And never came there unto them a Prophet but they used to mock\n\t\t\thim.
Then we destroyed men mightier than these in prowess; and the\n\t\t\texample of the men of old hath gone (before them).
And if thou (Muhammad) ask them: Who created the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth, they will surely answer: The Mighty, the Knower created\n\t\t\tthem;
Who made the earth a resting place for you, and placed roads for\n\t\t\tyou therein, that haply ye may find your way;
And who sendeth down water from the sky in (due) measure, and We\n\t\t\trevive a dead land therewith. Even so will ye be brought forth;
He who created all the pairs, and appointed for you ships and\n\t\t\tcattle whereupon ye ride.

That ye may mount upon their backs, and may remember your Lord's
			favor when ye mount thereon, and may say: Glorified be He Who
			hath subdued these unto us, and we were not capable (of subduing
			them);
And lo! unto our Lord we are returning.
And they allot to Him a portion of His bondmen! Lo! man is verily\n\t\t\ta mere ingrate.
Or chooseth He daughters of all that He hath created, and\n\t\t\thonoureth He you with sons?
And if one of them hath tidings of that which he likeneth to the\n\t\t\tBeneficent One, his countenance becometh black and he is full of\n\t\t\tinward rage.
(Liken they then to Allah) that which is bred up in outward show,\n\t\t\tand in dispute cannot make itself plain?
And they make the angels, who are the slaves of the Beneficent,\n\t\t\tfemales. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be\n\t\t\trecorded and they will be questioned.
And they say: If the Beneficent One had (so) willed, we should\n\t\t\tnot have worshipped them. They have no knowledge whatsoever of\n\t\t\tthat. They do but guess.
Or have We given them any Scripture before (this Qur'an) so that\n\t\t\tthey are holding fast thereto?
Nay, for they say only: Lo! we found our fathers following a\n\t\t\treligion, and we are guided by their footprints.

And even so We sent not a warner before thee (Muhammad) into any\n\t\t\ttownship but its luxurious ones said: Lo! we found our fathers\n\t\t\tfollowing a religion, and we are following their footprints.
(And the warner) said: What! Even though I bring you better\n\t\t\tguidance than that ye found your fathers following? They\n\t\t\tanswered: Lo! in what ye bring we are disbelievers.
So We requited them. Then see the nature of the consequence for\n\t\t\tthe rejecters!
And when Abraham said unto his father and his folk: Lo! I am\n\t\t\tinnocent of what ye worship
Save Him Who did create me, for He will surely guide me.
And he made It a word enduring among his seed, that haply they\n\t\t\tmight return.
Nay, but I let these and their fathers enjoy life (only) till\n\t\t\tthere should come unto them the Truth and a messenger making\n\t\t\tplain.
And now that the Truth hath come unto them they say: This is mere\n\t\t\tmagic, and lo! we are disbelievers therein.
And they say: If only this Qur'an had been revealed to some great\n\t\t\tman of the two towns?

Is it they who apportion their Lord's mercy? We have apportioned
			among them their livelihood in the life of the world, and raised
			some of them above others in rank that some of them may take
			labor from others; and the mercy of thy Lord is better than (the
			wealth) that they amass.

And were it not that mankind would have become one community, We
			might well have appointed, for those who disbelieve in the
			Beneficent, roofs of silver for their houses and stairs (of
			silver) whereby to mount,
And for their houses doors (of silver) and couches of silver\n\t\t\twhereon to recline,
And ornaments of gold. Yet all that would have been but a\n\t\t\tprovision of the life of the world. And the Hereafter with your\n\t\t\tLord would have been for those who keep from evil.
And he whose sight is dim to the remembrance of the Beneficent,\n\t\t\tWe assign unto him a devil who becometh his comrade;
And lo! they surely turn them from the way of Allah, and yet they\n\t\t\tdeem that they are rightly guided;
Till, when he cometh unto Us, he saith (unto his comrade): Ah,\n\t\t\twould that between me and thee there were the distance of the two\n\t\t\thorizons--an evil comrade!
And it profiteth you not this day, because ye did wrong, that ye\n\t\t\twill be sharers in the doom.
Canst thou (Muhammad) make the deaf to hear, or canst thou guide\n\t\t\tthe blind or him who is in error manifest?
And if We take thee away, We surely shall take vengeance on them;
Or (if) We show thee that wherewith We threaten them; for lo! We\n\t\t\thave complete command of them.
So hold thou fast to that which is inspired in thee. Lo! thou art\n\t\t\ton a right path.
And lo! it is in truth a Reminder for thee and for thy folk; and\n\t\t\tye will be questioned.
And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before thee: Did We\n\t\t\tever appoint gods to be worshipped beside the Beneficent?
And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations unto Pharaoh and\n\t\t\this chiefs, and he said: I am a messenger of the Lord of the\n\t\t\tWorlds.
But when he brought them Our tokens, behold! they laughed at\n\t\t\tthem.
And every token that We showed them was greater than its sister\n\t\t\t(token), and we grasped them with the torment, that haply they\n\t\t\tmight turn again.
And they said: O wizard; Entreat thy Lord for us by the pact that\n\t\t\tHe hath made with thee. Lo! we verily will walk aright.
But when We eased them of the torment, behold! they broke their\n\t\t\tword.
And Pharaoh caused a proclamation to be made among his people\n\t\t\tsaying: O my people! Is not mine the sovereignty of Egypt and\n\t\t\tthese rivers flowing under me? Can ye not then discern?
I am surely better than this fellow, who is despicable, and can\n\t\t\thardly make (his meaning) plain!
Why, then, have armlets of gold not been set upon him, or angels\n\t\t\tsent along with him?
Thus he persuaded his people to make light (of Moses), and they\n\t\t\tobeyed him. Lo! they were a wanton folk.
So, when they angered Us, We punished them and drowned them every\n\t\t\tone.
And We made them a thing past, and an example for those after\n\t\t\t(them).
And when the son of Mary is quoted as an example, behold! the\n\t\t\tfolk laugh out,
And say: Are our gods better, or is he? They raise not the\n\t\t\tobjection save for argument. Nay! but they are a contentious\n\t\t\tfolk.
He is nothing but a slave on whom We bestowed favor, and We made\n\t\t\thim a pattern for the Children of Israel.
And had We willed We could have set among you angels to be\n\t\t\tviceroys in the earth.
And lo! verily there is knowledge of the Hour. So doubt ye not\n\t\t\tconcerning it, but follow Me. This is the right path.
And let not Satan turn you aside. Lo! he is an open enemy for\n\t\t\tyou.

When Jesus came with clear proofs (of Allah's sovereignty), he
			said: I have come unto you with wisdom, and to make plain some of
			that concerning which ye differ. So keep your duty to Allah, and
			obey me.
Lo! Allah, He is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is a\n\t\t\tright path.
But the factions among them differed. Then woe unto those who do\n\t\t\twrong from the doom of a painful day.
Await they aught save the Hour, that it shall come upon them\n\t\t\tsuddenly, when they know not?
Friends on that day will be foes one to another, save those who\n\t\t\tkept their duty (to Allah).
O My slaves! For you there is no fear this day, nor is it ye who\n\t\t\tgrieve;
(Ye) who believed Our revelations and were self-surrendered,
Enter the Garden, ye and your wives, to be made glad.
Therein are brought round for them trays of gold and goblets, and\n\t\t\ttherein is all that souls desire and eyes find sweet. And ye are\n\t\t\timmortal therein.
This is the Garden which ye are made to inherit because of what\n\t\t\tye used to do.
Therein for you is fruit in plenty whence to eat.
Lo! the guilty are immortal in hell's torment.
It is not relaxed for them, and they despair therein.
We wronged them not, but they it was who did the wrong.
And they cry: O master! Let thy Lord make an end of us. He saith:\n\t\t\tLo! here ye must remain.
We verily brought the Truth unto you, but ye were, most of you,\n\t\t\taverse to the Truth.
Or do they determine any thing (against the Prophet)? Lo! We\n\t\t\t(also) are determining.
Or deem they that We cannot hear their secret thoughts and\n\t\t\tprivate confidences? Nay, but Our envoys, present with them, do\n\t\t\trecord.
Say (O Muhammad): The Beneficent One hath no son. I am first\n\t\t\tamong the worshippers.
Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of\n\t\t\tthe Throne, from that which they ascribe (unto Him)!
So let them flounder (in their talk) and play until they meet the\n\t\t\tDay which they are promised.
And He it is Who in the heaven is God, and in the earth God. He\n\t\t\tis the Wise, the knower.

And blessed be He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the\n\t\t\theavens and the earth and all that is between them, and with Whom\n\t\t\tis knowledge of the Hour, and unto Whom ye will be returned.
And those unto whom they cry instead of Him possess no power of\n\t\t\tintercession, saving him who beareth witness unto the Truth\n\t\t\tknowingly.
And if thou ask them who created them, they will surely say:\n\t\t\tAllah. How then are they turned away?
And he saith: O my Lord! Lo! those are a folk who believe not.
Then bear with them (O Muhammad) and say: Peace. But they will\n\t\t\tcome to know.
Ha. Mim.
By the Scripture that maketh plain
Lo! We revealed it on a blessed night.--Lo! We are ever\n\t\t\twarning.--
Whereupon every wise command is made clear
As a command from Our presence.--Lo! We are ever sending--
